original: Ṛgveda
analyzed: ṛgveda
translated: Ṛg Veda

original: tvam agne dyubhis tvam āśuśukṣaṇis tvam adbhyas tvam aśmanas pari /
analyzed: tvam agne dyubhiḥ tvam āśuśukṣaṇiḥ tvam adbhyaḥ tvam aśmanaḥ pari
translated: You, O Agni, by the lights, you, O Agni, by the flames, you by the waters, you by the stone,

original: tvaṃ vanebhyas tvam oṣadhībhyas tvaṃ nṛṇāṃ nṛpate jāyase śuciḥ //
analyzed: tvam vanebhyaḥ tvam oṣadhībhyaḥ tvam nṛṇām nṛpate jāyase śuciḥ
translated: You by the woods, you by the plants, you, O lord of men, are born pure.

original: tavāgne hotraṃ tava potram ṛtviyaṃ tava neṣṭraṃ tvam agnid ṛtāyataḥ /
analyzed: tava agne hotram tava potram ṛtviyam tava neṣṭram tvam agnidh ṛta āyataḥ
translated: Yours, O Agni, is the office of Hotar, yours the office of Potr at the proper time, yours the office of Neṣṭṛ, you are the Agnīdh, you are the Praśāstr,

original: tava praśāstraṃ tvam adhvarīyasi brahmā cāsi gṛhapatiś ca no dame //
analyzed: tava praśāstram tvam adhvarīyasi brahmā ca asi gṛhapatiḥ ca naḥ dame
translated: You officiate as Adhvaryu, and you are our Brahman and lord of the house in our house.

original: tvam agna indro vṛṣabhaḥ satām asi tvaṃ viṣṇur urugāyo namasyaḥ /
analyzed: tvam agne indraḥ vṛṣabhaḥ satām asi tvam viṣṇuḥ uru gāyaḥ namasyaḥ
translated: You, O Agni, are Indra, the bull of the good, you are Viṣṇu, the far-striding, to be worshipped.

original: tvam brahmā rayivid brahmaṇas pate tvaṃ vidhartaḥ sacase purandhyā //
analyzed: tvam brahmā rayi vid brahmaṇas pate tvam vidhartar sacase purandhyā
translated: You are Brahmā, the finder of wealth, O lord of prayer, you, the supporter, attend with your highest thought.

original: tvam agne rājā varuṇo dhṛtavratas tvam mitro bhavasi dasma īḍyaḥ /
analyzed: tvam agne rājā varuṇaḥ dhṛta vrataḥ tvam mitraḥ bhavasi dasmaḥ īḍyaḥ
translated: You, O Agni, are king Varuṇa, of firm vow, you become the wondrous one to be praised by Mitra.

original: tvam aryamā satpatir yasya sambhujaṃ tvam aṃśo vidathe deva bhājayuḥ //
analyzed: tvam aryamā satpatiḥ yasya sambhujam tvam aṃśaḥ vidathe deva bhājayuḥ
translated: You are Aryaman, the lord of the good, whose share you are, you are Aṃśa, O god, to be shared in the assembly.

original: tvam agne tvaṣṭā vidhate suvīryaṃ tava gnāvo mitramahaḥ sajātyam /
analyzed: tvam agne tvaṣṭā vidhate su vīryam tava gnāvaḥ mitra mahas sajātyam
translated: You, O Agni, are Tvaṣṭar, for the one who spreads out, the hero, in your flames, the greatness of Mitra, the kinship.

original: tvam āśuhemā rariṣe svaśvyaṃ tvaṃ narāṃ śardho asi purūvasuḥ //
analyzed: tvam āśu hemā rariṣe su aśvyam tvam narām śardhaḥ asi purūvasuḥ
translated: You, O swift-hoofed one, give the good horse, you are the host of men, rich in many treasures.

original: tvam agne rudro asuro maho divas tvaṃ śardho mārutam pṛkṣa īśiṣe /
analyzed: tvam agne rudraḥ asuraḥ mahaḥ divaḥ tvam śardhaḥ mārutam pṛkṣaḥ īśiṣe
translated: Thou, O Agni, art Rudra, the Asura of the great sky; thou art the Marut host, O thou that art to be worshipped.

original: tvaṃ vātair aruṇair yāsi śaṅgayas tvam pūṣā vidhataḥ pāsi nu tmanā //
analyzed: tvam vātaiḥ aruṇaiḥ yāsi śaṅgayaḥ tvam pūṣā vidhataḥ pāsi nu tmanā
translated: With the red winds thou goest forth to battle; thou art Pûshan, O thou that art to be worshipped, thou guardest the worshipper by thyself.

original: tvam agne draviṇodā araṅkṛte tvaṃ devaḥ savitā ratnadhā asi /
analyzed: tvam agne draviṇaḥ dāḥ araṅkṛte tvam devaḥ savitā ratna dhāḥ asi
translated: Thou, O Agni, art the giver of wealth to the worshipper; thou, O God, art Savitar, the bestower of treasure.

original: tvam bhago nṛpate vasva īśiṣe tvam pāyur dame yas te 'vidhat //
analyzed: tvam bhagaḥ nṛpate vasvaḥ īśiṣe tvam pāyuḥ dame yaḥ te vidhat
translated: Thou, O Bhaga, art the Lord of treasures as a King; thou art the guardian in the house who hath served thee.

original: tvām agne dama ā viśpatiṃ viśas tvāṃ rājānaṃ suvidatram ṛñjate /
analyzed: tvām agne dame ā viśpatim viśaḥ tvām rājānam suvidatram ṛñjate
translated: Thee, O Agni, as a lord of the people in the house, they honour, thee, O God, the bountiful King.

original: tvaṃ viśvāni svanīka patyase tvaṃ sahasrāṇi śatā daśa prati //
analyzed: tvam viśvāni su anīka patyase tvam sahasrāṇi śatā daśa prati
translated: Thou art the Lord of all things, O thou of fair aspect; thou of a thousand, a hundred, ten (gifts).

original: tvām agne pitaram iṣṭibhir naras tvām bhrātrāya śamyā tanūrucam /
analyzed: tvām agne pitaram iṣṭibhiḥ naraḥ tvām bhrātrāya śamyā tanūrucam
translated: Thee, O Agni, men (honour) as a father with oblations; thee, O God, with the dart of the brother for the ruddy form.

original: tvam putro bhavasi yas te 'vidhat tvaṃ sakhā suśevaḥ pāsy ādhṛṣaḥ //
analyzed: tvam putraḥ bhavasi yaḥ te vidhat tvam sakhā su śevaḥ pāsi ādhṛṣaḥ
translated: Thou art a son to him who hath served thee; thou art a friend, a good friend, to be entreated, not to be overcome.

original: tvam agna ṛbhur āke namasyas tvaṃ vājasya kṣumato rāya īśiṣe /
analyzed: tvam agne ṛbhuḥ āke namasyaḥ tvam vājasya kṣumataḥ rāyaḥ īśiṣe
translated: Thou, O Agni, art the R̥ibhu to be worshipped; thou art the Lord of strength, of wealth that is to be desired.

original: tvaṃ vi bhāsy anu dakṣi dāvane tvaṃ viśikṣur asi yajñam ātaniḥ //
analyzed: tvam vi bhāsi anu dakṣi dāvane tvam viśikṣuḥ asi yajñam ātaniḥ
translated: Thou shinest forth to give the gift of wealth; thou, O God, hast stretched out the sacrifice to be performed.

original: tvam agne aditir deva dāśuṣe tvaṃ hotrā bhāratī vardhase girā /
analyzed: tvam agne aditiḥ deva dāśuṣe tvam hotrā bhāratī vardhase girā
translated: Thou, O Agni, art Aditi to the worshipper, thou, O God, as Hotr, as Bharati, art magnified by song.

original: tvam iḷā śatahimāsi dakṣase tvaṃ vṛtrahā vasupate sarasvatī //
analyzed: tvam iḷā śata himā asi dakṣase tvam vṛtra hā vasu pate sarasvatī
translated: Thou art Iḷā, thou art Dakṣa, a hundred winters old; thou art Vṛtra-slayer, Lord of treasure, Sarasvatī.

original: tvam agne subhṛta uttamaṃ vayas tava spārhe varṇa ā saṃdṛśi śriyaḥ /
analyzed: tvam agne su bhṛtaḥ uttamam vayaḥ tava spārhe varṇe ā saṃdṛśi śriyaḥ
translated: O Agni, well-worshipped, thou art the best life-power; in thy lovely form are the glories of the looker-on.

original: tvaṃ vājaḥ prataraṇo bṛhann asi tvaṃ rayir bahulo viśvatas pṛthuḥ //
analyzed: tvam vājaḥ prataraṇaḥ bṛhan asi tvam rayiḥ bahulaḥ viśvatas pṛthuḥ
translated: Thou art the mighty Vāja, the conqueror; thou art the wide, the all-pervading wealth.

original: tvām agna ādityāsa āsyaṃ tvāṃ jihvāṃ śucayaś cakrire kave /
analyzed: tvām agne ādityāsaḥ āsyam tvām jihvām śucayaḥ cakrire kave
translated: O Agni, the Âdityas have made thee their mouth, and the pure ones, O wise one, have made thee their tongue.

original: tvāṃ rātiṣāco adhvareṣu saścire tve devā havir adanty āhutam //
analyzed: tvām rātiṣācaḥ adhvareṣu saścire tve devāḥ haviḥ adanti āhutam
translated: The worshippers have looked for thee at the sacrifices; in thee the Gods eat the offered oblation.

original: tve agne viśve amṛtāso adruha āsā devā havir adanty āhutam /
analyzed: tve agne viśve amṛtāsaḥ adruhaḥ āsā devāḥ haviḥ adanti āhutam
translated: In thee, O Agni, all the immortal Gods, free from guile, eat the offered oblation.

original: tvayā martāsaḥ svadanta āsutiṃ tvaṃ garbho vīrudhāṃ jajñiṣe śuciḥ //
analyzed: tvayā martāsaḥ svadante āsutim tvam garbhaḥ vīrudhām jajñiṣe śuciḥ
translated: Through thee, O mortal men, enjoy the draught that gladdens; thou, pure, art born as the germ of the plants.

original: tvaṃ tān saṃ ca prati cāsi majmanāgne sujāta pra ca deva ricyase /
analyzed: tvam tān sam ca prati ca asi majmanā agne su jāta pra ca deva ricyase
translated: Thou, O Agni, art he who unites and separates these (people), O God, well-born, thou art enriched with gifts.

original: pṛkṣo yad atra mahinā vi te bhuvad anu dyāvāpṛthivī rodasī ubhe //
analyzed: pṛkṣaḥ yat atra mahinā vi te bhuvat anu dyāvāpṛthivī rodasī ubhe
translated: When the great food is here, then thou art spread out after the two world-halves, heaven and earth, O thou who art between the two world-halves.

original: ye stotṛbhyo goagrām aśvapeśasam agne rātim upasṛjanti sūrayaḥ /
analyzed: ye stotṛbhyaḥ go agrām aśva peśasam agne rātim upasṛjanti sūrayaḥ
translated: The princes who bestow on those who praise them gifts of cattle, horses, and the choicest food,

original: asmāñ ca tāṃś ca pra hi neṣi vasya ā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: asmām ca tān ca pra hi neṣi vasyaḥ ā bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: Lead us and them to what is better. May we speak lofty words in the assembly, with brave sons.

original: yajñena vardhata jātavedasam agniṃ yajadhvaṃ haviṣā tanā girā /
analyzed: yajñena vardhata jātavedasam agnim yajadhvam haviṣā tanā girā
translated: With sacrifice increase the all-knowing Agni; worship him with oblation, with a song.

original: samidhānaṃ suprayasaṃ svarṇaraṃ dyukṣaṃ hotāraṃ vṛjaneṣu dhūrṣadam //
analyzed: samidhānam su prayasam svarṇaram dyukṣam hotāram vṛjaneṣu dhūrṣadam
translated: The well-kindled, well-disposed, golden-hued, celestial Hotar, who stirs the people in the assemblies.

original: abhi tvā naktīr uṣaso vavāśire 'gne vatsaṃ na svasareṣu dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: abhi tvā naktīḥ uṣasaḥ vavāśire gne vatsam na svasareṣu dhenavaḥ
translated: The nights and the dawns have looked on thee, O Agni, as the cows on the calf among their own sisters.

original: diva ived aratir mānuṣā yugā kṣapo bhāsi puruvāra saṃyataḥ //
analyzed: divaḥ iva id aratiḥ mānuṣā yugā kṣapaḥ bhāsi puru vāra saṃyataḥ
translated: Like the all-supporting sky, O thou of much wealth, thou shinest in the dwellings of men, well-guarded.

original: taṃ devā budhne rajasaḥ sudaṃsasaṃ divaspṛthivyor aratiṃ ny erire /
analyzed: tam devāḥ budhne rajasaḥ su daṃsasam divaspṛthivyoḥ aratim ni erire
translated: The gods have placed in the bottom of the realm of air that most delightful one, the messenger of heaven and earth.

original: ratham iva vedyaṃ śukraśociṣam agnim mitraṃ na kṣitiṣu praśaṃsyam //
analyzed: ratham iva vedyam śukra śociṣam agnim mitram na kṣitiṣu praśaṃsyam
translated: Like a known chariot, shining with bright splendour, Agni, to be praised among men like a friend.

original: tam ukṣamāṇaṃ rajasi sva ā dame candram iva surucaṃ hvāra ā dadhuḥ /
analyzed: tam ukṣamāṇam rajasi sve ā dame candram iva su rucam hvāre ā dadhuḥ
translated: In his own abode, in the realm, they have placed him, the pouring one, like the moon, of great beauty, in the trough.

original: pṛśnyāḥ pataraṃ citayantam akṣabhiḥ pātho na pāyuṃ janasī ubhe anu //
analyzed: pṛśnyāḥ pataram citayantam akṣabhiḥ pāthaḥ na pāyum janasī ubhe anu
translated: The swift one, the son of Prisni, whom they urge on with the reins, the protector, they have made to go along the two worlds, as on a path.

original: sa hotā viśvam pari bhūtv adhvaraṃ tam u havyair manuṣa ṛñjate girā /
analyzed: sa hotā viśvam pari bhūtu adhvaram tam u havyaiḥ manuṣe ṛñjate girā
translated: He, the priest, pervading all the sacrifice, is served by men with offerings and with song.

original: hiriśipro vṛdhasānāsu jarbhurad dyaur na stṛbhiś citayad rodasī anu //
analyzed: hiri śipraḥ vṛdhasānāsu jarbhurat dyauḥ na stṛbhiḥ citayat rodasī anu
translated: The tawny-backed one shines in the growing dawns, like heaven with the stars, through the two worlds.

original: sa no revat samidhānaḥ svastaye saṃdadasvān rayim asmāsu dīdihi /
analyzed: sa naḥ revat samidhānaḥ svastaye saṃdadasvān rayim asmāsu dīdihi
translated: Be thou well-kindled for our prosperity; grant us wealth, shine upon us.

original: ā naḥ kṛṇuṣva suvitāya rodasī agne havyā manuṣo deva vītaye //
analyzed: ā naḥ kṛṇuṣva suvitāya rodasī agne havyā manuṣaḥ deva vītaye
translated: Make the two worlds easy for us to traverse, O Agni, for the offering of man, O god, for the feast.

original: dā no agne bṛhato dāḥ sahasriṇo duro na vājaṃ śrutyā apā vṛdhi /🔽prācī dyāvāpṛthivī brahmaṇā kṛdhi svar ṇa śukram uṣaso vi didyutaḥ //
analyzed: dāḥ naḥ agne bṛhataḥ dāḥ sahasriṇaḥ duraḥ na vājam śrutyai apa ā vṛdhi  prācī dyāvāpṛthivī brahmaṇā kṛdhi svar na śukram uṣasaḥ vi didyutaḥ
translated: Give us, O Agni, great, thousandfold gifts; increase, as by the cry of battle, our wealth.🔽Make the eastern heaven and earth ready with prayer; shine forth, O bright dawn, with thy ruddy light.

original: sa idhāna uṣaso rāmyā anu svar ṇa dīded aruṣeṇa bhānunā /🔽hotrābhir agnir manuṣaḥ svadhvaro rājā viśām atithiś cārur āyave //
analyzed: saḥ idhānaḥ uṣasaḥ rāmyāḥ anu svar na dīdet aruṣeṇa bhānunā  hotrābhiḥ agniḥ manuṣaḥ su adhvaraḥ rājā viśām atithiḥ cāruḥ āyave
translated: He, kindled, follows the lovely dawns, shining with his ruddy light in the sky.🔽Agni, by the oblations of men, by the holy rites, is king of the people, a guest dear to the young man.

original: evā no agne amṛteṣu pūrvya dhīṣ pīpāya bṛhaddiveṣu mānuṣā /
analyzed: eva naḥ agne amṛteṣu pūrvya dhīḥ pīpāya bṛhaddiveṣu mānuṣā
translated: So, O Agni, most ancient among the immortals, let thy thought come to us, to the great days of men.

original: duhānā dhenur vṛjaneṣu kārave tmanā śatinam pururūpam iṣaṇi //
analyzed: duhānā dhenuḥ vṛjaneṣu kārave tmanā śatinam puru rūpam iṣaṇi
translated: The milch-cow, yielding a hundredfold, in the rites, for the singer, herself, in many a form, to be desired.

original: vayam agne arvatā vā suvīryam brahmaṇā vā citayemā janāṃ ati /
analyzed: vayam agne arvatā vā su vīryam brahmaṇā vā citayema janān ati
translated: We, O Agni, by our chariot or by our prayer, would win the people for ourselves and for our good heroes.

original: asmākaṃ dyumnam adhi pañca kṛṣṭiṣūccā svar ṇa śuśucīta duṣṭaram //🔽sa no bodhi sahasya praśaṃsyo yasmin sujātā iṣayanta sūrayaḥ /🔽yam agne yajñam upayanti vājino nitye toke dīdivāṃsaṃ sve dame //
analyzed: asmākam dyumnam adhi pañca kṛṣṭiṣu uccā svar na śuśucīta duṣṭaram  sa naḥ bodhi sahasya praśaṃsyaḥ yasmin sujātāḥ iṣayanta sūrayaḥ  yam agne yajñam upayanti vājinaḥ nitye toke dīdivāṃsam sve dame
translated: Let our glory shine forth, most excellent among the five peoples, bright and resplendent heaven.🔽Be thou, O Agni, our protector, to be praised by the foe, in whom well-born heroes rejoice,🔽In whom, O Agni, the strong ones rejoice, the shining one in his own abode, in the eternal birth, in the sacrifice.

original: ubhayāso jātavedaḥ syāma te stotāro agne sūrayaś ca śarmaṇi /
analyzed: ubhayāsaḥ jātavedaḥ syāma te stotāraḥ agne sūrayaḥ ca śarmaṇi
translated: O all-knower, may we be on both sides of thee, O Agni, the praisers and the nobles in the shelter.

original: vasvo rāyaḥ puruścandrasya bhūyasaḥ prajāvataḥ svapatyasya śagdhi naḥ //
analyzed: vasvaḥ rāyaḥ puru ścandrasya bhūyasaḥ prajāvataḥ su apatyasya śagdhi naḥ
translated: Help us to the wealth of riches, very desirable, abundant, of offspring, of our own, to be desired.

original: ye stotṛbhyo goagrām aśvapeśasam agne rātim upasṛjanti sūrayaḥ /
analyzed: ye stotṛbhyaḥ go agrām aśva peśasam agne rātim upasṛjanti sūrayaḥ
translated: Those nobles who bestow upon the praisers, O Agni, a gift consisting of cattle and horses,

original: asmāñ ca tāṃś ca pra hi neṣi vasya ā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: asmām ca tān ca pra hi neṣi vasyaḥ ā bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: Lead us and them to what is better. May we speak lofty words in the assembly, with good heroes.

original: samiddho agnir nihitaḥ pṛthivyām pratyaṅ viśvāni bhuvanāny asthāt /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agniḥ nihitaḥ pṛthivyām pratyaṅ viśvāni bhuvanāni asthāt
translated: Agni is kindled, set on the earth, he hath stood facing all the worlds.

original: hotā pāvakaḥ pradivaḥ sumedhā devo devān yajatv agnir arhan //
analyzed: hotā pāvakaḥ pradivaḥ sumedhāḥ devaḥ devān yajatu agniḥ arhan
translated: The priest, the purifier, the high-minded one, the god, the worthy one, may Agni worship the gods.

original: narāśaṃsaḥ prati dhāmāny añjan tisro divaḥ prati mahnā svarciḥ /
analyzed: narāśaṃsaḥ prati dhāmāni añjan tisraḥ divaḥ prati mahnā su arciḥ
translated: Narâṣansa, anointing the abodes, with his threefold light from heaven through greatness,

original: ghṛtapruṣā manasā havyam undan mūrdhan yajñasya sam anaktu devān //
analyzed: ghṛta pruṣā manasā havyam undan mūrdhan yajñasya sam anaktu devān
translated: With mind distilling the oblation, dropping with ghee, let him besprinkle the heads of the gods at the beginning of the sacrifice.

original: īḷito agne manasā no arhan devān yakṣi mānuṣāt pūrvo adya /
analyzed: īḍitaḥ agne manasā naḥ arhan devān yakṣi mānuṣāt pūrvaḥ adya
translated: Honoured by our mind, O Agni, worthy of worship, worship the gods this day before the men.

original: sa ā vaha marutāṃ śardho acyutam indraṃ naro barhiṣadaṃ yajadhvam //
analyzed: saḥ ā vaha marutām śardhaḥ acyutam indram naraḥ barhiṣadam yajadhvam
translated: Bring hither the Marut host, the imperishable, Indra, whom the men seated on the grass must worship.

original: deva barhir vardhamānaṃ suvīraṃ stīrṇaṃ rāye subharaṃ vedy asyām /
analyzed: deva barhiḥ vardhamānam su vīram stīrṇam rāye subharam vedi asyām
translated: O divine sacrificial grass, increasing, rich in brave men, spread out for wealth, well-filled, to be known in this (world),

original: ghṛtenāktaṃ vasavaḥ sīdatedaṃ viśve devā ādityā yajñiyāsaḥ //
analyzed: ghṛtena aktam vasavaḥ sīdata idam viśve devāḥ ādityāḥ yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: Anointed with ghee, let the Vasus, all the gods, the Ādityas worthy of sacrifice, sit on this (grass).

original: vi śrayantām urviyā hūyamānā dvāro devīḥ suprāyaṇā namobhiḥ /🔽vyacasvatīr vi prathantām ajuryā varṇam punānā yaśasaṃ suvīram //
analyzed: vi śrayantām urviyā hūyamānāḥ dvāraḥ devīḥ su prāyaṇāḥ namobhiḥ  vyacasvatīḥ vi prathantām ajuryāḥ varṇam punānāḥ yaśasam su vīram
translated: May the doors, to be worshipped with reverence, wide, well-opening, divine, be opened apart.🔽May they, of wide extent, be spread out, undecaying, purifying the glorious form, rich in brave men.

original: sādhv apāṃsi sanatā na ukṣite uṣāsānaktā vayyeva raṇvite /
analyzed: sādhu apāṃsi sanatā naḥ ukṣite uṣāsānaktā vayyā iva raṇvite
translated: The good deeds of the ancient ones are not destroyed, Dawn and Night, as if they were young and tender.

original: tantuṃ tataṃ saṃvayantī samīcī yajñasya peśaḥ sudughe payasvatī //
analyzed: tantum tatam saṃvayantī samīcī yajñasya peśaḥ sudughe payasvatī
translated: Weaving the woven thread, in accord, the form of sacrifice, O well-milking one, rich in milk.

original: daivyā hotārā prathamā viduṣṭara ṛju yakṣataḥ sam ṛcā vapuṣṭarā /
analyzed: daivyā hotārā prathamā viduṣṭarau ṛju yakṣataḥ sam ṛcā vapuṣṭarā
translated: The two divine Hotars, most skilled in the beginning, upright in worship, most beautiful with the Rg verses,

original: devān yajantāv ṛtuthā sam añjato nābhā pṛthivyā adhi sānuṣu triṣu //
analyzed: devān yajantau ṛtuthā sam añjataḥ nābhā pṛthivyāḥ adhi sānuṣu triṣu
translated: worshipping the gods, anointing in due season, on the three heights of the navel of the earth.

original: sarasvatī sādhayantī dhiyaṃ na iḷā devī bhāratī viśvatūrtiḥ /
analyzed: sarasvatī sādhayantī dhiyam naḥ iḷā devī bhāratī viśvatūrtiḥ
translated: Sarasvatī, accomplishing the thought, the goddess Ilā, Bhāratī, all-powerful,

original: tisro devīḥ svadhayā barhir edam acchidram pāntu śaraṇaṃ niṣadya //
analyzed: tisraḥ devīḥ svadhayā barhiḥ ā idam acchidram pāntu śaraṇam niṣadya
translated: may the three goddesses, by their own nature, protect this flawless shelter, sitting down.

original: piśaṅgarūpaḥ subharo vayodhāḥ śruṣṭī vīro jāyate devakāmaḥ /
analyzed: piśaṅga rūpaḥ subharaḥ vayodhāḥ śruṣṭī vīraḥ jāyate deva kāmaḥ
translated: The tawny-hued one, well-nourished, supporting life, the hero is born, desired by the gods, through hearing.

original: prajāṃ tvaṣṭā vi ṣyatu nābhim asme athā devānām apy etu pāthaḥ //
analyzed: prajām tvaṣṭā vi syatu nābhim asme athā devānām api etu pāthaḥ
translated: May Tvaṣṭṛ spread offspring in our navel, then may he go to the abode of the gods.

original: vanaspatir avasṛjann upa sthād agnir haviḥ sūdayāti pra dhībhiḥ /
analyzed: vanaspatiḥ avasṛjan upa sthāt agniḥ haviḥ sūdayāti pra dhībhiḥ
translated: The tree, letting go from the root, Agni, by his thoughts, makes the oblation ready.

original: tridhā samaktaṃ nayatu prajānan devebhyo daivyaḥ śamitopa havyam //
analyzed: tridhā samaktam nayatu prajānan devebhyaḥ daivyaḥ śamitā upa havyam
translated: May he, the divine, appointed by the gods, knowing, lead the threefold-anointed oblation to the gods.

original: ghṛtam mimikṣe ghṛtam asya yonir ghṛte śrito ghṛtam v asya dhāma /
analyzed: ghṛtam mimikṣe ghṛtam asya yoniḥ ghṛte śritaḥ ghṛtam u asya dhāma
translated: Ghee is mixed with ghee, ghee is its birthplace, ghee is laid in ghee, ghee is its abode.

original: anuṣvadham ā vaha mādayasva svāhākṛtaṃ vṛṣabha vakṣi havyam //
analyzed: anuṣvadham ā vaha mādayasva svāhākṛtam vṛṣabha vakṣi havyam
translated: Bring it along the path, make it rejoice, O bull, carry the oblation offered with svāhā.

original: huve vaḥ sudyotmānaṃ suvṛktiṃ viśām agnim atithiṃ suprayasam /
analyzed: huve vaḥ sudyotmānam suvṛktim viśām agnim atithim su prayasam
translated: I invoke for you the well-shining, well-praised Agni, the guest of the people, who is very bountiful.

original: mitra iva yo didhiṣāyyo bhūd deva ādeve jane jātavedāḥ //
analyzed: mitraḥ iva yaḥ didhiṣāyyaḥ bhūt devaḥ ādeve jane jātavedāḥ
translated: He who is to be desired like a friend, the god among the godless people, the all-knowing one.

original: imaṃ vidhanto apāṃ sadhasthe dvitādadhur bhṛgavo vikṣv āyoḥ /
analyzed: imam vidhantaḥ apām sadhasthe dvitā adadhuḥ bhṛgavaḥ vikṣu āyoḥ
translated: This one, the Bhrgus, having fashioned him in the abode of the waters, have established him in the two worlds of man.

original: eṣa viśvāny abhy astu bhūmā devānām agnir aratir jīrāśvaḥ //
analyzed: eṣa viśvāni abhī astu bhūmā devānām agniḥ aratiḥ jīra aśvaḥ
translated: May this Agni be superior to all things, the messenger of the gods, with swift horses.

original: agniṃ devāso mānuṣīṣu vikṣu priyaṃ dhuḥ kṣeṣyanto na mitram /
analyzed: agnim devāsaḥ mānuṣīṣu vikṣu priyam dhuḥ kṣeṣyantaḥ na mitram
translated: The gods have placed Agni among human people, dear as a friend, when they were about to settle.

original: sa dīdayad uśatīr ūrmyā ā dakṣāyyo yo dāsvate dama ā //
analyzed: sa dīdayat uśatīḥ ūrmyāḥ ā dakṣāyyaḥ yaḥ dāsvate dame ā
translated: He shines with his lovely rays, with his waves, desirable for strength, when he is to give, in the house.

original: asya raṇvā svasyeva puṣṭiḥ saṃdṛṣṭir asya hiyānasya dakṣoḥ /
analyzed: asya raṇvā svasya iva puṣṭiḥ saṃdṛṣṭiḥ asya hiyānasya dakṣoḥ
translated: His radiance is like that of his own prosperity. His appearance is that of a strong and active one.

original: vi yo bharibhrad oṣadhīṣu jihvām atyo na rathyo dodhavīti vārān //🔽ā yan me abhvaṃ vanadaḥ panantośigbhyo nāmimīta varṇam /
analyzed: vi yaḥ bharibhrat oṣadhīṣu jihvām atyaḥ na rathyaḥ dodhavīti vārān  ā yat me abhvam vanadaḥ pananta uśigbhyaḥ na āmimīta varṇam
translated: He who bears his tongue over the plants, he rushes through the waters like a harnessed horse.🔽When the wood-cutter, rejoicing, has cut down my terror, he has measured out the name for the young ones.

original: sa citreṇa cikite raṃsu bhāsā jujurvāṃ yo muhur ā yuvā bhūt //
analyzed: sa citreṇa cikite raṃsu bhāsā jujurvām yaḥ muhur ā yuvā bhūt
translated: He shines with his variegated, lovely light, the one who is to be praised, who is young again and again.

original: ā yo vanā tātṛṣāṇo na bhāti vār ṇa pathā rathyeva svānīt /
analyzed: ā yaḥ vanā tātṛṣāṇaḥ na bhāti vār na pathā rathyā iva svānīt
translated: He who shines, thirsting for the woods, like water, has come quickly, like a chariot on its own path.

original: kṛṣṇādhvā tapū raṇvaś ciketa dyaur iva smayamāno nabhobhiḥ //
analyzed: kṛṣṇa adhvā tapūḥ raṇvaḥ ciketa dyauḥ iva smayamānaḥ nabhobhiḥ
translated: The dark path, the pure, and the lovely one has thought, like the smiling heaven with the clouds.

original: sa yo vy asthād abhi dakṣad urvīm paśur naiti svayur agopāḥ /
analyzed: sa yaḥ vi asthāt abhi dakṣat urvīm paśuḥ na eti svayuḥ agopāḥ
translated: He who has stood apart, desiring the spacious earth, goes like an animal with its own herdsman.

original: agniḥ śociṣmāṃ atasāny uṣṇan kṛṣṇavyathir asvadayan na bhūma //
analyzed: agniḥ śociṣmān atasāni uṣṇan kṛṣṇa vyathiḥ asvadayat na bhūma
translated: Agni, the radiant one, warming the dry places, the dark expanse, has made the earth sweet.

original: nū te pūrvasyāvaso adhītau tṛtīye vidathe manma śaṃsi /
analyzed: nu te pūrvasya avasaḥ adhītau tṛtīye vidathe manma śaṃsi
translated: Now in the third gathering of your former favor, I will utter a hymn in the third gathering.

original: asme agne saṃyadvīram bṛhantaṃ kṣumantaṃ vājaṃ svapatyaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ //
analyzed: asme agne saṃyat vīram bṛhantam kṣumantam vājam su apatyam rayim dāḥ
translated: O Agni, give us wealth with heroes, vast, powerful, victorious, and self-sufficient.

original: tvayā yathā gṛtsamadāso agne guhā vanvanta uparāṃ abhi ṣyuḥ /
analyzed: tvayā yathā gṛtsamadāsaḥ agne guhā vanvantaḥ uparām abhi syuḥ
translated: Just as the sons of Gritsamada, O Agni, found the hidden one through you, the youngest,

original: suvīrāso abhimātiṣāhaḥ smat sūribhyo gṛṇate tad vayo dhāḥ //
analyzed: su vīrāsaḥ abhimātiṣāhaḥ smat sūribhyaḥ gṛṇate tat vayaḥ dhāḥ
translated: Bestowing good heroes, conquering the enemies, grant that to our princes, to the singer, that strength.

original: hotājaniṣṭa cetanaḥ pitā pitṛbhya ūtaye /
analyzed: hotā ajaniṣṭa cetanaḥ pitā pitṛbhyaḥ ūtaye
translated: The Hotar was born, the wise one, the father, for the help of the fathers.

original: prayakṣañ jenyaṃ vasu śakema vājino yamam //
analyzed: prayakṣam jenyam vasu śakema vājinaḥ yamam
translated: May we be able to win the visible, the noble, the treasure, the powerful Yama.

original: ā yasmin sapta raśmayas tatā yajñasya netari /
analyzed: ā yasmin sapta raśmayaḥ tatāḥ yajñasya netari
translated: In whom the seven rays are spread out, the leader of the sacrifice,

original: manuṣvad daivyam aṣṭamam potā viśvaṃ tad invati //
analyzed: manuṣvat daivyam aṣṭamam potā viśvam tat invati
translated: The divine eighth, like Manu's, the purifier impels all that.

original: dadhanve vā yad īm anu vocad brahmāṇi ver u tat /
analyzed: dadhanve vā yat īm anu vocat brahmāṇi veḥ u tat
translated: If he were to praise you after that, or utter Brahmanic hymns, that would be wrong.

original: pari viśvāni kāvyā nemiś cakram ivābhavat //
analyzed: pari viśvāni kāvyā nemiḥ cakram iva abhavat
translated: It hath encompassed all the thoughts, as 'twere the felly of a wheel.

original: sākaṃ hi śucinā śuciḥ praśāstā kratunājani /🔽vidvāṃ asya vratā dhruvā vayā ivānu rohate //
analyzed: sākam hi śucinā śuciḥ praśāstā kratunā ajani  vidvān asya vratā dhruvā vayāḥ iva anu rohate
translated: For he, the pure with pure, the lord, hath been born with the sacrifice.🔽The wise one follows, as 'twere a bird, the firm decrees of him.

original: tā asya varṇam āyuvo neṣṭuḥ sacanta dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ asya varṇam āyuvaḥ neṣṭuḥ sacanta dhenavaḥ
translated: His milch-kine, young in years, attend his form, the milch-kine of the Priest.

original: kuvit tisṛbhya ā varaṃ svasāro yā idaṃ yayuḥ //
analyzed: kuvid tisṛbhyaḥ ā varam svasāraḥ yāḥ idam yayuḥ
translated: Are they not better than the three sisters who have come to this?

original: yadī mātur upa svasā ghṛtam bharanty asthita /
analyzed: yadī mātuḥ upa svasā ghṛtam bharantī asthita
translated: When, as his Mother's sister, they bring oil and settle down beside him,

original: tāsām adhvaryur āgatau yavo vṛṣṭīva modate //
analyzed: tāsām adhvaryuḥ āgatau yavaḥ vṛṣṭī iva modate
translated: The Adhvaryu comes to them: the barley rejoices as in rain.

original: svaḥ svāya dhāyase kṛṇutām ṛtvig ṛtvijam /
analyzed: svaḥ svāya dhāyase kṛṇutām ṛtvij ṛtvijam
translated: Make ye the Priest for him who hath a home, for him who hath a home make ye the Priest.

original: stomaṃ yajñaṃ cād araṃ vanemā rarimā vayam //
analyzed: stomam yajñam ca āt aram vanema rarimā vayam
translated: Make ye the hymn and sacrifice easy of access: we will serve and honour them.

original: yathā vidvāṃ araṃ karad viśvebhyo yajatebhyaḥ /
analyzed: yathā vidvān aram karat viśvebhyaḥ yajatebhyaḥ
translated: As one who knows makes easy of access this sacrifice for all the priests,

original: ayam agne tve api yaṃ yajñaṃ cakṛmā vayam //
analyzed: ayam agne tve api yam yajñam cakṛma vayam
translated: This sacrifice, O Agni, have we made for thee.

original: imām me agne samidham imām upasadaṃ vaneḥ /
analyzed: imām me agne samidham imām upasadam vaneḥ
translated: This my oblation, Agni, this my attendance do thou accept.

original: imā u ṣu śrudhī giraḥ //
analyzed: imāḥ u su śrudhi giraḥ
translated: Hear thou these songs of mine.

original: ayā te agne vidhemorjo napād aśvamiṣṭe /
analyzed: ayā te agne vidhema ūrjaḥ napāt aśvamiṣṭe
translated: O Agni, we would serve thee, thee, the foot of strength, the best of sacrificers,

original: enā sūktena sujāta //🔽taṃ tvā gīrbhir girvaṇasaṃ draviṇasyuṃ draviṇodaḥ /
analyzed: enā sūktena sujāta  tam tvā gīrbhiḥ girvaṇasam draviṇasyum draviṇaḥ daḥ
translated: With this hymn, O thou of happy birth.

original: saparyema saparyavaḥ //
analyzed: saparyema saparyavaḥ
translated: Thee, O lover of song, who hast much wealth, who givest wealth, we would serve with this our service,🔽With this our hymn, O thou of happy birth.

original: sa bodhi sūrir maghavā vasupate vasudāvan /
analyzed: sa bodhi sūriḥ maghavā vasu pate vasu dāvan
translated: He, the wise, the bountiful, the wealthy, the lord of wealth, the giver of wealth,

original: yuyodhy asmad dveṣāṃsi //
analyzed: yuyodhi asmat dveṣāṃsi
translated: May he drive away our enemies.

original: sa no vṛṣṭiṃ divas pari sa no vājam anarvāṇam /🔽sa naḥ sahasriṇīr iṣaḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ vṛṣṭim divaḥ pari sa naḥ vājam anarvāṇam  sa naḥ sahasriṇīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: May he send us rain from heaven, may he send us strength that is not to be taken away,🔽May he send us food in abundance.

original: īḷānāyāvasyave yaviṣṭha dūta no girā /
analyzed: īḍānāya avasyave yaviṣṭha dūta naḥ girā
translated: To the one who is invoked, the active one, O youngest messenger, with our song,

original: yajiṣṭha hotar ā gahi //
analyzed: yajiṣṭha hotar ā gahi
translated: O best sacrificer, O Hotar, come hither.

original: antar hy agna īyase vidvāñ janmobhayā kave /🔽dūto janyeva mitryaḥ //
analyzed: antar hi agne īyase vidvām janma ubhayā kave  dūtaḥ janyā iva mitryaḥ
translated: For, O Agni, you move between, knowing both races, O wise one,🔽As a friendly messenger to the people.

original: sa vidvāṃ ā ca piprayo yakṣi cikitva ānuṣak /
analyzed: sa vidvān ā ca piprayaḥ yakṣi cikitvaḥ ānuṣak
translated: You, O wise one, who are to be invoked, serve and attend to the one who knows,

original: ā cāsmin satsi barhiṣi //
analyzed: ā ca asmin satsi barhiṣi
translated: And sit down on this sacrificial grass.

original: śreṣṭhaṃ yaviṣṭha bhāratāgne dyumantam ā bhara /
analyzed: śreṣṭham yaviṣṭha bhārata agne dyumantam ā bhara
translated: O youngest Agni, bring us the most excellent, the glorious wealth,

original: vaso puruspṛhaṃ rayim //
analyzed: vaso puruspṛham rayim
translated: O Vasu, the wealth that is desired by many.

original: mā no arātir īśata devasya martyasya ca /
analyzed: mā naḥ arātiḥ īśata devasya martyasya ca
translated: Let not hostility prevail over us, whether of a god or a mortal.

original: parṣi tasyā uta dviṣaḥ //🔽viśvā uta tvayā vayaṃ dhārā udanyā iva /🔽ati gāhemahi dviṣaḥ //
analyzed: parṣi tasyāḥ uta dviṣaḥ  viśvāḥ uta tvayā vayam dhārāḥ udanyāḥ iva  ati gāhemahi dviṣaḥ
translated: You deliver us from that and from the haters.🔽And all of us, through you,🔽May we pass over the haters, like streams over a dam.

original: śuciḥ pāvaka vandyo 'gne bṛhad vi rocase /🔽tvaṃ ghṛtebhir āhutaḥ //
analyzed: śuciḥ pāvaka vandyaḥ gne bṛhat vi rocase  tvam ghṛtebhiḥ āhutaḥ
translated: O pure, purifying, venerable Agni, you shine forth greatly,🔽You who are offered with ghee.

original: tvaṃ no asi bhāratāgne vaśābhir ukṣabhiḥ /
analyzed: tvam naḥ asi bhārata agne vaśābhiḥ ukṣabhiḥ
translated: You are ours, O Agni, O Bharata, with barren cows and bulls,

original: aṣṭāpadībhir āhutaḥ //
analyzed: aṣṭāpadībhiḥ āhutaḥ
translated: Offered with eight-footed (cows).

original: drvannaḥ sarpirāsutiḥ pratno hotā vareṇyaḥ /
analyzed: dru annaḥ sarpiḥ āsutiḥ pratnaḥ hotā vareṇyaḥ
translated: The guest who eats food, urged on by ghee, the ancient priest, the excellent one,

original: sahasas putro adbhutaḥ //
analyzed: sahasaḥ putraḥ adbhutaḥ
translated: The son of strength, the wondrous one.

original: vājayann iva nū rathān yogāṃ agner upa stuhi /
analyzed: vājayan iva nu rathān yogān agneḥ upa stuhi
translated: As if delighting in the chariots, O Agni, praise the yokes,

original: yaśastamasya mīḷhuṣaḥ //🔽yaḥ sunītho dadāśuṣe 'juryo jarayann arim /
analyzed: yaśastamasya mīḷhuṣaḥ  yaḥ su nīthaḥ dadāśuṣe juryaḥ jarayan arim
translated: Of the most glorious one who bestows.

original: cārupratīka āhutaḥ //
analyzed: cāru pratīkaḥ āhutaḥ
translated: He who is well-disposed, who gives to the worshipper, who, not decaying, destroys the enemy,🔽The one with a beautiful appearance, who is offered.

original: ya u śriyā dameṣv ā doṣoṣasi praśasyate /
analyzed: yaḥ u śriyā dameṣu ā doṣā uṣasi praśasyate
translated: He who, by his glory, is praised in the dwellings, at dawn and in the evening,

original: yasya vrataṃ na mīyate //
analyzed: yasya vratam na mīyate
translated: Whose vow is not violated.

original: ā yaḥ svar ṇa bhānunā citro vibhāty arciṣā /
analyzed: ā yaḥ svar na bhānunā citraḥ vibhāti arciṣā
translated: He who shines with his own light, with his radiant splendor, with his variegated flame,

original: añjāno ajarair abhi //
analyzed: añjānaḥ ajaraiḥ abhi
translated: Anointed with the undecaying ones.

original: atrim anu svarājyam agnim ukthāni vāvṛdhuḥ /
analyzed: atrim anu sva rājyam agnim ukthāni vāvṛdhuḥ
translated: Atri's own kingdom, Agni, the praises have increased,

original: viśvā adhi śriyo dadhe //🔽agner indrasya somasya devānām ūtibhir vayam /
analyzed: viśvāḥ adhi śriyaḥ dadhe  agneḥ indrasya somasya devānām ūtibhiḥ vayam
translated: He has placed all the glories.🔽By the help of Agni, Indra, Soma, and the gods,

original: ariṣyantaḥ sacemahy abhi ṣyāma pṛtanyataḥ //
analyzed: a riṣyantaḥ sacemahi abhi syāma pṛtanyataḥ
translated: We, being desirous, shall conquer those who hate us, and the enemies.

original: ni hotā hotṛṣadane vidānas tveṣo dīdivāṃ asadat sudakṣaḥ /
analyzed: ni hotā hotṛṣadane vidānaḥ tveṣaḥ dīdivān asadat su dakṣaḥ
translated: The Hotar, the guest, has sat down in the Hotar's seat, the radiant one, the shining one, the very skillful one,

original: adabdhavratapramatir vasiṣṭhaḥ sahasrambharaḥ śucijihvo agniḥ //
analyzed: adabdha vrata pramatiḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ sahasrambharaḥ śuci jihvaḥ agniḥ
translated: The one with unviolated vows, the wise one, the best, Agni, the bearer of a thousand, the one with a pure tongue.

original: tvaṃ dūtas tvam u naḥ paraspās tvaṃ vasya ā vṛṣabha praṇetā /
analyzed: tvam dūtaḥ tvam u naḥ paraspāḥ tvam vasyaḥ ā vṛṣabha praṇetā
translated: You are the messenger, you are our protector, O bull, you are the leader to what is good.

original: agne tokasya nas tane tanūnām aprayucchan dīdyad bodhi gopāḥ //
analyzed: agne tokasya naḥ tane tanūnām aprayucchan dīdyat bodhi gopāḥ
translated: Agni, be thou a watchful guardian, shining, of our offspring and of our bodies.

original: vidhema te parame janmann agne vidhema stomair avare sadhasthe /
analyzed: vidhema te parame janman agne vidhema stomaiḥ avare sadhasthe
translated: We will worship thee in the highest birth, O Agni, we will worship with praises in the lowest abode.

original: yasmād yoner udārithā yaje tam pra tve havīṃṣi juhure samiddhe //
analyzed: yasmāt yoneḥ udāritha yaje tam pra tve havīṃṣi juhure samiddhe
translated: From whatever womb thou hast come forth to sacrifice, to thee are offered oblations when thou art enkindled.

original: agne yajasva haviṣā yajīyāñ chruṣṭī deṣṇam abhi gṛṇīhi rādhaḥ /
analyzed: agne yajasva haviṣā yajīyān śruṣṭī deṣṇam abhi gṛṇīhi rādhaḥ
translated: O Agni, sacrifice with the most acceptable offering; accept the gift to be offered, the bounty.

original: tvaṃ hy asi rayipatī rayīṇāṃ tvaṃ śukrasya vacaso manotā //
analyzed: tvam hi asi rayi patiḥ rayīṇām tvam śukrasya vacasaḥ manotā
translated: For thou art the lord of riches, of all riches; thou art the invoker of the bright speech.

original: ubhayaṃ te na kṣīyate vasavyaṃ divedive jāyamānasya dasma /
analyzed: ubhayam te na kṣīyate vasavyam dive dive jāyamānasya dasma
translated: Both thy treasures are inexhaustible, O wondrous one, as thou art born day by day.

original: kṛdhi kṣumantaṃ jaritāram agne kṛdhi patiṃ svapatyasya rāyaḥ //
analyzed: kṛdhi kṣumantam jaritāram agne kṛdhi patim su apatyasya rāyaḥ
translated: Make the singer rich in food, O Agni; make him the lord of wealth that is his own.

original: sainānīkena suvidatro asme yaṣṭā devāṃ āyajiṣṭhaḥ svasti /
analyzed: sainānīkena suvidatraḥ asme yaṣṭā devān āyajiṣṭhaḥ svasti
translated: With the army, O very bountiful one, be thou our sacrificer, best at sacrificing, for prosperity.

original: adabdho gopā uta naḥ paraspā agne dyumad uta revad didīhi //
analyzed: adabdhaḥ gopāḥ uta naḥ paraspāḥ agne dyumat uta revat didīhi
translated: Be thou our protector, O Agni, and our guardian from behind; shine thou bright and glorious.

original: johūtro agniḥ prathamaḥ piteveḷas pade manuṣā yat samiddhaḥ /
analyzed: johūtraḥ agniḥ prathamaḥ pitā iva iḍaḥ pade manuṣā yat samiddhaḥ
translated: Agni, the invocator, the first, like a father, when enkindled in the house of men,

original: śriyaṃ vasāno amṛto vicetā marmṛjenyaḥ śravasyaḥ sa vājī //
analyzed: śriyam vasānaḥ amṛtaḥ vicetāḥ marmṛjenyaḥ śravasyaḥ sa vājī
translated: Wearing glory, immortal, of far-reaching mind, to be praised, to be glorified, is that strong one.

original: śrūyā agniś citrabhānur havam me viśvābhir gīrbhir amṛto vicetāḥ /
analyzed: śrūyāḥ agniḥ citrabhānuḥ havam me viśvābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ amṛtaḥ vicetāḥ
translated: May Agni, the bearer of wondrous light, the immortal, the all-knowing one, listen to my call with all his songs.

original: śyāvā rathaṃ vahato rohitā votāruṣāha cakre vibhṛtraḥ //
analyzed: śyāvā ratham vahataḥ rohitā cakre vibhṛtraḥ
translated: The dark ones draw his chariot, the ruddy ones his yoke-horses, the strong one has made his seat.

original: uttānāyām ajanayan suṣūtam bhuvad agniḥ purupeśāsu garbhaḥ /
analyzed: uttānāyām ajanayan suṣūtam bhuvat agniḥ puru peśāsu garbhaḥ
translated: They have generated the well-lying one in the outstretched (earth), Agni, the embryo in the wombs of many people.

original: śiriṇāyāṃ cid aktunā mahobhir aparīvṛto vasati pracetāḥ //🔽jigharmy agniṃ haviṣā ghṛtena pratikṣiyantam bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: śiriṇāyām cit aktunā mahobhiḥ aparīvṛtaḥ vasati pracetāḥ  jigharmi agnim haviṣā ghṛtena pratikṣiyantam bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: Even in the shining one, the all-encompassing one, the wise one dwells, not to be encompassed by the great ones.🔽I warm Agni with oblation and ghee, the one who repels all beings.

original: pṛthuṃ tiraścā vayasā bṛhantaṃ vyaciṣṭham annai rabhasaṃ dṛśānam //
analyzed: pṛthum tiraścā vayasā bṛhantam vyaciṣṭham annaiḥ rabhasam dṛśānam
translated: Broad, wide, and vast in his body, most expansive, the one to be seen with food, the strong one.

original: ā viśvataḥ pratyañcaṃ jigharmy arakṣasā manasā taj juṣeta /
analyzed: ā viśvatas pratyañcam jigharmi arakṣasā manasā tat juṣeta
translated: I warm him from all sides, from the front, with a mind free from evil; may he approve of that.

original: maryaśrī spṛhayadvarṇo agnir nābhimṛśe tanvā jarbhurāṇaḥ //
analyzed: marya śrī spṛhayat varṇaḥ agniḥ na abhimṛśe tanvā jarbhurāṇaḥ
translated: Agni, of youthful beauty, of desirable appearance, should not be touched with the body, the eager one.

original: jñeyā bhāgaṃ sahasāno vareṇa tvādūtāso manuvad vadema /
analyzed: jñeyāḥ bhāgam sahasānaḥ vareṇa tvādūtāsaḥ manu vat vadema
translated: The one to be known, the victorious one, we, with envoys like Manu, should speak with a boon.

original: anūnam agniṃ juhvā vacasyā madhupṛcaṃ dhanasā johavīmi //
analyzed: anūnam agnim juhvā vacasyā madhu pṛcam dhana sāḥ johavīmi
translated: I, the strong one, call with my tongue, with speech, the unobstructed Agni, the one with honeyed praise.

original: śrudhī havam indra mā riṣaṇyaḥ syāma te dāvane vasūnām /
analyzed: śrudhi havam indra mā riṣaṇyaḥ syāma te dāvane vasūnām
translated: Listen to the call, O Indra, be not niggardly; may we be yours for the bestowal of treasures.

original: imā hi tvām ūrjo vardhayanti vasūyavaḥ sindhavo na kṣarantaḥ //
analyzed: imāḥ hi tvām ūrjaḥ vardhayanti vasūyavaḥ sindhavaḥ na kṣarantaḥ
translated: For these, seeking wealth, increase thee with their strength, like rivers flowing on.

original: sṛjo mahīr indra yā apinvaḥ pariṣṭhitā ahinā śūra pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: sṛjaḥ mahīḥ indra yāḥ apinvaḥ pariṣṭhitāḥ ahinā śūra pūrvīḥ
translated: The great regions which thou hast filled, O Indra, many which thou hast encompassed with the serpent,

original: amartyaṃ cid dāsam manyamānam avābhinad ukthair vāvṛdhānaḥ //
analyzed: amartyam cit dāsam manyamānam avābhinat ukthaiḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ
translated: Thou hast overcome with hymns, waxing strong, the Dâsa who esteemed himself immortal.

original: uktheṣv in nu śūra yeṣu cākan stomeṣv indra rudriyeṣu ca /
analyzed: uktheṣu id nu śūra yeṣu cākan stomeṣu indra rudriyeṣu ca
translated: In the hymns, O hero, in which thou hast rejoiced, in the lauds, O Indra, in the Rudri hymns,

original: tubhyed etā yāsu mandasānaḥ pra vāyave sisrate na śubhrāḥ //🔽śubhraṃ nu te śuṣmaṃ vardhayantaḥ śubhraṃ vajram bāhvor dadhānāḥ /
analyzed: tubhya id etāḥ yāsu mandasānaḥ pra vāyave sisrate na śubhrāḥ  śubhram nu te śuṣmam vardhayantaḥ śubhram vajram bāhvoḥ dadhānāḥ
translated: To thee, O Vâyu, these, in which thou hast delighted, flow forth, bright, like the rays of the sun.🔽Exalting thy bright strength, O Indra, placing in thy arms thy bright bolt,

original: śubhras tvam indra vāvṛdhāno asme dāsīr viśaḥ sūryeṇa sahyāḥ //
analyzed: śubhraḥ tvam indra vāvṛdhānaḥ asme dāsīḥ viśaḥ sūryeṇa sahyāḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, waxing great, hast with the sun overcome the Dâsa tribes that were to be overcome.

original: guhā hitaṃ guhyaṃ gūḷham apsv apīvṛtam māyinaṃ kṣiyantam /
analyzed: guhā hitam guhyam gūḍham apsu apīvṛtam māyinam kṣiyantam
translated: The hidden, the secret, the concealed in the waters, the hidden, the all-encompassing, the guileful, the lying,

original: uto apo dyāṃ tastabhvāṃsam ahann ahiṃ śūra vīryeṇa //
analyzed: uta u apaḥ dyām tastabhvāṃsam ahan ahim śūra vīryeṇa
translated: And the sky, the firm-set, O hero, thou hast slain with thy manly strength, the dragon.

original: stavā nu ta indra pūrvyā mahāny uta stavāma nūtanā kṛtāni /
analyzed: stavā nu te indra pūrvyā mahāni uta stavāma nūtanā kṛtāni
translated: Now will we praise thy former great achievements, and now we will praise the new ones, O Indra.

original: stavā vajram bāhvor uśantaṃ stavā harī sūryasya ketū //
analyzed: stavā vajram bāhvoḥ uśantam stavā harī sūryasya ketū
translated: We will praise the bolt that is eager in thy arms, we will praise thy two bays, the ensigns of Sûrya.

original: harī nu ta indra vājayantā ghṛtaścutaṃ svāram asvārṣṭām /
analyzed: harī nu te indra vājayantā ghṛtaścutam svāram asvārṣṭām
translated: O Indra, the two bay steeds, making thee strong, have brought thee to the ghee-sprinkled oblation.

original: vi samanā bhūmir aprathiṣṭāraṃsta parvataś cit sariṣyan //
analyzed: vi samanā bhūmiḥ aprathiṣṭa araṃsta parvataḥ cit sariṣyan
translated: The earth hath spread out with its joints, and the mountain hath rejoiced, as if it would move.

original: ni parvataḥ sādy aprayucchan sam mātṛbhir vāvaśāno akrān /🔽dūre pāre vāṇīṃ vardhayanta indreṣitāṃ dhamanim paprathan ni //🔽indro mahāṃ sindhum āśayānam māyāvinaṃ vṛtram asphuran niḥ /
analyzed: ni parvataḥ sādi aprayucchan sam mātṛbhiḥ vāvaśānaḥ akrān  dūre pāre vāṇīm vardhayantaḥ indra iṣitām dhamanim paprathat ni  indraḥ mahām sindhum āśayānam māyāvinam vṛtram asphurat niḥ
translated: The mountain, not to be shaken, hath sat down; he hath grown, rejoicing with his mothers.🔽They have extended the voice, the artery sent forth by Indra, strengthening it on the other side.🔽Indra hath burst the deceitful Vrtra, the great dragon lying in the water.

original: arejetāṃ rodasī bhiyāne kanikradato vṛṣṇo asya vajrāt //
analyzed: arejetām rodasī bhiyāne kanikradataḥ vṛṣṇaḥ asya vajrāt
translated: The two world-halves have trembled through fear of him, of the roaring, mighty one, of his thunderbolt.

original: aroravīd vṛṣṇo asya vajro 'mānuṣaṃ yan mānuṣo nijūrvāt /
analyzed: aroravīt vṛṣṇaḥ asya vajraḥ mānuṣam yat mānuṣaḥ nijūrvāt
translated: The thunderbolt of the mighty one hath roared, when the human one hath driven away the superhuman.

original: ni māyino dānavasya māyā apādayat papivān sutasya //
analyzed: ni māyinaḥ dānavasya māyāḥ apādayat papivān sutasya
translated: The drinker hath cast away the illusions of the deceitful Dânava, of the pressed (Soma).

original: pibāpibed indra śūra somam mandantu tvā mandinaḥ sutāsaḥ /🔽pṛṇantas te kukṣī vardhayantv itthā sutaḥ paura indram āva //
analyzed: piba a piba id indra śūra somam mandantu tvā mandinaḥ sutāsaḥ  pṛṇantaḥ te kukṣī vardhayantu itthā sutaḥ pauraḥ indram āva
translated: Drink, drink, O Indra, the Soma, O hero! Let the gladdening draughts gladden thee!🔽May they, filling thy belly, make thee swell. Here is the pressed (juice), O Purî, for Indra.

original: tve indrāpy abhūma viprā dhiyaṃ vanema ṛtayā sapantaḥ /
analyzed: tve indra api abhūma viprāḥ dhiyam vanema ṛtayā sapantaḥ
translated: In thee, O Indra, have we been, O sages, we who have offered with holy power, have gained the thought.

original: avasyavo dhīmahi praśastiṃ sadyas te rāyo dāvane syāma //
analyzed: avasyavaḥ dhīmahi praśastim sadyas te rāyaḥ dāvane syāma
translated: We have gained the praise, O bountiful one, that we may quickly obtain thy wealth, to give (it).

original: syāma te ta indra ye ta ūtī avasyava ūrjaṃ vardhayantaḥ /
analyzed: syāma te te indra ye te ūtī avasyavaḥ ūrjam vardhayantaḥ
translated: May we be those of thine, O Indra, who with devotion increase thy strength,

original: śuṣmintamaṃ yaṃ cākanāma devāsme rayiṃ rāsi vīravantam //
analyzed: śuṣmintamam yam cākanāma deva asme rayim rāsi vīravantam
translated: The most powerful whom we have chosen. Bestow on us, O God, wealth with heroes.

original: rāsi kṣayaṃ rāsi mitram asme rāsi śardha indra mārutaṃ naḥ /
analyzed: rāsi kṣayam rāsi mitram asme rāsi śardhaḥ indra mārutam naḥ
translated: Bestow wealth, bestow a friend on us. Bestow the Marut host on us, O Indra.

original: sajoṣaso ye ca mandasānāḥ pra vāyavaḥ pānty agraṇītim //
analyzed: sajoṣasaḥ ye ca mandasānāḥ pra vāyavaḥ pānti agraṇītim
translated: Those who are of one mind with us, and those who rejoice, and the winds protect our leadership.

original: vyantv in nu yeṣu mandasānas tṛpat somam pāhi drahyad indra /
analyzed: vyantu id nu yeṣu mandasānaḥ tṛpat somam pāhi drahyat indra
translated: Do thou rejoice in those in whom thou rejoicest. Drink the Soma to thy fill, be strong, O Indra.

original: asmān su pṛtsv ā tarutrāvardhayo dyām bṛhadbhir arkaiḥ //
analyzed: asmān su pṛtsu ā tarutra avardhayaḥ dyām bṛhadbhiḥ arkaiḥ
translated: In battles help us, O thou who art to be invoked. Increase our wealth with great hymns.

original: bṛhanta in nu ye te tarutrokthebhir vā sumnam āvivāsān /
analyzed: bṛhantaḥ id nu ye te tarutra ukthebhiḥ vā sumnam āvivāsān
translated: Great, O thou who art to be invoked, are they who rejoice in thee. Do thou, with hymns, come to their happiness.

original: stṛṇānāso barhiḥ pastyāvat tvotā id indra vājam agman //
analyzed: stṛṇānāsaḥ barhiḥ pastyāvat tvotāḥ id indra vājam agman
translated: They who strew the grass, the abode, invoked by us, have come, O Indra, to the booty.

original: ugreṣv in nu śūra mandasānas trikadrukeṣu pāhi somam indra /
analyzed: ugreṣu id nu śūra mandasānaḥ trikadrukeṣu pāhi somam indra
translated: Rejoicing in the fierce (struggles), O hero, drink the Soma on the Trikadrukas, O Indra.

original: pradodhuvac chmaśruṣu prīṇāno yāhi haribhyāṃ sutasya pītim //🔽dhiṣvā śavaḥ śūra yena vṛtram avābhinad dānum aurṇavābham /
analyzed: pradodhuvat śmaśruṣu prīṇānaḥ yāhi haribhyām sutasya pītim  dhiṣvā śavaḥ śūra yena vṛtram avābhinat dānum aurṇavābham
translated: Shaking the beard, delighting, come to the drinking of the juice with thy two bay steeds.🔽Sharpen thy strength, O hero, wherewith thou smotest Vritra, the Dânu, the son of Aurṇavâb.

original: apāvṛṇor jyotir āryāya ni savyataḥ sādi dasyur indra //
analyzed: apāvṛṇoḥ jyotiḥ āryāya ni savyatas sādi dasyuḥ indra
translated: Thou hast disclosed the light for the Ârya. The Dasyu is smitten down on the left side, O Indra.

original: sanema ye ta ūtibhis taranto viśvā spṛdha āryeṇa dasyūn /
analyzed: sanema ye te ūtibhiḥ tarantaḥ viśvāḥ spṛdhaḥ āryeṇa dasyūn
translated: May we, with your aids, O Indra, crossing all our enemies, whether Aryan or Dasyu,

original: asmabhyaṃ tat tvāṣṭraṃ viśvarūpam arandhayaḥ sākhyasya tritāya //
analyzed: asmabhyam tat tvāṣṭram viśva rūpam arandhayaḥ sākhyasya tritāya
translated: May we obtain that wealth of yours, O Tvastr, of every form, which you bestowed on Triṭa, the son of Sākhin.

original: asya suvānasya mandinas tritasya ny arbudaṃ vāvṛdhāno astaḥ /
analyzed: asya suvānasya mandinaḥ tritasya ni arbudam vāvṛdhānaḥ astar
translated: The son of Trita, the joyous one, the pressed, hath waxed strong and hath cast away his foeman.

original: avartayat sūryo na cakram bhinad valam indro aṅgirasvān //
analyzed: avartayat sūryaḥ na cakram bhinat valam indraḥ aṅgirasvān
translated: Sūrya hath rolled his wheel, Indra, the son of Aṅgiras, hath cleft the cloud.

original: nūnaṃ sā te prati varaṃ jaritre duhīyad indra dakṣiṇā maghonī /
analyzed: nūnam sā te prati varam jaritre duhīyat indra dakṣiṇā maghonī
translated: Now let that same, O Indra, which is thy bounty to the singer, the bountiful, the rich,

original: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: śikṣa stotṛbhyaḥ mā ati dhak bhagaḥ naḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: Yield to us, O Lord of Bay Steeds, as a cow to her calf. May we speak lofty words in the assembly, with brave sons.

original: yo jāta eva prathamo manasvān devo devān kratunā paryabhūṣat /
analyzed: yaḥ jātaḥ eva prathamaḥ manasvān devaḥ devān kratunā paryabhūṣat
translated: He who, even from his birth, the first, the wise, the God, hath by his will encompassed the Gods,

original: yasya śuṣmād rodasī abhyasetāṃ nṛmṇasya mahnā sa janāsa indraḥ //
analyzed: yasya śuṣmāt rodasī abhyasetām nṛmṇasya mahnā sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: By whose impulse the two worlds have been extended, by the greatness of his manliness, He is Indra among men.

original: yaḥ pṛthivīṃ vyathamānām adṛṃhad yaḥ parvatān prakupitāṃ aramṇāt /
analyzed: yaḥ pṛthivīm vyathamānām adṛṃhat yaḥ parvatān prakupitām aramṇāt
translated: He who hath steadied the trembling earth, who hath set in order the angry mountains,

original: yo antarikṣaṃ vimame varīyo yo dyām astabhnāt sa janāsa indraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ antarikṣam vimame varīyaḥ yaḥ dyām astabhnāt sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Who hath measured out the wide air, who hath upheld the sky, He is Indra among men.

original: yo hatvāhim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn yo gā udājad apadhā valasya /
analyzed: yaḥ hatvā ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn yaḥ gāḥ udājat apadhā valasya
translated: He who, having slain the dragon, let loose the seven rivers, who hath brought forth the kine, and cleft the cloud,

original: yo aśmanor antar agniṃ jajāna saṃvṛk samatsu sa janāsa indraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ aśmanoḥ antar agnim jajāna saṃvṛj samatsu sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: He who hath generated Agni from between the stones, he who in battles is the guardian of the people, is Indra.

original: yenemā viśvā cyavanā kṛtāni yo dāsaṃ varṇam adharaṃ guhākaḥ /
analyzed: yena imā viśvā cyavanā kṛtāni yaḥ dāsam varṇam adharam guhā akaḥ
translated: By whom all these things have been made to tremble, who hath hidden the dark-hued race of the Dâsa,

original: śvaghnīva yo jigīvāṃl lakṣam ādad aryaḥ puṣṭāni sa janāsa indraḥ //
analyzed: śvaghnī iva yaḥ jigīvān lakṣam ādat aryaḥ puṣṭāni sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Who, like a bitch, hath seized the prize of conquest, he who hath won the Aryan's wealth is Indra.

original: yaṃ smā pṛcchanti kuha seti ghoram utem āhur naiṣo astīty enam /
analyzed: yam sma pṛcchanti kuha sa iti ghoram uta īm āhuḥ na eṣaḥ asti iti enam
translated: Whom they ask, Where is the terrible one? and they say unto him, He is not here at all.

original: so aryaḥ puṣṭīr vija ivā mināti śrad asmai dhatta sa janāsa indraḥ //
analyzed: saḥ aryaḥ puṣṭīḥ vijaḥ iva ā mināti śrath asmai dhatta sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: He, like a robber, plunders the Aryan's wealth. Give to him, O people! He is Indra.

original: yo radhrasya coditā yaḥ kṛśasya yo brahmaṇo nādhamānasya kīreḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ radhrasya coditā yaḥ kṛśasya yaḥ brahmaṇaḥ nādhamānasya kīreḥ
translated: He who impels the poor and needy man, who helps the singer of the prayer that fain would speak,

original: yuktagrāvṇo yo 'vitā suśipraḥ sutasomasya sa janāsa indraḥ //
analyzed: yukta grāvṇaḥ yaḥ vitā su śipraḥ suta somasya sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Who is the guardian of him who presses out the Soma, he who hath beautiful eyebrows is Indra.

original: yasyāśvāsaḥ pradiśi yasya gāvo yasya grāmā yasya viśve rathāsaḥ /
analyzed: yasya aśvāsaḥ pradiśi yasya gāvaḥ yasya grāmāḥ yasya viśve rathāsaḥ
translated: He who hath horses and kine, whose are the villages, whose all the chariots,

original: yaḥ sūryaṃ ya uṣasaṃ jajāna yo apāṃ netā sa janāsa indraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ sūryam yaḥ uṣasam jajāna yaḥ apām netā sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Who hath engendered the sun and the dawn, who is the leader of the waters, is Indra.

original: yaṃ krandasī saṃyatī vihvayete pare 'vara ubhayā amitrāḥ /
analyzed: yam krandasī saṃyatī vihvayete pare vare ubhayāḥ amitrāḥ
translated: Whom the two worlds, moving together, frighten, the higher and the lower, the foes on both sides,

original: samānaṃ cid ratham ātasthivāṃsā nānā havete sa janāsa indraḥ //
analyzed: samānam cit ratham ātasthivāṃsā nānā havete sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Who, though seated in the same chariot, calls them each by a different name, is Indra.

original: yasmān na ṛte vijayante janāso yaṃ yudhyamānā avase havante /
analyzed: yasmāt na ṛte vijayante janāsaḥ yam yudhyamānāḥ avase havante
translated: Since people do not conquer without him, to whom they cry out for help in battle.

original: yo viśvasya pratimānam babhūva yo acyutacyut sa janāsa indraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ viśvasya pratimānam babhūva yaḥ a cyuta cyut sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: He who became the measure of all things, who is the shaker of the unshakable, he is the people's Indra.

original: yaḥ śaśvato mahy eno dadhānān amanyamānāñ charvā jaghāna /
analyzed: yaḥ śaśvataḥ mahi enaḥ dadhānān a manyamānām śarvā jaghāna
translated: He who slew with his dart those who always bore great enmity, who were insolent,

original: yaḥ śardhate nānudadāti śṛdhyāṃ yo dasyor hantā sa janāsa indraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ śardhate na anudadāti śṛdhyām yaḥ dasyoḥ hantā sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: who does not give way to the one who threatens, who is the slayer of the Dasyu, he is the people's Indra.

original: yaḥ śambaram parvateṣu kṣiyantaṃ catvāriṃśyāṃ śarady anvavindat /
analyzed: yaḥ śambaram parvateṣu kṣiyantam catvāriṃśyām śaradi anvavindat
translated: He who found in the autumn of forty years Shambara lying on the mountains,

original: ojāyamānaṃ yo ahiṃ jaghāna dānuṃ śayānaṃ sa janāsa indraḥ //
analyzed: ojāyamānam yaḥ ahim jaghāna dānum śayānam sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: who slew the serpent striving with might, lying as a demon, he is the people's Indra.

original: yaḥ saptaraśmir vṛṣabhas tuviṣmān avāsṛjat sartave sapta sindhūn /
analyzed: yaḥ sapta raśmiḥ vṛṣabhaḥ tuviṣmān avāsṛjat sartave sapta sindhūn
translated: He who is the bull with seven rays, mighty, let loose the seven rivers to flow,

original: yo rauhiṇam asphurad vajrabāhur dyām ārohantaṃ sa janāsa indraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ rauhiṇam asphurat vajra bāhuḥ dyām ārohantam sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: who with his thunderbolt arm burst Rauhina as he was ascending to the sky, he is the people's Indra.

original: dyāvā cid asmai pṛthivī namete śuṣmāc cid asya parvatā bhayante /
analyzed: dyāvā cit asmai pṛthivī namete śuṣmāt cit asya parvatāḥ bhayante
translated: Even heaven and earth bow down to him, the mountains tremble at his might,

original: yaḥ somapā nicito vajrabāhur yo vajrahastaḥ sa janāsa indraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ soma pāḥ nicitaḥ vajra bāhuḥ yaḥ vajra hastaḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: he who drinks the Soma, who is girt with the thunderbolt in his arm, who has the thunderbolt in his hand, he is the people's Indra.

original: yaḥ sunvantam avati yaḥ pacantaṃ yaḥ śaṃsantaṃ yaḥ śaśamānam ūtī /
analyzed: yaḥ sunvantam avati yaḥ pacantam yaḥ śaṃsantam yaḥ śaśamānam ūtī
translated: He who protects the man who presses out the Soma, who cooks, who sings praises, who strives to win him,

original: yasya brahma vardhanaṃ yasya somo yasyedaṃ rādhaḥ sa janāsa indraḥ //
analyzed: yasya brahma vardhanam yasya somaḥ yasya idam rādhaḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Whose strength the prayer increases, whose the Soma, whose this gift, he is the people's Indra.

original: yaḥ sunvate pacate dudhra ā cid vājaṃ dardarṣi sa kilāsi satyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ sunvate pacate dudhraḥ ā cit vājam dardarṣi sa kila asi satyaḥ
translated: He who even to the faithful one who presses and cooks the Soma sends forth strength, he verily is true.

original: vayaṃ ta indra viśvaha priyāsaḥ suvīrāso vidatham ā vadema //🔽ṛtur janitrī tasyā apas pari makṣū jāta āviśad yāsu vardhate /
analyzed: vayam te indra viśvaha priyāsaḥ su vīrāsaḥ vidatham ā vadema  ṛtuḥ janitrī tasyāḥ apaḥ pari makṣū jātaḥ āviśat yāsu vardhate
translated: We, O Indra, all of us, are thy dear friends: may we speak in the assembly, with brave sons.🔽The season is the mother, the waters are her surroundings. He entered them as soon as born, in which he grows.

original: tad āhanā abhavat pipyuṣī payo 'ṃśoḥ pīyūṣam prathamaṃ tad ukthyam //
analyzed: tat āhanāḥ abhavat pipyuṣī payaḥ ṃśoḥ pīyūṣam prathamam tat ukthyam
translated: That became the swelling milk, the first sweet drink of the portion, that is the Ukthya.

original: sadhrīm ā yanti pari bibhratīḥ payo viśvapsnyāya pra bharanta bhojanam /
analyzed: sadhrīm ā yanti pari bibhratīḥ payaḥ viśvapsnyāya pra bharanta bhojanam
translated: They come together, bearing the milk, they bring the food for the all-nourishing one.

original: samāno adhvā pravatām anuṣyade yas tākṛṇoḥ prathamaṃ sāsy ukthyaḥ //
analyzed: samānaḥ adhvā pravatām anuṣyade yaḥ tā akṛṇoḥ prathamam sa asi ukthyaḥ
translated: The common path of the running streams is the sky: thou who madest that first art the Ukthya.

original: anv eko vadati yad dadāti tad rūpā minan tadapā eka īyate /
analyzed: anu ekaḥ vadati yat dadāti tat rūpā minan tad apāḥ ekaḥ īyate
translated: One follows when he says what he will give; he measures the forms, and then goes away.

original: viśvā ekasya vinudas titikṣate yas tākṛṇoḥ prathamaṃ sāsy ukthyaḥ //
analyzed: viśvāḥ ekasya vinudaḥ titikṣate yaḥ tā akṛṇoḥ prathamam sa asi ukthyaḥ
translated: The other's repulsions all he endures: thou who madest that first art the Ukthya.

original: prajābhyaḥ puṣṭiṃ vibhajanta āsate rayim iva pṛṣṭham prabhavantam āyate /
analyzed: prajābhyaḥ puṣṭim vibhajantaḥ āsate rayim iva pṛṣṭham prabhavantam āyate
translated: They distribute nourishment to the people, as if they were distributing wealth, to the growing back.

original: asinvan daṃṣṭraiḥ pitur atti bhojanaṃ yas tākṛṇoḥ prathamaṃ sāsy ukthyaḥ //
analyzed: asinvan daṃṣṭraiḥ pituḥ atti bhojanam yaḥ tā akṛṇoḥ prathamam sa asi ukthyaḥ
translated: He chews the food of his father with his teeth, which you first made. That is why he is worthy of praise.

original: adhākṛṇoḥ pṛthivīṃ saṃdṛśe dive yo dhautīnām ahihann āriṇak pathaḥ /
analyzed: adha akṛṇoḥ pṛthivīm saṃdṛśe dive yaḥ dhautīnām ahi han āriṇak pathaḥ
translated: You made the earth visible to the sky, O slayer of Ahi, you cleared the paths of the waters.

original: taṃ tvā stomebhir udabhir na vājinaṃ devaṃ devā ajanan sāsy ukthyaḥ //
analyzed: tam tvā stomebhiḥ udabhiḥ na vājinam devam devāḥ ajanan sa asi ukthyaḥ
translated: You, whom the gods have generated as a god with praises and prayers, as a strong one, that is why he is worthy of praise.

original: yo bhojanaṃ ca dayase ca vardhanam ārdrād ā śuṣkam madhumad dudohitha /
analyzed: yaḥ bhojanam ca dayase ca vardhanam ārdrāt ā śuṣkam madhumat dudohitha
translated: You who give food and increase, you who have drawn forth honey from the moist to the dry.

original: sa śevadhiṃ ni dadhiṣe vivasvati viśvasyaika īśiṣe sāsy ukthyaḥ //
analyzed: sa śevadhim ni dadhiṣe vivasvati viśvasya ekaḥ īśiṣe sa asi ukthyaḥ
translated: You have placed the treasure in the sun. You are the sole lord of all. That is why he is worthy of praise.

original: yaḥ puṣpiṇīś ca prasvaś ca dharmaṇādhi dāne vy avanīr adhārayaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ puṣpiṇīḥ ca prasvaḥ ca dharmaṇā adhi dāne vi avanīḥ adhārayaḥ
translated: You who by law have held fast the flowering and the unflowering, the waters in the gift.

original: yaś cāsamā ajano didyuto diva urur ūrvāṃ abhitaḥ sāsy ukthyaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ ca asamāḥ ajanaḥ didyutaḥ divaḥ uruḥ ūrvām abhitas sa asi ukthyaḥ
translated: And you who have generated the unequalled flashes of lightning from the sky, the wide-spread ones on all sides. That is why he is worthy of praise.

original: yo nārmaraṃ sahavasuṃ nihantave pṛkṣāya ca dāsaveśāya cāvahaḥ /🔽ūrjayantyā apariviṣṭam āsyam utaivādya purukṛt sāsy ukthyaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ nārmaram sahavasum nihantave pṛkṣāya ca dāsaveśāya ca avahaḥ 🔽ūrjayantyāḥ apariviṣṭam āsyam uta eva adya puru kṛt sa asi ukthyaḥ
translated: You who have brought the treasure with its wealth to be slain, for the sake of the earth and the lord of the Dāsas.🔽The treasure which is not to be surpassed, which is full of nourishment, even today, O performer of great deeds, that is why he is worthy of praise.

original: śataṃ vā yasya daśa sākam ādya ekasya śruṣṭau yad dha codam āvitha /🔽arajjau dasyūn sam unab dabhītaye suprāvyo abhavaḥ sāsy ukthyaḥ //
analyzed: śatam vā yasya daśa sākam ādyaḥ ekasya śruṣṭau yat ha codam āvitha  a rajjau dasyūn sam unap dabhītaye suprāvyaḥ abhavaḥ sa asi ukthyaḥ
translated: Whose hundred or ten are together at the first, what time thou aidest one in hearing the call.🔽Thou madest the Dasyus free from bonds for Dabiha's sake: thou wast the good protector: thou art worthy of the laud.

original: viśved anu rodhanā asya pauṃsyaṃ dadur asmai dadhire kṛtnave dhanam /
analyzed: viśvā id anu rodhanā asya pauṃsyam daduḥ asmai dadhire kṛtnave dhanam
translated: All have given him the furtherance of his manhood: they have given wealth to him who is to be served.

original: ṣaḷ astabhnā viṣṭiraḥ pañca saṃdṛśaḥ pari paro abhavaḥ sāsy ukthyaḥ //🔽supravācanaṃ tava vīra vīryaṃ yad ekena kratunā vindase vasu /
analyzed: ṣaḍ astabhnāḥ viṣṭiraḥ pañca saṃdṛśaḥ pari paras abhavaḥ sa asi ukthyaḥ  su pravācanam tava vīra vīryam yat ekena kratunā vindase vasu
translated: Thou hast supported the five regions, the six boundaries: thou hast become the highest: thou art worthy of the laud.🔽Easy to call is thy heroic strength, O Hero, since by one rite thou gainest wealth.

original: jātūṣṭhirasya pra vayaḥ sahasvato yā cakartha sendra viśvāsy ukthyaḥ //🔽aramayaḥ sarapasas tarāya kaṃ turvītaye ca vayyāya ca srutim /
analyzed: jātūṣṭhirasya pra vayaḥ sahasvataḥ yā cakartha sa indra viśvā asi ukthyaḥ  aramayaḥ sarapasaḥ tarāya kam turvītaye ca vayyāya ca srutim
translated: The life of Jatugahu, the mighty one, which thou hast made thine own, is worthy of the laud, O Indra.🔽Thou hast set free the swift one to move at will: whom hast thou saved? The path for Turvitha and Vya.

original: nīcā santam ud anayaḥ parāvṛjam prāndhaṃ śroṇaṃ śravayan sāsy ukthyaḥ //
analyzed: nīcā santam ud anayaḥ parāvṛjam pra andham śroṇam śravayan sa asi ukthyaḥ
translated: Thou hast brought up the low one to the highest place: thou hast made the blind and lame to hear: thou art worthy of the laud.

original: asmabhyaṃ tad vaso dānāya rādhaḥ sam arthayasva bahu te vasavyam /
analyzed: asmabhyam tat vaso dānāya rādhaḥ sam arthayasva bahu te vasavyam
translated: That bounty, O Vasu, for our gift, do thou bring together: much is thy wealth to give.

original: indra yac citraṃ śravasyā anu dyūn bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: indra yat citram śravasyāḥ anu dyūn bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: O Indra, that wondrous glory which we have in the days, let us utter in the assembly, with brave sons: thou art worthy of the laud.

original: adhvaryavo bharatendrāya somam āmatrebhiḥ siñcatā madyam andhaḥ /
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ bharata indrāya somam āmatrebhiḥ siñcata madyam andhaḥ
translated: O Adhvaryus, bring the Soma to Indra, pour the intoxicating drink with the Amātrī verses.

original: kāmī hi vīraḥ sadam asya pītiṃ juhota vṛṣṇe tad id eṣa vaṣṭi //
analyzed: kāmī hi vīraḥ sadam asya pītim juhota vṛṣṇe tat id eṣa vaṣṭi
translated: For the hero is ever eager for his draught; offer it to the bull, for he is the one who enjoys it.

original: adhvaryavo yo apo vavrivāṃsaṃ vṛtraṃ jaghānāśanyeva vṛkṣam /
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yaḥ apaḥ vavrivāṃsam vṛtram jaghāna aśanyā iva vṛkṣam
translated: O Adhvaryus, he who struck down the cloud-covered Vrtra like a tree with a thunderbolt,

original: tasmā etam bharata tadvaśāyaṃ eṣa indro arhati pītim asya //
analyzed: tasmai etam bharata tad vaśāyam eṣaḥ indraḥ arhati pītim asya
translated: To him, O Bharata, who is under his control, to him, to Indra, is this drink worthy.

original: adhvaryavo yo dṛbhīkaṃ jaghāna yo gā udājad apa hi valaṃ vaḥ /
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yaḥ dṛbhīkam jaghāna yaḥ gāḥ udājat apa hi valam vaḥ
translated: O Adhvaryus, he who struck down Dṛbhīka, who brought forth the cows and broke through your enclosure,

original: tasmā etam antarikṣe na vātam indraṃ somair orṇuta jūr na vastraiḥ //
analyzed: tasmai etam antarikṣe na vātam indram somaiḥ orṇuta jūḥ na vastraiḥ
translated: To him, to Indra, who is like the wind in the atmosphere, anoint with the Somas, as one does a garment with oil.

original: adhvaryavo ya uraṇaṃ jaghāna nava cakhvāṃsaṃ navatiṃ ca bāhūn /
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yaḥ uraṇam jaghāna nava cakhvāṃsam navatim ca bāhūn
translated: O Adhvaryus, he who struck down Uraṇa, who crushed nine and ninety arms,

original: yo arbudam ava nīcā babādhe tam indraṃ somasya bhṛthe hinota //
analyzed: yaḥ arbudam ava nīcā babādhe tam indram somasya bhṛthe hinota
translated: Who struck down the demon Arbudi, to him, to Indra, lead him to the Soma bath.

original: adhvaryavo yaḥ sv aśnaṃ jaghāna yaḥ śuṣṇam aśuṣaṃ yo vyaṃsam /
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yaḥ su aśnam jaghāna yaḥ śuṣṇam aśuṣam yaḥ vyaṃsam
translated: O Adhvaryus, he who struck down Svaṣna, who killed Śuṣṇa, the wicked one, who killed Vyaṃsa,

original: yaḥ pipruṃ namuciṃ yo rudhikrāṃ tasmā indrāyāndhaso juhota //
analyzed: yaḥ piprum namucim yaḥ rudhikrām tasmai indrāya andhasaḥ juhota
translated: Who killed Pipru, Namuci, and Rudhikrāṇa, to him, to Indra, offer the drink.

original: adhvaryavo yaḥ śataṃ śambarasya puro bibhedāśmaneva pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yaḥ śatam śambarasya puraḥ bibheda aśmanā iva pūrvīḥ
translated: O Adhvaryus, he who broke a hundred of Śambara's forts, as if they were many small ones,

original: yo varcinaḥ śatam indraḥ sahasram apāvapad bharatā somam asmai //
analyzed: yaḥ varcinaḥ śatam indraḥ sahasram apāvapat bharata somam asmai
translated: He who, Indra, cast away a hundred, a thousand, Varcinas, bring Soma to him, O Bharatas.

original: adhvaryavo yaḥ śatam ā sahasram bhūmyā upasthe 'vapaj jaghanvān /
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yaḥ śatam ā sahasram bhūmyāḥ upasthe vapat jaghanvān
translated: O Adhvaryus, he who, a hundred, a thousand, on the lap of the earth, cast down, with his knee bent,

original: kutsasyāyor atithigvasya vīrān ny āvṛṇag bharatā somam asmai //
analyzed: kutsasya āyoḥ atithigvasya vīrān ni āvṛṇak bharatā somam asmai
translated: The heroes of Kutsa's son Atithigva, covered them, bring Soma to him, O Bharatas.

original: adhvaryavo yan naraḥ kāmayādhve śruṣṭī vahanto naśathā tad indre /
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yat naraḥ kāmayādhve śruṣṭī vahantaḥ naśatha tat indre
translated: O Adhvaryus, if men desire to hear, carrying the oblations, go to that Indra.

original: gabhastipūtam bharata śrutāyendrāya somaṃ yajyavo juhota //
analyzed: gabhasti pūtam bharata śrutāya indrāya somam yajyavaḥ juhota
translated: Purified in the arms, bring, O famous ones, Soma to Indra, O you who are to be worshipped, offer it.

original: adhvaryavaḥ kartanā śruṣṭim asmai vane nipūtaṃ vana un nayadhvam /🔽juṣāṇo hastyam abhi vāvaśe va indrāya somam madiraṃ juhota //
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ kartana śruṣṭim asmai vane nipūtam vane ud nayadhvam  juṣāṇaḥ hastyam abhi vāvaśe vaḥ indrāya somam madiram juhota
translated: O Adhvaryus, for him who is to be heard, bring the one purified in the forest to the forest.🔽Accepting the oblation, come to the strong one, offer to Indra the intoxicating Soma.

original: adhvaryavaḥ payasodhar yathā goḥ somebhir īm pṛṇatā bhojam indram /
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ payasodhar yathā goḥ somebhiḥ īm pṛṇata bhojam indram
translated: O Adhvaryus, as much as the milk of the cow, with the Somas, satisfy Indra, the enjoyer.

original: vedāham asya nibhṛtam ma etad ditsantam bhūyo yajataś ciketa //
analyzed: veda aham asya nibhṛtam me etat ditsantam bhūyas yajataḥ ciketa
translated: I know his secret, I know him who is willing to give more than he is to be worshipped.

original: adhvaryavo yo divyasya vasvo yaḥ pārthivasya kṣamyasya rājā /
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ yaḥ divyasya vasvaḥ yaḥ pārthivasya kṣamyasya rājā
translated: O Adhvaryus, he who is the king of heavenly wealth, of earthly, of the forgiving,

original: tam ūrdaraṃ na pṛṇatā yavenendraṃ somebhis tad apo vo astu //
analyzed: tam ūrdaram na pṛṇatā yavena indram somebhiḥ tat apaḥ vaḥ astu
translated: That Indra, fill the belly with barley, with Somas, let that be for you, O waters.

original: asmabhyaṃ tad vaso dānāya rādhaḥ sam arthayasva bahu te vasavyam /
analyzed: asmabhyam tat vaso dānāya rādhaḥ sam arthayasva bahu te vasavyam
translated: For us, O Vasu, direct that bounty to our gift: thou hast much wealth.

original: indra yac citraṃ śravasyā anu dyūn bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: indra yat citram śravasyāḥ anu dyūn bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: O Indra, whatever wondrous glory there is in the days, may we speak it in the assembly, with brave sons.

original: pra ghā nv asya mahato mahāni satyā satyasya karaṇāni vocam /
analyzed: pra ghā nu asya mahataḥ mahāni satyā satyasya karaṇāni vocam
translated: Now will I tell the true deeds of this great one, the true deeds of the mighty one.

original: trikadrukeṣv apibat sutasyāsya made ahim indro jaghāna //
analyzed: trikadrukeṣu apibat sutasya asya made ahim indraḥ jaghāna
translated: He drank of the pressed (Soma) on the Trikadrukas; in the rapture of this (drink) Indra slew the dragon.

original: avaṃśe dyām astabhāyad bṛhantam ā rodasī apṛṇad antarikṣam /
analyzed: avaṃśe dyām astabhāyat bṛhantam ā rodasī apṛṇat antarikṣam
translated: He propped up the lofty sky in the hollow; he filled the two world-halves, the wide atmosphere.

original: sa dhārayat pṛthivīm paprathac ca somasya tā mada indraś cakāra //
analyzed: sa dhārayat pṛthivīm paprathat ca somasya tā made indraḥ cakāra
translated: He supported the earth, and spread it out: Indra did this deed in the rapture of the Soma.

original: sadmeva prāco vi mimāya mānair vajreṇa khāny atṛṇan nadīnām /
analyzed: sadma iva prācaḥ vi mimāya mānaiḥ vajreṇa khāni atṛṇat nadīnām
translated: As with a measure he meted out the eastern (quarters) with his thoughts; with his bolt he cleft the openings of the rivers.

original: vṛthāsṛjat pathibhir dīrghayāthaiḥ somasya tā mada indraś cakāra //
analyzed: vṛthā sṛjat pathibhiḥ dīrghayāthaiḥ somasya tā made indraḥ cakāra
translated: He set free the waters by the long-desired paths: Indra did this deed in the rapture of the Soma.

original: sa pravoḷhṝn parigatyā dabhīter viśvam adhāg āyudham iddhe agnau /
analyzed: sa pravoḷhṝn parigatya dabhīteḥ viśvam adhāk āyudham iddhe agnau
translated: He, having encompassed the Pravols and the Dabhîtis, cast all their weapons into the kindled fire.

original: saṃ gobhir aśvair asṛjad rathebhiḥ somasya tā mada indraś cakāra //
analyzed: sam gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ asṛjat rathebhiḥ somasya tā made indraḥ cakāra
translated: He set them free with kine, with horses, with chariots: Indra did this deed in the rapture of the Soma.

original: sa īm mahīṃ dhunim etor aramṇāt so asnātṝn apārayat svasti /
analyzed: saḥ īm mahīm dhunim etoḥ aramṇāt saḥ asnātṝn apārayat svasti
translated: He set free the great trembling one from the pit; he delivered the bathers in safety.

original: ta utsnāya rayim abhi pra tasthuḥ somasya tā mada indraś cakāra //
analyzed: te utsnāya rayim abhi pra tasthuḥ somasya tā made indraḥ cakāra
translated: Having bathed, they went forth to wealth. These were the joys of Soma which Indra made.

original: sodañcaṃ sindhum ariṇān mahitvā vajreṇāna uṣasaḥ sam pipeṣa /
analyzed: sā udañcam sindhum ariṇāt mahitvā vajreṇa anaḥ uṣasaḥ sam pipeṣa
translated: He made the river flow upwards by his greatness, and with his thunderbolt he crushed the dawns.

original: ajavaso javinībhir vivṛścan somasya tā mada indraś cakāra //
analyzed: ajavasaḥ javinībhiḥ vivṛścan somasya tā made indraḥ cakāra
translated: With his swift powers he tore asunder the swift one. These were the joys of Soma which Indra made.

original: sa vidvāṃ apagohaṃ kanīnām āvir bhavann ud atiṣṭhat parāvṛk /
analyzed: sa vidvān apagoham kanīnām āvis bhavan ud atiṣṭhat parāvṛj
translated: He, the wise one, the protector of the weak, rising up, stood forth, turned away from the distant.

original: prati śroṇa sthād vy anag acaṣṭa somasya tā mada indraś cakāra //
analyzed: prati śroṇa sthāt vi anak acaṣṭa somasya tā made indraḥ cakāra
translated: From the place of the back he looked out, the unburned. These were the joys of Soma which Indra made.

original: bhinad valam aṅgirobhir gṛṇāno vi parvatasya dṛṃhitāny airat /
analyzed: bhinat valam aṅgirobhiḥ gṛṇānaḥ vi parvatasya dṛṃhitāni airat
translated: He broke the stronghold with the Angirases singing, he cleft asunder the firm bonds of the mountain.

original: riṇag rodhāṃsi kṛtrimāṇy eṣāṃ somasya tā mada indraś cakāra //
analyzed: riṇak rodhāṃsi kṛtrimāṇi eṣām somasya tā made indraḥ cakāra
translated: He cut through the barriers and contrivances of these. These were the joys of Soma which Indra made.

original: svapnenābhyupyā cumuriṃ dhuniṃ ca jaghantha dasyum pra dabhītim āvaḥ /🔽rambhī cid atra vivide hiraṇyaṃ somasya tā mada indraś cakāra //
analyzed: svapnena abhyupya cumurim dhunim ca jaghantha dasyum pra dabhītim āvaḥ  rambhī cit atra vivide hiraṇyam somasya tā made indraḥ cakāra
translated: Having approached with a dream, thou slewest Chumu and Dhuni, thou gavest the Dasyu to be slain.🔽Even the greedy one found gold here. These were the joys of Soma which Indra made.

original: nūnaṃ sā te prati varaṃ jaritre duhīyad indra dakṣiṇā maghonī /
analyzed: nūnam sā te prati varam jaritre duhīyat indra dakṣiṇā maghonī
translated: Now, indeed, that rich one, the milch cow, should yield a reward to the singer, O Indra.

original: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: śikṣa stotṛbhyaḥ mā ati dhak bhagaḥ naḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: Let the teaching not fail those who praise, may Bhaga be our protector. May we speak loftily in the assembly, with good sons.

original: pra vaḥ satāṃ jyeṣṭhatamāya suṣṭutim agnāv iva samidhāne havir bhare /
analyzed: pra vaḥ satām jyeṣṭhatamāya suṣṭutim agnau iva samidhāne haviḥ bhare
translated: I offer you praise to the most excellent of the good, like oblation placed in the fire in Agni.

original: indram ajuryaṃ jarayantam ukṣitaṃ sanād yuvānam avase havāmahe //
analyzed: indram ajuryam jarayantam ukṣitam sanāt yuvānam avase havāmahe
translated: We invoke for help Indra, the undecaying, the aging, the sprinkled one, the youthful from of old.

original: yasmād indrād bṛhataḥ kiṃ canem ṛte viśvāny asmin sambhṛtādhi vīryā /
analyzed: yasmāt indrāt bṛhataḥ kim cana īm ṛte viśvāni asmin sambhṛtā adhi vīryā
translated: From whom, from Indra, the great one, nothing is omitted, all the powers are collected in him.

original: jaṭhare somaṃ tanvī saho maho haste vajram bharati śīrṣaṇi kratum //🔽na kṣoṇībhyām paribhve ta indriyaṃ na samudraiḥ parvatair indra te rathaḥ /
analyzed: jaṭhare somam tanvī sahaḥ mahaḥ haste vajram bharati śīrṣaṇi kratum  na kṣoṇībhyām paribhve te indriyam na samudraiḥ parvataiḥ indra te rathaḥ
translated: In his belly he bears Soma, in his slender body great strength, in his hand the thunderbolt, in his head the will.🔽Neither by the two worlds nor by the oceans and mountains is thy power, O Indra, thy chariot, surpassed.

original: na te vajram anv aśnoti kaś cana yad āśubhiḥ patasi yojanā puru //
analyzed: na te vajram anu aśnoti kaḥ cana yat āśubhiḥ patasi yojanā puru
translated: No one can follow thy thunderbolt when thou fliest with thy swift horses many a league.

original: viśve hy asmai yajatāya dhṛṣṇave kratum bharanti vṛṣabhāya saścate /
analyzed: viśve hi asmai yajatāya dhṛṣṇave kratum bharanti vṛṣabhāya saścate
translated: For all these bring the will to this sacrificer, to the bold one, to the bull who is in accord.

original: vṛṣā yajasva haviṣā viduṣṭaraḥ pibendra somaṃ vṛṣabheṇa bhānunā //
analyzed: vṛṣā yajasva haviṣā viduṣṭaraḥ piba indra somam vṛṣabheṇa bhānunā
translated: O bull, sacrifice with the most excellent oblation. Drink Soma, O Indra, with thy bull-like light.

original: vṛṣṇaḥ kośaḥ pavate madhva ūrmir vṛṣabhānnāya vṛṣabhāya pātave /
analyzed: vṛṣṇaḥ kośaḥ pavate madhvaḥ ūrmiḥ vṛṣabha annāya vṛṣabhāya pātave
translated: The bull's vessel flows, the wave of sweet drink, for the bull's food, for the bull to drink.

original: vṛṣaṇādhvaryū vṛṣabhāso adrayo vṛṣaṇaṃ somaṃ vṛṣabhāya suṣvati //
analyzed: vṛṣaṇā adhvaryū vṛṣabhāsaḥ adrayaḥ vṛṣaṇam somam vṛṣabhāya
translated: The Adhvaryus are the testicles, the mountains are the bulls, the bull presses the bull Soma for the bull.

original: vṛṣā te vajra uta te vṛṣā ratho vṛṣaṇā harī vṛṣabhāṇy āyudhā /
analyzed: vṛṣā te vajraḥ uta te vṛṣā rathaḥ vṛṣaṇā harī vṛṣabhāṇi āyudhā
translated: Your thunderbolt is a bull, your chariot is a bull, your two tawny horses are bulls, your weapons are bulls.

original: vṛṣṇo madasya vṛṣabha tvam īśiṣa indra somasya vṛṣabhasya tṛpṇuhi //
analyzed: vṛṣṇaḥ madasya vṛṣabha tvam īśiṣe indra somasya vṛṣabhasya tṛpṇuhi
translated: You are the lord of the bull's rapture, O Indra; be satisfied with the bull Soma.
