original: pra te nāvaṃ na samane vacasyuvam brahmaṇā yāmi savaneṣu dādhṛṣiḥ /
analyzed: pra te nāvam na samane vacasyuvam brahmaṇā yāmi savaneṣu dādhṛṣiḥ
translated: With prayer I come to you, as if in a boat, to the assembly, to the contest, to the sacrifices, daring.

original: kuvin no asya vacaso nibodhiṣad indram utsaṃ na vasunaḥ sicāmahe //🔽purā sambādhād abhy ā vavṛtsva no dhenur na vatsaṃ yavasasya pipyuṣī /
analyzed: kuvid naḥ asya vacasaḥ nibodhiṣat indram utsam na vasunaḥ sicāmahe  purā sambādhāt abhī ā vavṛtsva naḥ dhenuḥ na vatsam yavasasya pipyuṣī
translated: Will you not be inclined to listen to this speech of ours? We long for Indra as for a spring of wealth.🔽Turn to us before the press of battle, like a milch-cow to her calf, swelling with milk.

original: sakṛt su te sumatibhiḥ śatakrato sam patnībhir na vṛṣaṇo nasīmahi //
analyzed: sakṛt su te sumatibhiḥ śatakrato sam patnībhiḥ na vṛṣaṇaḥ nasīmahi
translated: Once, O you of a hundred powers, with your favors, we will be like bulls with our wives.

original: nūnaṃ sā te prati varaṃ jaritre duhīyad indra dakṣiṇā maghonī /
analyzed: nūnam sā te prati varam jaritre duhīyat indra dakṣiṇā maghonī
translated: Surely that (cow) of yours, O Indra, the bountiful one, should yield a reward to the praiser before (the time of) the assembly.

original: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //🔽tad asmai navyam aṅgirasvad arcata śuṣmā yad asya pratnathodīrate /
analyzed: śikṣa stotṛbhyaḥ mā ati dhak bhagaḥ naḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ 🔽tat asmai navyam aṅgirasvat arcata śuṣmāḥ yat asya pratnathā udīrate
translated: Do not let your favor fail the praisers. We will speak lofty words in the assembly, with brave sons.

original: viśvā yad gotrā sahasā parīvṛtā made somasya dṛṃhitāny airayat //🔽sa bhūtu yo ha prathamāya dhāyasa ojo mimāno mahimānam ātirat /🔽śūro yo yutsu tanvam parivyata śīrṣaṇi dyām mahinā praty amuñcata //
analyzed: viśvā yat gotrā sahasā parīvṛtā made somasya dṛṃhitāni airayat  sa bhūtu yaḥ ha prathamāya dhāyasaḥ ojaḥ mimānaḥ mahimānam ātirat  śūraḥ yaḥ yutsu tanvam parivyata śīrṣaṇi dyām mahinā prati amuñcata
translated: When he encompassed with his might all the clans, and shook the firm ones in the rapture of the Soma.🔽Let him be, who, measuring out strength for the first support, hath surpassed greatness.🔽The hero who, in battle, hath encompassed his body, hath set the sky on his head with his might.

original: adhākṛṇoḥ prathamaṃ vīryam mahad yad asyāgre brahmaṇā śuṣmam airayaḥ /
analyzed: adha akṛṇoḥ prathamam vīryam mahat yat asya agre brahmaṇā śuṣmam airayaḥ
translated: Then thou madest the first great deed of prowess, when thou sentest forth with prayer the strength of this (Agni).

original: ratheṣṭhena haryaśvena vicyutāḥ pra jīrayaḥ sisrate sadhryak pṛthak //
analyzed: ratheṣṭhena hari aśvena vicyutāḥ pra jīrayaḥ sisrate sadhryak pṛthak
translated: The ancient ones, scattered by the charioteer with the two bay steeds, flow forth separately, together.

original: adhā yo viśvā bhuvanābhi majmaneśānakṛt pravayā abhy avardhata /
analyzed: adhā yaḥ viśvā bhuvanā abhi majmanā īśāna kṛt pravayāḥ abhī avardhata
translated: Then he, who for the lordship of all beings, hath been exalted by the ancient ones,

original: ād rodasī jyotiṣā vahnir ātanot sīvyan tamāṃsi dudhitā sam avyayat //🔽sa prācīnān parvatān dṛṃhad ojasādharācīnam akṛṇod apām apaḥ /
analyzed: āt rodasī jyotiṣā vahniḥ ātanot sīvyan tamāṃsi dudhitā sam avyayat  sa prācīnān parvatān dṛṃhat ojasā adharācīnam akṛṇot apām apaḥ
translated: The fire hath stretched out the two world-halves with light, and hath sewn together the hidden and the manifest darkness.🔽He hath strengthened the eastern mountains with might, and hath made the waters of the nether world to flow.

original: adhārayat pṛthivīṃ viśvadhāyasam astabhnān māyayā dyām avasrasaḥ //
analyzed: adhārayat pṛthivīm viśva dhāyasam astabhnāt māyayā dyām avasrasaḥ
translated: He hath supported the earth, the supporter of all, he hath propped up the sky with his power.

original: sāsmā aram bāhubhyāṃ yam pitākṛṇod viśvasmād ā januṣo vedasas pari /
analyzed: sa asmai aram bāhubhyām yam pitā akṛṇot viśvasmāt ā januṣaḥ vedasaḥ pari
translated: He whom the father hath made easy for him with his arms, from every birth, from every wealth,

original: yenā pṛthivyāṃ ni kriviṃ śayadhyai vajreṇa hatvy avṛṇak tuviṣvaṇiḥ //
analyzed: yenā pṛthivyām ni krivim śayadhyai vajreṇa hatvī avṛṇak tuviṣvaṇiḥ
translated: With which he laid down on the earth the Kṛvi to be slain, the mighty one with the thunderbolt broke him who was to be slain.

original: amājūr iva pitroḥ sacā satī samānād ā sadasas tvām iye bhagam /
analyzed: amājūḥ iva pitroḥ sacā satī samānāt ā sadasaḥ tvām iye bhagam
translated: Like a child sitting together with its parents, from the same seat I choose you, O Bhaga.

original: kṛdhi praketam upa māsy ā bhara daddhi bhāgaṃ tanvo yena māmahaḥ //🔽bhojaṃ tvām indra vayaṃ huvema dadiṣ ṭvam indrāpāṃsi vājān /
analyzed: kṛdhi praketam upa māsi ā bhara daddhi bhāgam tanvaḥ yena māmahaḥ  bhojam tvām indra vayam huvema dadiḥ tvam indra apāṃsi vājān
translated: Make the sign clear, bring it near, give the share of the body by which you have been worshipped.🔽O Indra, we invoke you as the enjoyer, you, O Indra, give the prizes.

original: aviḍḍhīndra citrayā na ūtī kṛdhi vṛṣann indra vasyaso naḥ //
analyzed: aviḍḍhi indra citrayā naḥ ūtī kṛdhi vṛṣan indra vasyasaḥ naḥ
translated: O Indra, be pleased with the wondrous help, make us rich, O Indra.

original: nūnaṃ sā te prati varaṃ jaritre duhīyad indra dakṣiṇā maghonī /
analyzed: nūnam sā te prati varam jaritre duhīyat indra dakṣiṇā maghonī
translated: This very same, O Indra, which is yours, the bountiful one, should yield a reward to the singer.

original: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: śikṣa stotṛbhyaḥ mā ati dhak bhagaḥ naḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: Teach the praisers, let not our good fortune fail. May we speak lofty words in the assembly, with brave sons.

original: prātā ratho navo yoji sasniś caturyugas trikaśaḥ saptaraśmiḥ /
analyzed: prātā rathaḥ navaḥ yoji sasniḥ catur yugaḥ trikaśaḥ sapta raśmiḥ
translated: The new chariot has been yoked in the morning, swift, with four horses, three seats, seven reins.

original: daśāritro manuṣyaḥ svarṣāḥ sa iṣṭibhir matibhī raṃhyo bhūt //
analyzed: daśa aritraḥ manuṣyaḥ svarṣāḥ saḥ iṣṭibhiḥ matibhiḥ raṃhyaḥ bhūt
translated: The human one, self-shining, with ten arrows, has become swift with sacrifices and thoughts.

original: sāsmā aram prathamaṃ sa dvitīyam uto tṛtīyam manuṣaḥ sa hotā /
analyzed: sa asmai aram prathamam sa dvitīyam uta u tṛtīyam manuṣaḥ sa hotā
translated: He is the first to extend it, he is the second, and the third of this human one is the priest.

original: anyasyā garbham anya ū jananta so anyebhiḥ sacate jenyo vṛṣā //
analyzed: anyasyāḥ garbham anye u jananta saḥ anyebhiḥ sacate jenyaḥ vṛṣā
translated: Another begets the embryo of another. He, the excellent bull, associates with others.

original: harī nu kaṃ ratha indrasya yojam āyai sūktena vacasā navena /
analyzed: harī nu kam rathe indrasya yojam āyai sūktena vacasā navena
translated: O Indra, which chariot of thine shall I yoke, with a new hymn and song, for going?

original: mo ṣu tvām atra bahavo hi viprā ni rīraman yajamānāso anye //
analyzed: mā u su tvām atra bahavaḥ hi viprāḥ ni rīraman yajamānāsaḥ anye
translated: Let not many other priests, other sacrificers, here hinder thee.

original: ā dvābhyāṃ haribhyām indra yāhy ā caturbhir ā ṣaḍbhir hūyamānaḥ /
analyzed: ā dvābhyām haribhyām indra yāhi ā caturbhiḥ ā ṣaḍbhiḥ hūyamānaḥ
translated: Come, O Indra, with two bays, come with four, come with six, invoked;

original: āṣṭābhir daśabhiḥ somapeyam ayaṃ sutaḥ sumakha mā mṛdhas kaḥ //
analyzed: ā aṣṭābhiḥ daśabhiḥ soma peyam ayam sutaḥ su makha mā mṛdhaḥ kaḥ
translated: Come with eight, with ten, to drink the Soma. Let not strife vex thee, O good sacrificer.

original: ā viṃśatyā triṃśatā yāhy arvāṅ ā catvāriṃśatā haribhir yujānaḥ /
analyzed: ā viṃśatyā triṃśatā yāhi arvāṅ ā catvāriṃśatā haribhiḥ yujānaḥ
translated: Come with twenty, come with thirty, come with forty, harnessed with bays;

original: ā pañcāśatā surathebhir indrā ṣaṣṭyā saptatyā somapeyam //
analyzed: ā pañcāśatā su rathebhiḥ indra ā ṣaṣṭyā saptatyā soma peyam
translated: Come with fifty, O thou of good chariots, with sixty, with seventy, to drink the Soma.

original: āśītyā navatyā yāhy arvāṅ ā śatena haribhir uhyamānaḥ /
analyzed: ā aśītyā navatyā yāhi arvāṅ ā śatena haribhiḥ uhyamānaḥ
translated: Come with eighty, come with ninety, come with a hundred, borne on the bays;

original: ayaṃ hi te śunahotreṣu soma indra tvāyā pariṣikto madāya //
analyzed: ayam hi te śunahotreṣu somaḥ indra tvāyā pariṣiktaḥ madāya
translated: For this is thy Soma, O Indra, among the Sunahotras, sprinkled around for thy rapture.

original: mama brahmendra yāhy acchā viśvā harī dhuri dhiṣvā rathasya /
analyzed: mama brahma indra yāhi acchā viśvā harī dhuri dhiṣvā rathasya
translated: Come, O Indra, to my prayer. Place the two bays of the chariot.

original: purutrā hi vihavyo babhūthāsmiñ chūra savane mādayasva //
analyzed: purutrā hi vihavyaḥ babhūtha asmin śūra savane mādayasva
translated: For thou art much invoked. Rejoice, O hero, at this libation.

original: na ma indreṇa sakhyaṃ vi yoṣad asmabhyam asya dakṣiṇā duhīta /
analyzed: na me indreṇa sakhyam vi yoṣat asmabhyam asya dakṣiṇā duhīta
translated: Let not my friendship with Indra be severed. Let him yield to us as a milch-cow his gifts.

original: upa jyeṣṭhe varūthe gabhastau prāyeprāye jigīvāṃsaḥ syāma //🔽nūnaṃ sā te prati varaṃ jaritre duhīyad indra dakṣiṇā maghonī /
analyzed: upa jyeṣṭhe varūthe gabhastau prāye prāye jigīvāṃsaḥ syāma  nūnam sā te prati varam jaritre duhīyat indra dakṣiṇā maghonī
translated: In the highest protection, in the two arms, in every contest may we be victorious.🔽This, O Indra, which is thine, the bountiful, the rich in gifts, may it yield to the singer a reward.

original: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: śikṣa stotṛbhyaḥ mā ati dhak bhagaḥ naḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: Teach us, O Indra, to win strength, let not our wealth be diminished. May we speak lofty words in the assembly, with brave sons.

original: apāyy asyāndhaso madāya manīṣiṇaḥ suvānasya prayasaḥ /🔽yasminn indraḥ pradivi vāvṛdhāna oko dadhe brahmaṇyantaś ca naraḥ //
analyzed: apāyi asya andhasaḥ madāya manīṣiṇaḥ suvānasya prayasaḥ  yasmin indraḥ pradivi vāvṛdhānaḥ okaḥ dadhe brahmaṇyantaḥ ca naraḥ
translated: To the drinking of this juice, to the gladdening, the wise one, the pressing of the juice,🔽In which Indra, grown great in the sky, has placed his abode, and the men who are devoted to prayer.

original: asya mandāno madhvo vajrahasto 'him indro arṇovṛtaṃ vi vṛścat /
analyzed: asya mandānaḥ madhvaḥ vajra hastaḥ him indraḥ arṇaḥ vṛtam vi vṛścat
translated: The wielder of the thunderbolt, rejoicing in this sweet drink, Indra has torn asunder the dragon who was surrounded by the waters.

original: pra yad vayo na svasarāṇy acchā prayāṃsi ca nadīnāṃ cakramanta //
analyzed: pra yat vayaḥ na svasarāṇi acchā prayāṃsi ca nadīnām cakramanta
translated: When he has gone to his own stations like a bird, and the courses of the rivers have been set in motion.

original: sa māhina indro arṇo apām prairayad ahihācchā samudram /
analyzed: sa māhinaḥ indraḥ arṇaḥ apām prairayat ahi hā acchā samudram
translated: That mighty Indra has sent forth the waters, the dragon-slayer, to the ocean.

original: ajanayat sūryaṃ vidad gā aktunāhnāṃ vayunāni sādhat //
analyzed: ajanayat sūryam vidat gāḥ aktunā ahnām vayunāni sādhat
translated: He has generated the sun, he has found the cows, he has accomplished the courses of the days.

original: so apratīni manave purūṇīndro dāśad dāśuṣe hanti vṛtram /
analyzed: saḥ apratīni manave purūṇi indraḥ dāśat dāśuṣe hanti vṛtram
translated: He, Indra, has given to Manu many boons, to the worshipper he has slain Vrtra.

original: sadyo yo nṛbhyo atasāyyo bhūt paspṛdhānebhyaḥ sūryasya sātau //
analyzed: sadyas yaḥ nṛbhyaḥ atasāyyaḥ bhūt paspṛdhānebhyaḥ sūryasya sātau
translated: He who is to be invoked by men, has become the most impetuous in the race for the sun.

original: sa sunvata indraḥ sūryam ā devo riṇaṅ martyāya stavān /
analyzed: sa sunvate indraḥ sūryam ā devaḥ riṇak martyāya stavān
translated: That Indra, the God, when pressed, has loosed the sun for the mortal whom he exalts,

original: ā yad rayiṃ guhadavadyam asmai bharad aṃśaṃ naitaśo daśasyan //
analyzed: ā yat rayim guhadavadyam asmai bharat aṃśam na etaśaḥ daśasyan
translated: When he brings him wealth that is free from reproach, and favours him like a friend.

original: sa randhayat sadivaḥ sārathaye śuṣṇam aśuṣaṃ kuyavaṃ kutsāya /
analyzed: sa randhayat sadivas sārathaye śuṣṇam aśuṣam kuyavam kutsāya
translated: He gave to Kutsa, to the charioteer of the people, to crush, to slay, to burn up,

original: divodāsāya navatiṃ ca navendraḥ puro vy airac chambarasya //
analyzed: divodāsāya navatim ca nava indraḥ puraḥ vi airat śambarasya
translated: To Divodasa, O Indra, he gave the ninety-nine forts of Samvara.

original: evā ta indrocatham ahema śravasyā na tmanā vājayantaḥ /
analyzed: eva te indra ucatham ahema śravasyā na tmanā vājayantaḥ
translated: Thus, O Indra, we have glorified thee, striving to win glory by our own strength.

original: aśyāma tat sāptam āśuṣāṇā nanamo vadhar adevasya pīyoḥ //
analyzed: aśyāma tat sāptam āśuṣāṇāḥ nanamaḥ vadhar adevasya pīyoḥ
translated: May we obtain that seventh step of thine, O thou who art to be invoked by those who strive, the destruction of the weapon of the godless.

original: evā te gṛtsamadāḥ śūra manmāvasyavo na vayunāni takṣuḥ /
analyzed: eva te gṛtsamadāḥ śūra manmā avasyavaḥ na vayunāni takṣuḥ
translated: Thus, O hero, the Gritsamadas, with their own thoughts, have fashioned for thee these hymns.

original: brahmaṇyanta indra te navīya iṣam ūrjaṃ sukṣitiṃ sumnam aśyuḥ //
analyzed: brahmaṇyantaḥ indra te navīyaḥ iṣam ūrjam su kṣitim sumnam aśyuḥ
translated: May they, O Indra, be new to thee, and bring thee food, strength, good abode, and bliss.

original: nūnaṃ sā te prati varaṃ jaritre duhīyad indra dakṣiṇā maghonī /🔽śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: nūnam sā te prati varam jaritre duhīyat indra dakṣiṇā maghonī  śikṣa stotṛbhyaḥ mā ati dhak bhagaḥ naḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: Now, indeed, that bountiful Dakshina of thine, O Indra, should yield a reward to the singer.🔽Teach us, O Indra, to win the prize, and let not our fortune fail us. May we speak loftily in the assembly, with brave sons.

original: vayaṃ te vaya indra viddhi ṣu ṇaḥ pra bharāmahe vājayur na ratham /
analyzed: vayam te vayaḥ indra viddhi su naḥ pra bharāmahe vājayuḥ na ratham
translated: We are thy people, O Indra; know us well. We harness ourselves to thee, as to a chariot to win the prize.

original: vipanyavo dīdhyato manīṣā sumnam iyakṣantas tvāvato nṝn //
analyzed: vipanyavaḥ dīdhyataḥ manīṣā sumnam iyakṣantaḥ tvāvataḥ nṝn
translated: The thoughts of the wise are directed to you, the men who long for bliss from you who are rich in gifts.

original: tvaṃ na indra tvābhir ūtī tvāyato abhiṣṭipāsi janān /
analyzed: tvam naḥ indra ūtī tvāyataḥ abhiṣṭi pā asi janān
translated: You, O Indra, with your aids, being stretched out, protect the people.

original: tvam ino dāśuṣo varūtetthādhīr abhi yo nakṣati tvā //
analyzed: tvam inaḥ dāśuṣaḥ varūtā itthā dhīḥ abhi yaḥ nakṣati tvā
translated: You, O lord, in the protection of the worshipper, are the overseer of him who will not serve you.

original: sa no yuvendro johūtraḥ sakhā śivo narām astu pātā /
analyzed: sa naḥ yuvā indraḥ johūtraḥ sakhā śivaḥ narām astu pātā
translated: Be that Indra, the invocator, the friend, the auspicious protector of men.

original: yaḥ śaṃsantaṃ yaḥ śaśamānam ūtī pacantaṃ ca stuvantaṃ ca praṇeṣat //
analyzed: yaḥ śaṃsantam yaḥ śaśamānam ūtī pacantam ca stuvantam ca praṇeṣat
translated: Who will lead to us the one who praises, the one who strives, the one who is helped, the one who cooks and the one who sings.

original: tam u stuṣa indraṃ taṃ gṛṇīṣe yasmin purā vāvṛdhuḥ śāśaduś ca /
analyzed: tam u stuṣe indram tam gṛṇīṣe yasmin purā vāvṛdhuḥ śāśaduḥ ca
translated: I praise that Indra, I sing his praises, in whom in the past they have grown strong and rejoiced.

original: sa vasvaḥ kāmam pīparad iyāno brahmaṇyato nūtanasyāyoḥ //
analyzed: sa vasvaḥ kāmam pīparat iyānaḥ brahmaṇyataḥ nūtanasya āyoḥ
translated: May he, the lord of wealth, grant the desire of the one who is striving, of the one who is devoted to prayer, of the one who is new and young.

original: so aṅgirasām ucathā jujuṣvān brahmā tūtod indro gātum iṣṇan /
analyzed: saḥ aṅgirasām ucathā jujuṣvān brahmā tūtot indraḥ gātum iṣṇan
translated: He, the Brahman, was accepted by the Angirases, Indra, the goer, was urged on by the singers.

original: muṣṇann uṣasaḥ sūryeṇa stavān aśnasya cic chiśnathat pūrvyāṇi //
analyzed: muṣṇan uṣasaḥ sūryeṇa stavān aśnasya cit śiśnathat pūrvyāṇi
translated: Shining with the sun on the dawns, he has shattered the ancient works of Asna.

original: sa ha śruta indro nāma deva ūrdhvo bhuvan manuṣe dasmatamaḥ /
analyzed: sa ha śrutaḥ indraḥ nāma devaḥ ūrdhvaḥ bhuvat manuṣe dasmatamaḥ
translated: He, indeed, is the famous Indra, the god, standing erect, most wonderful to men.

original: ava priyam arśasānasya sāhvāñ chiro bharad dāsasya svadhāvān //
analyzed: ava priyam arśasānasya sāhvām chiraḥ bharat dāsasya svadhāvān
translated: The self-existent one has brought down the head of the beloved Arsasâhna, the Dâsa.

original: sa vṛtrahendraḥ kṛṣṇayonīḥ purandaro dāsīr airayad vi /
analyzed: sa vṛtrahā indraḥ kṛṣṇa yonīḥ purandaraḥ dāsīḥ airayat vi
translated: That Indra, the slayer of Vṛtra, has brought the Kṛiṣṇayoni (tribes) into subjection, and the Dāsas into slavery.

original: ajanayan manave kṣām apaś ca satrā śaṃsaṃ yajamānasya tūtot //
analyzed: ajanayat manave kṣām apaḥ ca satrā śaṃsam yajamānasya tūtot
translated: He has generated the earth and the waters for Manu. He has always fulfilled the sacrificer's wish.

original: tasmai tavasyam anu dāyi satrendrāya devebhir arṇasātau /
analyzed: tasmai tavasyam anu dāyi satrā indrāya devebhiḥ arṇa sātau
translated: To him, to Indra, for the sake of the sacrifice, wealth has been given together with the gods.

original: prati yad asya vajram bāhvor dhur hatvī dasyūn pura āyasīr ni tārīt //
analyzed: prati yat asya vajram bāhvoḥ dhuḥ hatvī dasyūn puraḥ āyasīḥ ni tārīt
translated: When his thunderbolt is firmly fixed in his arms, he, the slayer, has destroyed the Dasyus and opened the iron doors.

original: nūnaṃ sā te prati varaṃ jaritre duhīyad indra dakṣiṇā maghonī /
analyzed: nūnam sā te prati varam jaritre duhīyat indra dakṣiṇā maghonī
translated: That same (wealth) of yours, O Indra, which yields abundant gifts, should yield a reward to the worshipper, O bountiful one.

original: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //🔽viśvajite dhanajite svarjite satrājite nṛjita urvarājite /🔽aśvajite gojite abjite bharendrāya somaṃ yajatāya haryatam //
analyzed: śikṣa stotṛbhyaḥ mā ati dhak bhagaḥ naḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ  viśva jite dhana jite svar jite satrā jite nṛ jite urvarā jite  aśva jite go jite ap jite bhara indrāya somam yajatāya haryatam
translated: Do not disregard the praisers. Let our good fortune be great. May we speak lofty words in the assembly, with brave sons.🔽To the conqueror of all, the conqueror of wealth, the conqueror of heaven, the conqueror of the sacrifice, the conqueror of men, the conqueror of the wide earth,🔽To the conqueror of horses, the conqueror of cows, the conqueror of waters, to Indra, to the Soma-drinking, to the tawny one, offer.

original: abhibhuve 'bhibhaṅgāya vanvate 'ṣāḷhāya sahamānāya vedhase /
analyzed: abhibhuve bhibhaṅgāya vanvate ṣāḷhāya sahamānāya vedhase
translated: To the overcomer, the conqueror, the victorious, the mighty, the wise,

original: tuvigraye vahnaye duṣṭarītave satrāsāhe nama indrāya vocata //
analyzed: tuvigraye vahnaye duṣṭarītave satrāsāhe namaḥ indrāya vocata
translated: To the powerful, the burning, the hard to subdue, the fearless, to Indra offer homage.

original: satrāsāho janabhakṣo janaṃsahaś cyavano yudhmo anu joṣam ukṣitaḥ /
analyzed: satrā sāhaḥ jana bhakṣaḥ janaṃsahaḥ cyavanaḥ yudhmaḥ anu joṣam ukṣitaḥ
translated: The fearless, the people-devouring, the people-conquering, the one who was cast down, the warrior, sprinkled according to his desire,

original: vṛtañcayaḥ sahurir vikṣv ārita indrasya vocam pra kṛtāni vīryā //
analyzed: vṛtañcayaḥ sahuriḥ vikṣu āritaḥ indrasya vocam pra kṛtāni vīryā
translated: The one who is surrounded, the powerful one, who is praised in many places, I will proclaim Indra's deeds and his heroic exploits.

original: anānudo vṛṣabho dodhato vadho gambhīra ṛṣvo asamaṣṭakāvyaḥ /
analyzed: anānudaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ dodhataḥ vadhaḥ gambhīraḥ ṛṣvaḥ a samaṣṭa kāvyaḥ
translated: The unvanquished bull, the killer of the rushing (enemy), deep, lofty, of incomparable power,

original: radhracodaḥ śnathano vīḷitas pṛthur indraḥ suyajña uṣasaḥ svar janat //
analyzed: radhra codaḥ śnathanaḥ vīḍitaḥ pṛthuḥ indraḥ su yajñaḥ uṣasaḥ svar janat
translated: the one who impels the slow, the one who cuts asunder, the wide one, Indra, the one with good sacrifices, has created the light of the dawns.

original: yajñena gātum apturo vividrire dhiyo hinvānā uśijo manīṣiṇaḥ /🔽abhisvarā niṣadā gā avasyava indre hinvānā draviṇāny āśata //
analyzed: yajñena gātum apturaḥ vividrire dhiyaḥ hinvānāḥ uśijaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ  abhisvarā niṣadā gāḥ avasyavaḥ indre hinvānāḥ draviṇāni āśata
translated: The swift ones, the wise ones, with their thoughts urging them on, have opened up a path with the sacrifice.🔽The singers, the reciters, the ones who seek help, have urged on Indra, and have obtained riches.

original: indra śreṣṭhāni draviṇāni dhehi cittiṃ dakṣasya subhagatvam asme /
analyzed: indra śreṣṭhāni draviṇāni dhehi cittim dakṣasya subhaga tvam asme
translated: O Indra, bestow the best riches upon us, the mind of Daksha, and good fortune.

original: poṣaṃ rayīṇām ariṣṭiṃ tanūnāṃ svādmānaṃ vācaḥ sudinatvam ahnām //
analyzed: poṣam rayīṇām ariṣṭim tanūnām svādmānam vācaḥ sudina tvam ahnām
translated: The nourishment of the wealth, the protection of the bodies, the sweetness of speech, and the goodness of the days.

original: trikadrukeṣu mahiṣo yavāśiraṃ tuviśuṣmas tṛpat somam apibad viṣṇunā sutaṃ yathāvaśat /
analyzed: trikadrukeṣu mahiṣaḥ yava āśiram tuvi śuṣmaḥ tṛpat somam apibat viṣṇunā sutam yathā vaśat
translated: On the Trikadrukas, the bull, the one who eats barley, the mighty one, has drunk the Soma to his fill, the one pressed by Vishnu, as he desired.

original: sa īm mamāda mahi karma kartave mahām uruṃ sainaṃ saścad devo devaṃ satyam indraṃ satya induḥ //
analyzed: saḥ īm mamāda mahi karma kartave mahām urum sa enam saścat devaḥ devam satyam indram satyaḥ induḥ
translated: He has drunk it to perform great deeds, the great one, the wide one, the god, the true Indra, the true Indu has followed him.

original: adha tviṣīmāṃ abhy ojasā kriviṃ yudhābhavad ā rodasī apṛṇad asya majmanā pra vāvṛdhe /
analyzed: adha tviṣī imām abhī ojasā krivim yudhā abhavat ā rodasī apṛṇat asya majmanā pra vāvṛdhe
translated: Then he, with his splendour and might, became victorious in battle; he filled the two world-halves with his greatness; he grew in strength.

original: adhattānyaṃ jaṭhare prem aricyata sainaṃ saścad devo devaṃ satyam indraṃ satya induḥ //
analyzed: adhatta anyam jaṭhare pra īm aricyata sa enam saścat devaḥ devam satyam indram satyaḥ induḥ
translated: He gave him another in his belly; he went forth. The god, the true one, followed the god, the true Indra, the true Moon.

original: sākaṃ jātaḥ kratunā sākam ojasā vavakṣitha sākaṃ vṛddho vīryaiḥ sāsahir mṛdho vicarṣaṇiḥ /
analyzed: sākam jātaḥ kratunā sākam ojasā vavakṣitha sākam vṛddhaḥ vīryaiḥ sāsahiḥ mṛdhaḥ vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: Born together with power, together with strength you have grown; together with manly powers you have grown, the all-conquering one, the swift one, over the enemies.

original: dātā rādha stuvate kāmyaṃ vasu sainaṃ saścad devo devaṃ satyam indraṃ satya induḥ //
analyzed: dātā rādha stuvate kāmyam vasu sa enam saścat devaḥ devam satyam indram satyaḥ induḥ
translated: The giver of wealth, of desirable wealth, to the praiser. The god, the true one, followed the god, the true Indra, the true Moon.

original: tava tyan naryaṃ nṛto 'pa indra prathamam pūrvyaṃ divi pravācyaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: tava tyad naryam nṛto pa indra prathamam pūrvyam divi pravācyam kṛtam
translated: That manly deed of yours, O Indra, the dancer, the first, the ancient, to be proclaimed in heaven,

original: yad devasya śavasā prāriṇā asuṃ riṇann apaḥ /
analyzed: yat devasya śavasā prāriṇāḥ asum riṇan apaḥ
translated: When by the power of the god you drove away the Asura and let loose the waters,

original: bhuvad viśvam abhy ādevam ojasā vidād ūrjaṃ śatakratur vidād iṣam //
analyzed: bhuvat viśvam abhī ā a devam ojasā vidāt ūrjam śatakratuḥ vidāt iṣam
translated: You became all-surpassing by your might, the god. Shatakratu found food and strength, found nourishment.

original: gaṇānāṃ tvā gaṇapatiṃ havāmahe kaviṃ kavīnām upamaśravastamam /
analyzed: gaṇānām tvā gaṇa patim havāmahe kavim kavīnām upamaśravastamam
translated: We call you, the lord of the bands, the leader of the bands, the sage of the sages, most renowned.

original: jyeṣṭharājam brahmaṇām brahmaṇas pata ā naḥ śṛṇvann ūtibhiḥ sīda sādanam //
analyzed: jyeṣṭharājam brahmaṇām brahmaṇas pate ā naḥ śṛṇvan ūtibhiḥ sīda sādanam
translated: The eldest king of the Brahmans, O Brahmanaspati, sit in your seat, listening to us with your aids.

original: devāś cit te asurya pracetaso bṛhaspate yajñiyam bhāgam ānaśuḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ cit te asurya pracetasaḥ bṛhaspate yajñiyam bhāgam ānaśuḥ
translated: Even the gods, O Asura, the wise, O Brihaspati, have brought thee thy share in the sacrifice.

original: usrā iva sūryo jyotiṣā maho viśveṣām ij janitā brahmaṇām asi //
analyzed: usrāḥ iva sūryaḥ jyotiṣā mahaḥ viśveṣām id janitā brahmaṇām asi
translated: Like the two Dawns, the Sun with his light, thou art the great progenitor of all the Brahmans.

original: ā vibādhyā parirāpas tamāṃsi ca jyotiṣmantaṃ ratham ṛtasya tiṣṭhasi /
analyzed: ā vibādhya parirāpaḥ tamāṃsi ca jyotiṣmantam ratham ṛtasya tiṣṭhasi
translated: Thou passest over the obstacles, the reproaches, the darkness; thou sittest in the luminous car of truth.

original: bṛhaspate bhīmam amitradambhanaṃ rakṣohaṇaṃ gotrabhidaṃ svarvidam //
analyzed: bṛhaspate bhīmam amitra dambhanam rakṣaḥ haṇam gotra bhidam svar vidam
translated: O Brihaspati, thou art terrible, subduing the enemy's pride, slaying the Rakshas, cleaving the cow-stalls, finding the light.

original: sunītibhir nayasi trāyase janaṃ yas tubhyaṃ dāśān na tam aṃho aśnavat /
analyzed: su nītibhiḥ nayasi trāyase janam yaḥ tubhyam dāśāt na tam aṃhaḥ aśnavat
translated: By good counsels thou leadest, thou savest the people; no misfortune befalls him who gives to thee.

original: brahmadviṣas tapano manyumīr asi bṛhaspate mahi tat te mahitvanam //
analyzed: brahma dviṣaḥ tapanaḥ manyumīḥ asi bṛhaspate mahi tat te mahitvanam
translated: Thou burnest the haters of prayer, thou art wrathful, O Brihaspati; great is that greatness of thine.

original: na tam aṃho na duritaṃ kutaś cana nārātayas titirur na dvayāvinaḥ /🔽viśvā id asmād dhvaraso vi bādhase yaṃ sugopā rakṣasi brahmaṇas pate //🔽tvaṃ no gopāḥ pathikṛd vicakṣaṇas tava vratāya matibhir jarāmahe /
analyzed: na tam aṃhaḥ na duritam kutas cana na arātayaḥ titiruḥ na dvayāvinaḥ  viśvāḥ id asmāt dhvarasaḥ vi bādhase yam su gopāḥ rakṣasi brahmaṇas pate  tvam naḥ gopāḥ pathikṛt vicakṣaṇaḥ tava vratāya matibhiḥ jarāmahe
translated: No misfortune, no evil from any side, no reproaches, no double-tongued slanderers have power over him.🔽All the sorcerers thou keepest far away from him whom thou, O Brahmanaspati, guardest well.🔽Thou art our guardian, O thou that makest paths, O thou that art all-seeing; for thy service we strive with our thoughts.

original: bṛhaspate yo no abhi hvaro dadhe svā tam marmartu ducchunā harasvatī //
analyzed: bṛhaspate yaḥ naḥ abhi hvaraḥ dadhe svā tam marmartu ducchunā harasvatī
translated: O Brihaspati, him who against us hath raised a weapon, him, O thou that art swift with evil, slay with thy dart.

original: uta vā yo no marcayād anāgaso 'rātīvā martaḥ sānuko vṛkaḥ /
analyzed: uta vā yaḥ naḥ marcayāt anāgasaḥ rātīvā martaḥ sānukaḥ vṛkaḥ
translated: Or if a man, innocent, should attack us, a wolf with a following, as it were, with evil intent,

original: bṛhaspate apa taṃ vartayā pathaḥ sugaṃ no asyai devavītaye kṛdhi //
analyzed: bṛhaspate apa tam vartaya pathaḥ sugam naḥ asyai deva vītaye kṛdhi
translated: Turn him away, O Brihaspati, from this path, and make it easy for us to reach this feast of the gods.

original: trātāraṃ tvā tanūnāṃ havāmahe 'vaspartar adhivaktāram asmayum /
analyzed: trātāram tvā tanūnām havāmahe vaspartar adhivaktāram asmayum
translated: We invoke thee as the protector of our bodies, the supporter, the overseer, the friend of the house.

original: bṛhaspate devanido ni barhaya mā durevā uttaraṃ sumnam un naśan //
analyzed: bṛhaspate deva nidaḥ ni barhaya mā durevāḥ uttaram sumnam ud naśan
translated: O Brihaspati, crush the enemies of the gods, and let not the evil-minded one find pleasure in the next world.

original: tvayā vayaṃ suvṛdhā brahmaṇas pate spārhā vasu manuṣyā dadīmahi /
analyzed: tvayā vayam suvṛdhā brahmaṇas pate spārhā vasu manuṣyāḥ dadīmahi
translated: Through thee, O thou of good gifts, O lord of prayer, we men shall obtain desirable wealth.

original: yā no dūre taḷito yā arātayo 'bhi santi jambhayā tā anapnasaḥ //
analyzed: yāḥ naḥ dūre taḷitaḥ yāḥ arātayaḥ bhi santi jambhaya tāḥ anapnasaḥ
translated: Those who are far away, those who are near, those who are unfriendly, crush them, O thou of boundless might.

original: tvayā vayam uttamaṃ dhīmahe vayo bṛhaspate papriṇā sasninā yujā /
analyzed: tvayā vayam uttamam vayaḥ bṛhaspate papriṇā sasninā yujā
translated: Through thee, O Brihaspati, we desire the highest life, through thee, the bountiful, through thee, the strong, as a companion.

original: mā no duḥśaṃso abhidipsur īśata pra suśaṃsā matibhis tāriṣīmahi //
analyzed: mā naḥ duḥśaṃsaḥ abhidipsuḥ īśata pra su śaṃsāḥ matibhiḥ tāriṣīmahi
translated: Let not the evil-speaking one who desires to injure us prevail over us. Through good counsels may we be delivered.

original: anānudo vṛṣabho jagmir āhavaṃ niṣṭaptā śatrum pṛtanāsu sāsahiḥ /
analyzed: anānudaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ jagmiḥ āhavam niṣṭaptā śatrum pṛtanāsu sāsahiḥ
translated: The bull who goes to battle without being urged, who scorches the enemy in battles, who conquers,

original: asi satya ṛṇayā brahmaṇas pata ugrasya cid damitā vīḷuharṣiṇaḥ //
analyzed: asi satyaḥ ṛṇayāḥ brahmaṇas pate ugrasya cit damitā vīḍu harṣiṇaḥ
translated: Thou art true, O lord of prayer, even to the fierce one who makes the hair stand on end, who is restrained.

original: adevena manasā yo riṣaṇyati śāsām ugro manyamāno jighāṃsati /
analyzed: adevena manasā yaḥ riṣaṇyati śāsām ugraḥ manyamānaḥ jighāṃsati
translated: He who with godless mind threatens the chastisers, the mighty one who, thinking himself strong, desires to kill.

original: bṛhaspate mā praṇak tasya no vadho ni karma manyuṃ durevasya śardhataḥ //
analyzed: bṛhaspate mā praṇak tasya naḥ vadhaḥ ni karma manyum durevasya śardhataḥ
translated: Let not his death, O Brihaspati, be ours. Turn away the wrath of the evil-working, impetuous one.

original: bhareṣu havyo namasopasadyo gantā vājeṣu sanitā dhanaṃdhanam /
analyzed: bhareṣu havyaḥ namasā upasadyaḥ gantā vājeṣu sanitā dhanaṃdhanam
translated: In battles he is to be invoked, to be worshipped with reverence, he goes to gain wealth in contests, to win riches.

original: viśvā id aryo abhidipsvo mṛdho bṛhaspatir vi vavarhā rathāṃ iva //
analyzed: viśvāḥ id aryaḥ abhidipsvaḥ mṛdhaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ vi vavarha rathān iva
translated: All the hostile, greedy, violent enemies, Brihaspati has scattered like chariots.

original: tejiṣṭhayā tapanī rakṣasas tapa ye tvā nide dadhire dṛṣṭavīryam /
analyzed: tejiṣṭhayā tapanī rakṣasaḥ tapa ye tvā nide dadhire dṛṣṭa vīryam
translated: With the most fiery heat, burn up the Rakshasas, who have placed their trust in thee, who have seen thy valour.

original: āvis tat kṛṣva yad asat ta ukthyam bṛhaspate vi parirāpo ardaya //🔽bṛhaspate ati yad aryo arhād dyumad vibhāti kratumaj janeṣu /
analyzed: āvis tat kṛṣva yat asat te ukthyam bṛhaspate vi parirāpaḥ ardaya  bṛhaspate ati yat aryaḥ arhāt dyumat vibhāti kratumat janeṣu
translated: Make manifest that which is worthy of praise in thee, O Brihaspati, and break through the encircling barriers.🔽O Brihaspati, when the foe hath passed beyond the reach of the strong,

original: yad dīdayac chavasa ṛtaprajāta tad asmāsu draviṇaṃ dhehi citram //🔽mā na stenebhyo ye abhi druhas pade nirāmiṇo ripavo 'nneṣu jāgṛdhuḥ /
analyzed: yat dīdayat śavasaḥ ṛta prajāta tat asmāsu draviṇam dhehi citram  mā naḥ stenebhyaḥ ye abhi druhaḥ pade nirāmiṇaḥ ripavaḥ nneṣu jāgṛdhuḥ
translated: when he hath shone forth in glory among the people, when he hath shone forth in strength, O thou of holy birth, bestow on us that wondrous wealth.🔽Let not the thieves, the enemies who lie in wait in the treacherous path, the niggardly foes, watch over our food.

original: ā devānām ohate vi vrayo hṛdi bṛhaspate na paraḥ sāmno viduḥ //
analyzed: ā devānām ohate vi vrayaḥ hṛdi bṛhaspate na paraḥ sāmnaḥ viduḥ
translated: The thoughts of the gods are in the heart. O Brihaspati, none knoweth the hymn better than thou.

original: viśvebhyo hi tvā bhuvanebhyas pari tvaṣṭājanat sāmnaḥsāmnaḥ kaviḥ /
analyzed: viśvebhyaḥ hi tvā bhuvanebhyaḥ pari tvaṣṭā ajanat sāmnaḥ sāmnaḥ kaviḥ
translated: For thee, verily, Tvashtar hath generated from all the worlds, the sage from each several hymn,

original: sa ṛṇacid ṛṇayā brahmaṇas patir druho hantā maha ṛtasya dhartari //🔽tava śriye vy ajihīta parvato gavāṃ gotram udasṛjo yad aṅgiraḥ /
analyzed: saḥ ṛṇa cit ṛṇayāḥ brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ druhaḥ hantā mahaḥ ṛtasya dhartari  tava śriye vi ajihīta parvataḥ gavām gotram udasṛjaḥ yat aṅgiraḥ
translated: The lord of prayer, who knoweth well the debt, the slayer of the foe, the great supporter of holy law.🔽For thy glory hath the mountain been extended: thou hast let loose the herd of kine, O Angiras.

original: indreṇa yujā tamasā parīvṛtam bṛhaspate nir apām aubjo arṇavam //
analyzed: indreṇa yujā tamasā parīvṛtam bṛhaspate niḥ apām aubjaḥ arṇavam
translated: With Indra for ally thou, Brihaspati, hast burst the cloud-encompassed watery prison.

original: brahmaṇas pate tvam asya yantā sūktasya bodhi tanayaṃ ca jinva /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ pate tvam asya yantā sūktasya bodhi tanayam ca jinva
translated: O Brahmanaspati, thou art the leader of this hymn: be thou the prosperer of this my son.

original: viśvaṃ tad bhadraṃ yad avanti devā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: viśvam tat bhadram yat avanti devāḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: All that the Gods have in their keeping is auspicious: with heroic sons let us speak lofty things in our assemblies.

original: semām aviḍḍhi prabhṛtiṃ ya īśiṣe 'yā vidhema navayā mahā girā /🔽yathā no mīḍhvān stavate sakhā tava bṛhaspate sīṣadhaḥ sota no matim //
analyzed: sa imām aviḍḍhi prabhṛtim yaḥ īśiṣe yā vidhema navayā mahā girā  yathā naḥ mīḍhvān stavate sakhā tava bṛhaspate sīṣadhaḥ sa uta naḥ matim
translated: This is the favour which thou hast to grant, O thou who hast the power: we will serve thee with a new great song.🔽As thy friend, O Brihaspati, may he praise us well: further thou our prayer.

original: yo nantvāny anaman ny ojasotādardar manyunā śambarāṇi vi /
analyzed: yaḥ nantvāni anamat ni ojasā uta adardar manyunā śambarāṇi vi
translated: Thou who hast bent the unbending with thy might, hast with thy wrath shattered the forts of Shamvara.

original: prācyāvayad acyutā brahmaṇas patir ā cāviśad vasumantaṃ vi parvatam //
analyzed: prācyāvayat acyutā brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ ā ca aviśat vasumantam vi parvatam
translated: Brahmanaspati hath shaken the immovable, and hath entered the rich mountain with his might.

original: tad devānāṃ devatamāya kartvam aśrathnan dṛḷhāvradanta vīḷitā /🔽ud gā ājad abhinad brahmaṇā valam agūhat tamo vy acakṣayat svaḥ //
analyzed: tat devānām devatamāya kartvam aśrathnan dṛḍhā avradanta vīḍitā  ud gāḥ ājat abhinat brahmaṇā valam agūhat tamaḥ vi acakṣayat svar
translated: That which is to be done for the gods, the best of gods, they have stretched out, the firm-jawed, the strong.🔽The cow has risen up, with holy power has burst the stronghold, has covered the darkness, has revealed the light.

original: aśmāsyam avatam brahmaṇas patir madhudhāram abhi yam ojasātṛṇat /
analyzed: aśma āsyam avatam brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ madhu dhāram abhi yam ojasā atṛṇat
translated: Brahmanaspati has thrown down the stone, which he, with his might, has cleft, the honey-flowing.

original: tam eva viśve papire svardṛśo bahu sākaṃ sisicur utsam udriṇam //
analyzed: tam eva viśve papire svar dṛśaḥ bahu sākam sisicuḥ utsam udriṇam
translated: All have drunk of it, the seers of heaven. They have poured forth together the stream of the spring.

original: sanā tā kā cid bhuvanā bhavītvā mādbhiḥ śaradbhir duro varanta vaḥ /
analyzed: sanā tā kā cit bhuvanā bhavītvā mādbhiḥ śaradbhiḥ duraḥ varanta vaḥ
translated: Some of the existing worlds have been, and some will be, by the waters, in the autumn, they will choose you.

original: ayatantā carato anyadanyad id yā cakāra vayunā brahmaṇas patiḥ //
analyzed: a yatantā carataḥ anyat anyat id yā cakāra vayunā brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: They move, each one to a different place, the one who has made the various forms, Brahmanaspati.

original: abhinakṣanto abhi ye tam ānaśur nidhim paṇīnām paramaṃ guhā hitam /
analyzed: abhinakṣantaḥ abhi ye tam ānaśuḥ nidhim paṇīnām paramam guhā hitam
translated: They who have seized him, who have brought him forward, the treasure of the Panis, hidden in the highest place,

original: te vidvāṃsaḥ praticakṣyānṛtā punar yata u āyan tad ud īyur āviśam //
analyzed: te vidvāṃsaḥ praticakṣya anṛtā punar yatas u āyan tat ud īyuḥ āviśam
translated: The wise ones, having looked at the untrue again, have gone back to where they came from, to the house.

original: ṛtāvānaḥ praticakṣyānṛtā punar āta ā tasthuḥ kavayo mahas pathaḥ /
analyzed: ṛtāvānaḥ praticakṣya anṛtā punar ā atas ā tasthuḥ kavayaḥ mahaḥ pathaḥ
translated: The truthful ones, having looked at the untrue again, have stood on the great path, the wise ones.

original: te bāhubhyāṃ dhamitam agnim aśmani nakiḥ ṣo asty araṇo jahur hi tam //
analyzed: te bāhubhyām dhamitam agnim aśmani nakir ṣaḥ asti araṇaḥ jahuḥ hi tam
translated: With their arms they have shaken the fire on the stone. None has found the way to it. They have left it.

original: ṛtajyena kṣipreṇa brahmaṇas patir yatra vaṣṭi pra tad aśnoti dhanvanā /
analyzed: ṛta jyena kṣipreṇa brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ yatra vaṣṭi pra tat aśnoti dhanvanā
translated: With the string of truth, with the swift one, with the bow of Brahman, where the lord of prayer shoots, he reaches with it.

original: tasya sādhvīr iṣavo yābhir asyati nṛcakṣaso dṛśaye karṇayonayaḥ //
analyzed: tasya sādhvīḥ iṣavaḥ yābhiḥ asyati nṛ cakṣasaḥ dṛśaye karṇa yonayaḥ
translated: His arrows are good, with which he shoots, the eye-seeing, the ear-born, for the sight.

original: sa saṃnayaḥ sa vinayaḥ purohitaḥ sa suṣṭutaḥ sa yudhi brahmaṇas patiḥ /
analyzed: sa saṃnayaḥ sa vinayaḥ purohitaḥ sa suṣṭutaḥ sa yudhi brahmaṇas patiḥ
translated: He is the one to be brought together, the one to be brought apart, the priest, he is well praised, in battle the lord of prayer.

original: cākṣmo yad vājam bharate matī dhanād it sūryas tapati tapyatur vṛthā //
analyzed: cākṣmaḥ yat vājam bharate matī dhanāt id sūryaḥ tapati tapyatuḥ vṛthā
translated: When he brings the prize, the thought, the wealth, then the sun shines, the two burn in vain.

original: vibhu prabhu prathamam mehanāvato bṛhaspateḥ suvidatrāṇi rādhyā /
analyzed: vibhu prabhu prathamam mehanāvataḥ bṛhaspateḥ suvidatrāṇi rādhyā
translated: The all-pervading lord, the first to rain, the well-disposed favors of Brihaspati I obtain.

original: imā sātāni venyasya vājino yena janā ubhaye bhuñjate viśaḥ //
analyzed: imā sātāni venyasya vājinaḥ yena janau ubhaye bhuñjate viśaḥ
translated: These enjoyments of the active one, the strong one, by whom both peoples and clans enjoy.

original: yo 'vare vṛjane viśvathā vibhur mahām u raṇvaḥ śavasā vavakṣitha /
analyzed: yaḥ vare vṛjane viśvathā vibhuḥ mahān u raṇvaḥ śavasā vavakṣitha
translated: He who in the lower abode is all-pervading, who has grown great with might, the kindly one.

original: sa devo devān prati paprathe pṛthu viśved u tā paribhūr brahmaṇas patiḥ //🔽viśvaṃ satyam maghavānā yuvor id āpaś cana pra minanti vrataṃ vām /
analyzed: sa devaḥ devān prati paprathe pṛthu viśvā id u tā paribhūḥ brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ  viśvam satyam maghavānā yuvoḥ id āpaḥ cana pra minanti vratam vām
translated: That god has extended himself to the gods, all around is the overlord, the lord of prayer.🔽All truth is yours, O bountiful ones, the waters do not transgress your vow.

original: acchendrābrahmaṇaspatī havir no 'nnaṃ yujeva vājinā jigātam //
analyzed: acchā indrābrahmaṇaspatī haviḥ naḥ nnam yujā iva vājinā jigātam
translated: Come to our offering, O Indra and Brahmanaspati, as if yoking strong horses, come to our food.

original: utāśiṣṭhā anu śṛṇvanti vahnayaḥ sabheyo vipro bharate matī dhanā /
analyzed: uta āśiṣṭhāḥ anu śṛṇvanti vahnayaḥ sabheyaḥ vipraḥ bharate matī dhanā
translated: And the most powerful ones listen to the calls, the priest in the assembly praises with his thoughts and wealth.

original: vīḷudveṣā anu vaśa ṛṇam ādadiḥ sa ha vājī samithe brahmaṇas patiḥ //
analyzed: vīḷu dveṣāḥ anu vaśe ṛṇam ādadiḥ sa ha vājī samithe brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: The one who hates Vṛtra follows the debt, he is the powerful one in the battle, the lord of prayer.

original: brahmaṇas pater abhavad yathāvaśaṃ satyo manyur mahi karmā kariṣyataḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ pateḥ abhavat yathāvaśam satyaḥ manyuḥ mahi karmā kariṣyataḥ
translated: He became as he wished of the lord of prayer, true is the anger of the one who will do great deeds.

original: yo gā udājat sa dive vi cābhajan mahīva rītiḥ śavasāsarat pṛthak //
analyzed: yaḥ gāḥ udājat sa dive vi ca abhajat mahī iva rītiḥ śavasā asarat pṛthak
translated: He who milked out the cows, he divided them for heaven, he went forth separately with might like a great mountain.

original: brahmaṇas pate suyamasya viśvahā rāyaḥ syāma rathyo vayasvataḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇas pate su yamasya viśvahā rāyaḥ syāma rathyaḥ vayasvataḥ
translated: O lord of prayer, may we always have the wealth of the one who is easy to invoke, the wealth that is worthy of a chariot and full of life.

original: vīreṣu vīrāṃ upa pṛṅdhi nas tvaṃ yad īśāno brahmaṇā veṣi me havam //
analyzed: vīreṣu vīrān upa pṛṅdhi naḥ tvam yat īśānaḥ brahmaṇā veṣi me havam
translated: You who are the lord, bestow upon us heroes among the heroes, when you, by prayer, accept my invocation.

original: brahmaṇas pate tvam asya yantā sūktasya bodhi tanayaṃ ca jinva /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ pate tvam asya yantā sūktasya bodhi tanayam ca jinva
translated: O lord of prayer, you are the leader of this hymn, and you quicken the son.

original: viśvaṃ tad bhadraṃ yad avanti devā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: viśvam tat bhadram yat avanti devāḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: All that good thing which the gods protect, may we speak lofty words in the assembly, with good heroes.

original: indhāno agniṃ vanavad vanuṣyataḥ kṛtabrahmā śūśuvad rātahavya it /
analyzed: indhānaḥ agnim vanavat vanuṣyataḥ kṛta brahmā śūśuvat rāta havyaḥ id
translated: Kindling the fire, he praises the one who is to be praised, having made the prayer, he shines, offering oblations.

original: jātena jātam ati sa pra sarsṛte yaṃyaṃ yujaṃ kṛṇute brahmaṇas patiḥ //
analyzed: jātena jātam ati sa pra sarsṛte yaṃ yam yujam kṛṇute brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: He surpasses each born thing with what is born, whomever the lord of prayer makes his companion.

original: vīrebhir vīrān vanavad vanuṣyato gobhī rayim paprathad bodhati tmanā /
analyzed: vīrebhiḥ vīrān vanavat vanuṣyataḥ gobhiḥ rayim paprathat bodhati tmanā
translated: With heroes he will win heroes, with cattle he will win wealth, he will spread out riches, he will awaken by himself.

original: tokaṃ ca tasya tanayaṃ ca vardhate yaṃyaṃ yujaṃ kṛṇute brahmaṇas patiḥ //
analyzed: tokam ca tasya tanayam ca vardhate yaṃ yam yujam kṛṇute brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: He prospers his own son and his own offspring, whomsoever Brahmanaspati makes his ally.

original: sindhur na kṣodaḥ śimīvāṃ ṛghāyato vṛṣeva vadhrīṃr abhi vaṣṭy ojasā /
analyzed: sindhuḥ na kṣodaḥ śimīvān ṛghāyataḥ vṛṣā iva vadhrīṃr abhi vaṣṭi ojasā
translated: Like the sea, the impetuous one, the strong one, he overcomes with force, like a bull his cows.

original: agner iva prasitir nāha vartave yaṃyaṃ yujaṃ kṛṇute brahmaṇas patiḥ //
analyzed: agneḥ iva prasitiḥ na aha vartave yaṃ yam yujam kṛṇute brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: Like the flame of a fire, he cannot be turned back, whomsoever Brahmanaspati makes his ally.

original: tasmā arṣanti divyā asaścataḥ sa satvabhiḥ prathamo goṣu gacchati /
analyzed: tasmai arṣanti divyāḥ asaścataḥ sa satvabhiḥ prathamaḥ goṣu gacchati
translated: From him flow the undecaying heavenly (waters), he goes first among the strong ones to the cows.

original: anibhṛṣṭataviṣir hanty ojasā yaṃyaṃ yujaṃ kṛṇute brahmaṇas patiḥ //
analyzed: a nibhṛṣṭa taviṣiḥ hanti ojasā yaṃ yam yujam kṛṇute brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: With his uninjured power he conquers with force, whomsoever Brahmanaspati makes his ally.

original: tasmā id viśve dhunayanta sindhavo 'cchidrā śarma dadhire purūṇi /
analyzed: tasmai id viśve dhunayanta sindhavaḥ u chidrā śarma dadhire purūṇi
translated: From him all the rivers flow, he has received many infallible protections.

original: devānāṃ sumne subhagaḥ sa edhate yaṃyaṃ yujaṃ kṛṇute brahmaṇas patiḥ //
analyzed: devānām sumne subhagaḥ saḥ edhate yam yam yujam kṛṇute brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: In the bliss of the gods he prospers, the fortunate one, whomsoever Brahmanaspati makes his ally.

original: ṛjur ic chaṃso vanavad vanuṣyato devayann id adevayantam abhy asat /
analyzed: ṛjuḥ id śaṃsaḥ vanavat vanuṣyataḥ devayan id a devayantam abhī asat
translated: The upright one praises, he will win, he will conquer; he who worships the gods will overcome him who does not worship.

original: suprāvīr id vanavat pṛtsu duṣṭaraṃ yajved ayajyor vi bhajāti bhojanam //
analyzed: su prāvīḥ id vanavat pṛtsu duṣṭaram yajvā id a yajyoḥ vi bhajāti bhojanam
translated: He will be well-praised, he will win in battles, he will overcome the wicked one; he who sacrifices will divide the food of him who does not sacrifice.

original: yajasva vīra pra vihi manāyato bhadram manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye /
analyzed: yajasva vīra pra vihi manāyataḥ bhadram manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye
translated: O hero, perform sacrifice, drive away the niggardly one, make thy mind propitious in the battle with Vritra.

original: haviṣ kṛṇuṣva subhago yathāsasi brahmaṇas pater ava ā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: haviṣ kṛṇuṣva subhagaḥ yathā asasi brahmaṇaḥ pateḥ avaḥ ā vṛṇīmahe
translated: Make offering, that thou mayst be prosperous: we choose the favour of Brahmanaspati.

original: sa ij janena sa viśā sa janmanā sa putrair vājam bharate dhanā nṛbhiḥ /🔽devānāṃ yaḥ pitaram āvivāsati śraddhāmanā haviṣā brahmaṇas patim //
analyzed: saḥ id janena sa viśā sa janmanā sa putraiḥ vājam bharate dhanā nṛbhiḥ  devānām yaḥ pitaram āvivāsati śraddhā manāḥ haviṣā brahmaṇaḥ patim
translated: He, with the people, with the clan, with the race, with the sons, gains strength through men, gains wealth through men,🔽Who, with faith and offering, invites the father of the gods, Brahmanaspati.

original: yo asmai havyair ghṛtavadbhir avidhat pra tam prācā nayati brahmaṇas patiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ asmai havyaiḥ ghṛtavadbhiḥ avidhat pra tam prācā nayati brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: Whom he has served with offerings rich in ghee, him Brahmanaspati leads on to glory.

original: uruṣyatīm aṃhaso rakṣatī riṣo 'ṃhoś cid asmā urucakrir adbhutaḥ //
analyzed: uruṣyati īm aṃhasaḥ rakṣati riṣaḥ ṃhoḥ cit asmai uru cakriḥ adbhutaḥ
translated: He preserves from sorrow, he guards from harm: from sorrow he has made wide room for him, the wondrous one.

original: imā gira ādityebhyo ghṛtasnūḥ sanād rājabhyo juhvā juhomi /
analyzed: imāḥ giraḥ ādityebhyaḥ ghṛtasnūḥ sanāt rājabhyaḥ juhvā juhomi
translated: These songs, bathed in ghee, to the Âdityas, to the ancient kings, I offer with the ladle.

original: śṛṇotu mitro aryamā bhago nas tuvijāto varuṇo dakṣo aṃśaḥ //
analyzed: śṛṇotu mitraḥ aryamā bhagaḥ naḥ tuvi jātaḥ varuṇaḥ dakṣaḥ aṃśaḥ
translated: May Mitra, Aryaman, Bhaga, the mighty, Varuna, Daksha, and Amsu hear our call.

original: imaṃ stomaṃ sakratavo me adya mitro aryamā varuṇo juṣanta /
analyzed: imam stomam sa kratavaḥ me adya mitraḥ aryamā varuṇaḥ juṣanta
translated: May Mitra, Aryaman, Varuna accept this day this hymn of mine, O ye of one accord.

original: ādityāsaḥ śucayo dhārapūtā avṛjinā anavadyā ariṣṭāḥ //
analyzed: ādityāsaḥ śucayaḥ dhāra pūtāḥ a vṛjināḥ anavadyāḥ ariṣṭāḥ
translated: The Âdityas, pure, cleansed by the straining-cloth, free from guile, unblamable, uninjured,

original: ta ādityāsa uravo gabhīrā adabdhāso dipsanto bhūryakṣāḥ /
analyzed: te ādityāsaḥ uravaḥ gabhīrāḥ adabdhāsaḥ dipsantaḥ bhūri akṣāḥ
translated: Those Ādityas, deep, far-reaching, unassailable, watchful, with wide-open eyes,

original: antaḥ paśyanti vṛjinota sādhu sarvaṃ rājabhyaḥ paramā cid anti //
analyzed: antar paśyanti vṛjinā uta sādhu sarvam rājabhyaḥ paramā cit anti
translated: Look within, the wicked and the good. All things are known to the kings, even the most hidden.

original: dhārayanta ādityāso jagat sthā devā viśvasya bhuvanasya gopāḥ /
analyzed: dhārayantaḥ ādityāsaḥ jagat stha devāḥ viśvasya bhuvanasya gopāḥ
translated: The Ādityas support the world, the gods, guardians of all the universe,

original: dīrghādhiyo rakṣamāṇā asuryam ṛtāvānaś cayamānā ṛṇāni //
analyzed: dīrgha ādhiyaḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ asuryam ṛtāvānaḥ cayamānāḥ ṛṇāni
translated: Protecting the divine power of the far-seeing ones, settling the debts of the righteous.

original: vidyām ādityā avaso vo asya yad aryaman bhaya ā cin mayobhu /🔽yuṣmākam mitrāvaruṇā praṇītau pari śvabhreva duritāni vṛjyām //
analyzed: vidyām ādityāḥ avasaḥ vaḥ asya yat aryaman bhaye ā cit mayobhu  yuṣmākam mitrāvaruṇā praṇītau pari śvabhrā iva duritāni vṛjyām
translated: O Ādityas, I know this favor of yours, O Aryaman, that you are the givers of bliss.🔽By your guidance, O Mitra-Varuṇa, may I go around misfortunes as if they were a pit.

original: sugo hi vo aryaman mitra panthā anṛkṣaro varuṇa sādhur asti /
analyzed: su gaḥ hi vaḥ aryaman mitra panthāḥ anṛkṣaraḥ varuṇa sādhuḥ asti
translated: O Aryaman, O Mitra, your path is easy to travel, O Varuṇa, it is free from obstacles and good.

original: tenādityā adhi vocatā no yacchatā no duṣparihantu śarma //
analyzed: tena ādityāḥ adhi vocata naḥ yacchata naḥ duṣparihantu śarma
translated: By that, O Ādityas, be gracious to us. Grant us protection that is difficult to overcome.

original: pipartu no aditī rājaputrāti dveṣāṃsy aryamā sugebhiḥ /
analyzed: pipartu naḥ aditiḥ rāja putrā ati dveṣāṃsi aryamā su gebhiḥ
translated: May Aditi, the queen, protect us from hatred, may Aryaman by easy paths.

original: bṛhan mitrasya varuṇasya śarmopa syāma puruvīrā ariṣṭāḥ //
analyzed: bṛhat mitrasya varuṇasya śarma upa syāma puru vīrāḥ ariṣṭāḥ
translated: May we be under the great protection of Mitra and Varuṇa, with many heroes and unharmed.

original: tisro bhūmīr dhārayan trīṃr uta dyūn trīṇi vratā vidathe antar eṣām /
analyzed: tisraḥ bhūmīḥ dhārayan trīn uta dyūn trīṇi vratā vidathe antar eṣām
translated: Supporting three worlds and three heavens, three vows are within their sacred law.

original: ṛtenādityā mahi vo mahitvaṃ tad aryaman varuṇa mitra cāru //
analyzed: ṛtena ādityāḥ mahi vaḥ mahi tvam tat aryaman varuṇa mitra cāru
translated: By the law, O Âdityas, your greatness is great: that is lovely, O Aryaman, O Varuṇa, O Mitra.

original: trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta hiraṇyayāḥ śucayo dhārapūtāḥ /
analyzed: trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta hiraṇyayāḥ śucayaḥ dhāra pūtāḥ
translated: Three luminous spheres in heaven do they uphold, golden, pure, cleansed by the filter.

original: asvapnajo animiṣā adabdhā uruśaṃsā ṛjave martyāya //
analyzed: a svapnajaḥ animiṣāḥ adabdhāḥ uru śaṃsāḥ ṛjave martyāya
translated: They who are never sleeping, never winking, never deceived, bestowing ample blessings on the upright man.

original: tvaṃ viśveṣāṃ varuṇāsi rājā ye ca devā asura ye ca martāḥ /
analyzed: tvam viśveṣām varuṇa asi rājā ye ca devāḥ asura ye ca martāḥ
translated: Thou, O Varuṇa, art the King of all the Gods, of those who are Gods and of those who are men.

original: śataṃ no rāsva śarado vicakṣe 'śyāmāyūṃṣi sudhitāni pūrvā //
analyzed: śatam naḥ rāsva śaradaḥ vicakṣe śyāma āyūṃṣi sudhitāni pūrvā
translated: Grant us a hundred winters, O Âditya, that we may see: may our lives be long and well-ordered in the beginning.

original: na dakṣiṇā vi cikite na savyā na prācīnam ādityā nota paścā /
analyzed: na dakṣiṇā vi cikite na savyā na prācīnam ādityāḥ na uta paścā
translated: Neither the south nor the north do I discern, O Âdityas, nor the east nor yet the west.

original: pākyā cid vasavo dhīryā cid yuṣmānīto abhayaṃ jyotir aśyām //
analyzed: pākyā cit vasavaḥ dhīryā cit yuṣmānītaḥ abhayam jyotiḥ aśyām
translated: Even from the cooked food, O ye Vasus, even from the raw, may I obtain through you a safe and happy resting-place.

original: yo rājabhya ṛtanibhyo dadāśa yaṃ vardhayanti puṣṭayaś ca nityāḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ rājabhyaḥ ṛta nibhyaḥ dadāśa yam vardhayanti puṣṭayaḥ ca nityāḥ
translated: He who hath given to the Kings who are the guardians of the Law, whom the perpetual prosperities strengthen,

original: sa revān yāti prathamo rathena vasudāvā vidatheṣu praśastaḥ //
analyzed: sa revān yāti prathamaḥ rathena vasu dāvā vidatheṣu praśastaḥ
translated: He, the rich, goes in his car first of all, he who bestows wealth, to be praised in assemblies.

original: śucir apaḥ sūyavasā adabdha upa kṣeti vṛddhavayāḥ suvīraḥ /
analyzed: śuciḥ apaḥ sū yavasāḥ adabdhaḥ upa kṣeti vṛddha vayāḥ su vīraḥ
translated: Pure, with good pasture, unassailable, he dwells, of great age, with noble heroes.

original: nakiṣ ṭaṃ ghnanty antito na dūrād ya ādityānām bhavati praṇītau //
analyzed: nakir tam ghnanti antitas na dūrāt yaḥ ādityānām bhavati praṇītau
translated: None slays him from near or from afar, who is in the guidance of the Âdityas.

original: adite mitra varuṇota mṛḷa yad vo vayaṃ cakṛmā kac cid āgaḥ /
analyzed: adite mitra varuṇa uta mṛḍa yat vaḥ vayam cakṛma kad cit āgaḥ
translated: O Aditi, Mitra, Varuna, be gracious to us, if we have done you any wrong.

original: urv aśyām abhayaṃ jyotir indra mā no dīrghā abhi naśan tamisrāḥ //
analyzed: uru aśyām abhayam jyotiḥ indra mā naḥ dīrghāḥ abhi naśan tamisrāḥ
translated: May we dwell in a wide, safe place, O Indra, may the long, dark nights not deceive us.

original: ubhe asmai pīpayataḥ samīcī divo vṛṣṭiṃ subhago nāma puṣyan /
analyzed: ubhe asmai pīpayataḥ samīcī divaḥ vṛṣṭim subhagaḥ nāma puṣyan
translated: Both the heavens pour for him, the fortunate one, the rain from heaven, nourishing the name.

original: ubhā kṣayāv ājayan yāti pṛtsūbhāv ardhau bhavataḥ sādhū asmai //
analyzed: ubhā kṣayau ājayan yāti pṛtsu ubhau ardhau bhavataḥ sādhū asmai
translated: He wins both abodes, he goes to the battles, both halves are good for him.

original: yā vo māyā abhidruhe yajatrāḥ pāśā ādityā ripave vicṛttāḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ vaḥ māyāḥ abhidruhe yajatrāḥ pāśāḥ ādityāḥ ripave vicṛttāḥ
translated: Your illusions, O holy ones, which attack us, the snares, O Adityas, which are spread out for the enemy,

original: aśvīva tāṃ ati yeṣaṃ rathenāriṣṭā urāv ā śarman syāma //
analyzed: aśvī iva tām ati yeṣam rathena ariṣṭāḥ urau ā śarman syāma
translated: May we, by you, by whom one goes on a chariot, be safe from harm, O you who are to be praised.

original: māham maghono varuṇa priyasya bhūridāvna ā vidaṃ śūnam āpeḥ /
analyzed: mā aham maghonaḥ varuṇa priyasya bhūri dāvnaḥ ā vidam śūnam āpeḥ
translated: May I not find, O Varuna, the house of the generous, the dear one, the giver of much.

original: mā rāyo rājan suyamād ava sthām bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: mā rāyaḥ rājan su yamāt ava sthām bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: Do not deprive me, O king, of wealth easily obtained. May we speak lofty words in the assembly, with good heroes.

original: idaṃ kaver ādityasya svarājo viśvāni sānty abhy astu mahnā /🔽ati yo mandro yajathāya devaḥ sukīrtim bhikṣe varuṇasya bhūreḥ //
analyzed: idam kaveḥ ādityasya sva rājaḥ viśvāni sānti abhī astu mahnā  ati yaḥ mandraḥ yajathāya devaḥ su kīrtim bhikṣe varuṇasya bhūreḥ
translated: This (protection) of the wise, of the self-ruling Adityas, may all (people) obtain by his greatness.🔽He who, the delightful one, the god, is to be worshipped, I beg for good fame, for great wealth from Varuna.

original: tava vrate subhagāsaḥ syāma svādhyo varuṇa tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ /
analyzed: tava vrate subhagāsaḥ syāma su ādhyaḥ varuṇa tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ
translated: O Varuna, may we be prosperous under your rule, well-disposed, O you who are to be praised.

original: upāyana uṣasāṃ gomatīnām agnayo na jaramāṇā anu dyūn //
analyzed: upāyane uṣasām gomatīnām agnayaḥ na jaramāṇāḥ anu dyūn
translated: The gifts of the dawn-cows rich in milk, the fires, like those that are kindled, through the days.

original: tava syāma puruvīrasya śarmann uruśaṃsasya varuṇa praṇetaḥ /
analyzed: tava syāma puru vīrasya śarman uru śaṃsasya varuṇa praṇetar
translated: May we be in the keeping of thee, O Varuna, of the most heroic, of him of wide sway, the leader.

original: yūyaṃ naḥ putrā aditer adabdhā abhi kṣamadhvaṃ yujyāya devāḥ //
analyzed: yūyam naḥ putrāḥ aditeḥ adabdhāḥ abhi kṣamadhvam yujyāya devāḥ
translated: Ye, O sons, are the undeceived of Aditi: be gracious to us, O gods, for union.

original: pra sīm ādityo asṛjad vidhartāṃ ṛtaṃ sindhavo varuṇasya yanti /
analyzed: pra sīm ādityaḥ asṛjat vidhartām ṛtam sindhavaḥ varuṇasya yanti
translated: The Âditya hath sent forth the regents of law: the rivers flow according to the ordinance of Varuna.

original: na śrāmyanti na vi mucanty ete vayo na paptū raghuyā parijman //
analyzed: na śrāmyanti na vi mucanti ete vayaḥ na paptuḥ raghuyā parijman
translated: They neither toil nor rest: they are not wearied: like a bird they fly over the rapid path.

original: vi mac chrathāya raśanām ivāga ṛdhyāma te varuṇa khām ṛtasya /
analyzed: vi mat śrathāya raśanām iva āgaḥ ṛdhyāma te varuṇa khām ṛtasya
translated: For my prosperity, O Varuna, as 'twere a rein, do I draw nigh: may we prosper in thy law.

original: mā tantuś chedi vayato dhiyam me mā mātrā śāry apasaḥ pura ṛtoḥ //
analyzed: mā tantuḥ chedi vayataḥ dhiyam me mā mātrā śāri apasaḥ puras ṛtoḥ
translated: Cut not the thread of my devotion, nor my hymn, nor my insight, O thou of holy rites, before the time.

original: apo su myakṣa varuṇa bhiyasam mat samrāḷ ṛtāvo 'nu mā gṛbhāya /
analyzed: apa u su myakṣa varuṇa bhiyasam mat samrāj ṛtāvaḥ nu mā gṛbhāya
translated: O Varuna, loosen thou the bond that binds me: be gracious unto me, O thou of holy laws.

original: dāmeva vatsād vi mumugdhy aṃho nahi tvad āre nimiṣaś caneśe //
analyzed: dāmā iva vatsāt vi mumugdhi aṃhaḥ nahi tvat āre nimiṣaḥ cana īśe
translated: As one unties a knot from out the calf, so loosen thou the sin from me. For not a moment mayst thou rule over me.

original: mā no vadhair varuṇa ye ta iṣṭāv enaḥ kṛṇvantam asura bhrīṇanti /
analyzed: mā naḥ vadhaiḥ varuṇa ye te iṣṭau enaḥ kṛṇvantam asura bhrīṇanti
translated: Let not, O Varuna, those bonds of thine which are set for the sinner, afflict us. O Asura, let them not torment him who hath sinned against thee.

original: mā jyotiṣaḥ pravasathāni ganma vi ṣū mṛdhaḥ śiśratho jīvase naḥ //
analyzed: mā jyotiṣaḥ pravasathāni ganma vi su mṛdhaḥ śiśrathaḥ jīvase naḥ
translated: Let us not go to the dwellings of the light: drive ye away our enemies, that we may live.

original: namaḥ purā te varuṇota nūnam utāparaṃ tuvijāta bravāma /
analyzed: namaḥ purā te varuṇa uta nūnam uta aparam tuvi jāta bravāma
translated: To thee, O Varuna, we will speak first, and now, O thou of mighty birth, afterwards.

original: tve hi kam parvate na śritāny apracyutāni dūḷabha vratāni //
analyzed: tve hi kam parvate na śritāni a pracyutāni dūḷabha vratāni
translated: For in thee, O Varuna, are placed, as on a mountain, thy never-failing and hard-to-be-broken laws.

original: para ṛṇā sāvīr adha matkṛtāni māhaṃ rājann anyakṛtena bhojam /
analyzed: paras ṛṇā sāvīḥ adha mad kṛtāni mā aham rājan anya kṛtena bhojam
translated: Deliver me from the debts I have contracted, and let me not, O king, be a debtor to another.

original: avyuṣṭā in nu bhūyasīr uṣāsa ā no jīvān varuṇa tāsu śādhi //
analyzed: a vyuṣṭāḥ id nu bhūyasīḥ uṣāsaḥ ā naḥ jīvān varuṇa tāsu śādhi
translated: Let the dawns rise more and more, and in them, O Varuna, grant us life.

original: yo me rājan yujyo vā sakhā vā svapne bhayam bhīrave mahyam āha /
analyzed: yaḥ me rājan yujyaḥ vā sakhā vā svapne bhayam bhīrave mahyam āha
translated: If a friend or companion of mine, O king, tell me in a dream of fear and terror,

original: steno vā yo dipsati no vṛko vā tvaṃ tasmād varuṇa pāhy asmān //🔽māham maghono varuṇa priyasya bhūridāvna ā vidaṃ śūnam āpeḥ /
analyzed: stenaḥ vā yaḥ dipsati naḥ vṛkaḥ vā tvam tasmāt varuṇa pāhi asmān  mā aham maghonaḥ varuṇa priyasya bhūri dāvnaḥ ā vidam śūnam āpeḥ
translated: Or if a thief or a wolf is bent on injuring us, O Varuna, protect us from him.🔽Let me not, O Varuna, find the house of the bountiful and dear patron empty.

original: mā rāyo rājan suyamād ava sthām bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: mā rāyaḥ rājan su yamāt ava sthām bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: Let me not be deprived, O king, of wealth easily obtained. Let us speak lofty words in the assembly, with brave sons.

original: dhṛtavratā ādityā iṣirā āre mat karta rahasūr ivāgaḥ /🔽śṛṇvato vo varuṇa mitra devā bhadrasya vidvāṃ avase huve vaḥ //
analyzed: dhṛta vratāḥ ādityāḥ iṣirāḥ āre mat karta rahasūḥ iva āgaḥ  śṛṇvataḥ vaḥ varuṇa mitra devāḥ bhadrasya vidvān avase huve vaḥ
translated: The powerful Adityas, whose vows are firm, make me free from sin, as from a pit.🔽To you, O Varuna, O Mitra, O gods, who hear, I call, knowing what is good, for help.

original: yūyaṃ devāḥ pramatir yūyam ojo yūyaṃ dveṣāṃsi sanutar yuyota /
analyzed: yūyam devāḥ pramatiḥ yūyam ojaḥ yūyam dveṣāṃsi sanutar yuyota
translated: You, O gods, are the over-ruler, you are the strength. You, O Suna and Tvastr, remove enmities.

original: abhikṣattāro abhi ca kṣamadhvam adyā ca no mṛḷayatāparaṃ ca //
analyzed: abhi kṣattāraḥ abhi ca kṣamadhvam adyā ca naḥ mṛḍayata aparam ca
translated: Be ye bountiful, and be ye also gracious, and be kind to us this day and hereafter.

original: kim ū nu vaḥ kṛṇavāmāpareṇa kiṃ sanena vasava āpyena /
analyzed: kim u nu vaḥ kṛṇavāma apareṇa kim sanena vasavaḥ āpyena
translated: What else can we do for you, O ye Vasus, with a gift that is to be obtained by another?

original: yūyaṃ no mitrāvaruṇādite ca svastim indrāmaruto dadhāta //
analyzed: yūyam naḥ mitrāvaruṇā adite ca svastim indrāmarutaḥ dadhāta
translated: Ye, O Mitra-Varuṇa and Aditi, and ye, O Indra and Maruts, bestow on us welfare.

original: haye devā yūyam id āpaya stha te mṛḷata nādhamānāya mahyam /
analyzed: haye devāḥ yūyam id āpayaḥ stha te mṛḍata nādhamānāya mahyam
translated: O ye gods, ye are indeed the leaders; be ye gracious to me, the humble one.

original: mā vo ratho madhyamavāḷ ṛte bhūn mā yuṣmāvatsv āpiṣu śramiṣma //
analyzed: mā vaḥ rathaḥ madhyama vāh ṛte bhūt mā yuṣmāvatsu āpiṣu śramiṣma
translated: Let not your chariot be far from us, O ye who are to be invoked; let us not toil among you who are to be invoked.

original: pra va eko mimaya bhūry āgo yan mā piteva kitavaṃ śaśāsa /
analyzed: pra vaḥ ekaḥ mimaya bhūri āgaḥ yat mā pitā iva kitavam śaśāsa
translated: One alone, O god, has extended his protection, since he has instructed me like a father, the deceitful one.

original: āre pāśā āre aghāni devā mā mādhi putre vim iva grabhīṣṭa //
analyzed: āre pāśāḥ āre aghāni devāḥ mā mā adhi putre vim iva grabhīṣṭa
translated: Far away the snares, far away the evil, O gods; do not seize me, O Varuṇa, as a son seizes his mother.

original: arvāñco adyā bhavatā yajatrā ā vo hārdi bhayamāno vyayeyam /
analyzed: arvāñcaḥ adya bhavata yajatrāḥ ā vaḥ hārdi bhayamānaḥ vyayeyam
translated: Be ye propitious to-day, O ye who are to be invoked; in fear I would approach your heart.

original: trādhvaṃ no devā nijuro vṛkasya trādhvaṃ kartād avapado yajatrāḥ //
analyzed: trādhvam naḥ devāḥ nijuraḥ vṛkasya trādhvam kartāt avapadaḥ yajatrāḥ
translated: Protect us, O ye gods, from the Niṣadara and the wolf; protect us from the pit, O ye who are to be invoked.

original: māham maghono varuṇa priyasya bhūridāvna ā vidaṃ śūnam āpeḥ /
analyzed: mā aham maghonaḥ varuṇa priyasya bhūri dāvnaḥ ā vidam śūnam āpeḥ
translated: Let me not, O Varuṇa, find the poor man, the dear friend of the liberal giver, the bountiful one.

original: mā rāyo rājan suyamād ava sthām bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: mā rāyaḥ rājan su yamāt ava sthām bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: Let me not be deprived, O king, of wealth that is easily obtained; may we speak lofty words in the assembly, with brave sons.

original: ṛtaṃ devāya kṛṇvate savitra indrāyāhighne na ramanta āpaḥ /
analyzed: ṛtam devāya kṛṇvate savitre indrāya ahi ghne na ramante āpaḥ
translated: The truth they make for the god Savitar, for Indra the slayer of Ahi, the waters rejoice.

original: aharahar yāty aktur apāṃ kiyāty ā prathamaḥ sarga āsām //
analyzed: ahar ahar yāti aktuḥ apām kiyāti ā prathamaḥ sargaḥ āsām
translated: Day by day the sun moves, the first creation of these waters moves on.

original: yo vṛtrāya sinam atrābhariṣyat pra taṃ janitrī viduṣa uvāca /
analyzed: yaḥ vṛtrāya sinam atrā ābhariṣyat pra tam janitrī viduṣe uvāca
translated: He who will bring the stream of water to Vritra, the wise one has spoken to him, the mother.

original: patho radantīr anu joṣam asmai divedive dhunayo yanty artham //🔽ūrdhvo hy asthād adhy antarikṣe 'dhā vṛtrāya pra vadhaṃ jabhāra /
analyzed: pathaḥ radantīḥ anu joṣam asmai dive dive dhunayaḥ yanti artham  ūrdhvaḥ hi asthāt adhi antarikṣe dhāḥ vṛtrāya pra vadham jabhāra
translated: The paths, grinding for him according to his will, the waves move day by day for their purpose.🔽For he stood up in the sky above, then he brought the weapon to Vritra.

original: mihaṃ vasāna upa hīm adudrot tigmāyudho ajayac chatrum indraḥ //
analyzed: miham vasānaḥ upa hi īm adudrot tigma āyudhaḥ ajayat śatrum indraḥ
translated: Wearing rain, he ran to the rain, with sharp weapons Indra conquered the enemy.

original: bṛhaspate tapuṣāśneva vidhya vṛkadvaraso asurasya vīrān /
analyzed: bṛhaspate tapuṣā aśnā iva vidhya vṛkadvaraso asurasya vīrān
translated: O Brihaspati, pierce with heat the heroes of the Asura, as one would pierce with a stake.

original: yathā jaghantha dhṛṣatā purā cid evā jahi śatrum asmākam indra //
analyzed: yathā jaghantha dhṛṣatā purā cit eva jahi śatrum asmākam indra
translated: As you boldly slew in the past, so slay our enemy, O Indra.

original: ava kṣipa divo aśmānam uccā yena śatrum mandasāno nijūrvāḥ /
analyzed: ava kṣipa divaḥ aśmānam uccā yena śatrum mandasānaḥ nijūrvāḥ
translated: Throw down from the sky the stone, with which, rejoicing, you struck the enemy.

original: tokasya sātau tanayasya bhūrer asmāṃ ardhaṃ kṛṇutād indra gonām //
analyzed: tokasya sātau tanayasya bhūreḥ asmān ardham kṛṇutāt indra gonām
translated: In the gain of offspring, in the gain of a son, in the gain of much, make us sharers of the cows, O Indra.

original: pra hi kratuṃ vṛhatho yaṃ vanutho radhrasya stho yajamānasya codau /
analyzed: pra hi kratum vṛhathaḥ yam vanuthaḥ radhrasya sthaḥ yajamānasya codau
translated: For you increase the power which you delight in, you are the supporters of the poor sacrificer.

original: indrāsomā yuvam asmāṃ aviṣṭam asmin bhayasthe kṛṇutam u lokam //
analyzed: indrāsomāḥ yuvam asmām aviṣṭam asmin bhayasthe kṛṇutam u lokam
translated: Indra and Soma, you have favoured us, make a place for us in this fearful situation.

original: na mā taman na śraman nota tandran na vocāma mā sunoteti somam /
analyzed: na mā taman na śraman na uta tandran na vocāma mā sunota iti somam
translated: Let me not be overcome by darkness, nor by fatigue, nor by sluggishness, nor let us say, 'Do not press out the Soma.'

original: yo me pṛṇād yo dadad yo nibodhād yo mā sunvantam upa gobhir āyat //
analyzed: yaḥ me pṛṇāt yaḥ dadat yaḥ nibodhāt yaḥ mā sunvantam upa gobhiḥ āyat
translated: He who has filled me, who has given to me, who has understood me, who has come to me with cattle while I was pressing out (Soma),

original: sarasvati tvam asmāṃ aviḍḍhi marutvatī dhṛṣatī jeṣi śatrūn /
analyzed: sarasvati tvam asmām aviḍḍhi marutvatī dhṛṣatī jeṣi śatrūn
translated: O Sarasvati, you have favoured us. Endowed with Maruts, daring, you conquer enemies.

original: tyaṃ cic chardhantaṃ taviṣīyamāṇam indro hanti vṛṣabhaṃ śaṇḍikānām //
analyzed: tyam cit śardhantam taviṣīyamāṇam indraḥ hanti vṛṣabham śaṇḍikānām
translated: Even him who is rushing forth, who is striving mightily, Indra slays the bull of the Śaṇḍika people.

original: yo naḥ sanutya uta vā jighatnur abhikhyāya taṃ tigitena vidhya /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ sanutyaḥ uta vā jighatnuḥ abhikhyāya tam tigitena vidhya
translated: Him who is near us, whether he is coming to kill or to hunger, pierce him with a sharp arrow.

original: bṛhaspata āyudhair jeṣi śatrūn druhe rīṣantam pari dhehi rājan //
analyzed: bṛhaspate āyudhaiḥ jeṣi śatrūn druhe rīṣantam pari dhehi rājan
translated: O Brihaspati, with your weapons you conquer enemies. O king, surround the one who is hostile and eager to fight.

original: asmākebhiḥ satvabhiḥ śūra śūrair vīryā kṛdhi yāni te kartvāni /🔽jyog abhūvann anudhūpitāso hatvī teṣām ā bharā no vasūni //
analyzed: asmākebhiḥ satvabhiḥ śūra śūraiḥ vīryā kṛdhi yāni te kartvāni  jyok abhūvan anudhūpitāsaḥ hatvī teṣām ā bhara naḥ vasūni
translated: O hero, perform heroic deeds, those which are to be done by you, with our own heroic ones.🔽We have become prosperous, well-perfumed. Having killed them, bring us riches.

original: taṃ vaḥ śardham mārutaṃ sumnayur giropa bruve namasā daivyaṃ janam /
analyzed: tam vaḥ śardham mārutam sumnayuḥ girā upa bruve namasā daivyam janam
translated: I address with praise and homage the divine people, the Marut host, with these songs that are eager for your favour.

original: yathā rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ naśāmahā apatyasācaṃ śrutyaṃ divedive //
analyzed: yathā rayim sarva vīram naśāmahai apatyasācam śrutyam dive dive
translated: That we may obtain wealth with all heroes, accompanied by offspring, renowned, day by day.

original: asmākam mitrāvaruṇāvataṃ ratham ādityai rudrair vasubhiḥ sacābhuvā /
analyzed: asmākam mitrāvaruṇā avatam ratham ādityaiḥ rudraiḥ vasubhiḥ sacābhuvā
translated: For us, O Mitra-Varuṇa, the chariot, together with the Ādityas, Rudras, and Vasus,

original: pra yad vayo na paptan vasmanas pari śravasyavo hṛṣīvanto vanarṣadaḥ //
analyzed: pra yat vayaḥ na paptan vasmanaḥ pari śravasyavaḥ hṛṣīvantaḥ vanarṣadaḥ
translated: When they fly like birds to their resting place, eager for fame, joyful, raining (rain).

original: adha smā na ud avatā sajoṣaso rathaṃ devāso abhi vikṣu vājayum /
analyzed: adha smā naḥ ud avata sajoṣasaḥ ratham devāsaḥ abhi vikṣu vājayum
translated: Then, indeed, the gods, in unison, with their helpful aids,

original: yad āśavaḥ padyābhis titrato rajaḥ pṛthivyāḥ sānau jaṅghananta pāṇibhiḥ //
analyzed: yat āśavaḥ padyābhiḥ titrataḥ rajaḥ pṛthivyāḥ sānau jaṅghananta pāṇibhiḥ
translated: When the swift ones, with the swift ones, traverse the path, trampling the earth's ridge with their feet.

original: uta sya na indro viśvacarṣaṇir divaḥ śardhena mārutena sukratuḥ /
analyzed: uta sya naḥ indraḥ viśvacarṣaṇiḥ divaḥ śardhena mārutena su kratuḥ
translated: And may Indra, he who is worshipped by all men, of good resolve, with the Marut host of heaven,

original: anu nu sthāty avṛkābhir ūtibhī ratham mahe sanaye vājasātaye //🔽uta sya devo bhuvanasya sakṣaṇis tvaṣṭā gnābhiḥ sajoṣā jūjuvad ratham /🔽iḷā bhago bṛhaddivota rodasī pūṣā purandhir aśvināv adhā patī //
analyzed: anu nu sthāti avṛkābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ ratham mahe sanaye vājasātaye  uta sya devaḥ bhuvanasya sakṣaṇiḥ tvaṣṭā gnābhiḥ sajoṣāḥ jūjuvat ratham  iḷā bhagaḥ bṛhaddivā uta rodasī pūṣā purandhiḥ aśvinau adhā patī
translated: Still stand with us with his aids that bring no fear, the chariot, for great gain, for winning strength.🔽And may that god, the impeller of the world, Tvaṣṭar, in unison with the wives, speed the chariot,🔽Ilā, Bhaga, the two mighty ones of the sky, the two worlds, Pūṣan, Purandhi, the two Āśvins, the lords.

original: uta tye devī subhage mithūdṛśoṣāsānaktā jagatām apījuvā /
analyzed: uta tye devī subhage mithūdṛśā uṣāsānaktā jagatām
translated: And those two, O goddess, the two auspicious ones, who look alike, dawn and night, of the moving ones, most active,

original: stuṣe yad vām pṛthivi navyasā vaca sthātuś ca vayas trivayā upastire //
analyzed: stuṣe yat vām pṛthivi navyasā sthātuḥ ca vayaḥ trivayāḥ upastire
translated: I praise you, O Earth, with a new song, and the strength of the standing one has been spread out in three layers.

original: uta vaḥ śaṃsam uśijām iva śmasy ahir budhnyo 'ja ekapād uta /
analyzed: uta vaḥ śaṃsam uśijām iva śmasi ahiḥ budhnyaḥ jaḥ ekapād uta
translated: And I proclaim you, like the swift ones, in the abode, Ahi Budhnya, the goat with one foot, and

original: trita ṛbhukṣāḥ savitā cano dadhe 'pāṃ napād āśuhemā dhiyā śami //
analyzed: tritaḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ savitā canaḥ dadhe pām napāt āśu hemā dhiyā śami
translated: Trita, Rbhukṣan, Savitar have set their thought, the swift-moving one of the waters, at the place of worship with the hymn.

original: etā vo vaśmy udyatā yajatrā atakṣann āyavo navyase sam /
analyzed: etāḥ vaḥ vaśmi udyatāḥ yajatrāḥ atakṣan āyavaḥ navyase sam
translated: This is your dwelling, O you to be worshipped, raised up, the living ones have fashioned it anew for you.

original: śravasyavo vājaṃ cakānāḥ saptir na rathyo aha dhītim aśyāḥ //
analyzed: śravasyavaḥ vājam cakānāḥ saptiḥ na rathyaḥ aha dhītim aśyāḥ
translated: Desiring glory, seeking booty, like a charioteer, I should win the thought.

original: asya me dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtāyato bhūtam avitrī vacasaḥ siṣāsataḥ /
analyzed: asya me dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtāyataḥ bhūtam avitrī vacasaḥ siṣāsataḥ
translated: May Dyaus and Prithivī, the two who are true to their promise, be for me, who am striving with my words,

original: yayor āyuḥ prataraṃ te idam pura upastute vasūyur vām maho dadhe //
analyzed: yayoḥ āyuḥ prataram te idam puras upastute vasūyuḥ vām mahaḥ dadhe
translated: In whose house this life of yours is spread out. I have set up for you, O you who possess wealth, a great abode.

original: mā no guhyā ripa āyor ahan dabhan mā na ābhyo rīradho ducchunābhyaḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ guhyāḥ ripaḥ āyoḥ ahan dabhan mā naḥ ābhyaḥ rīradhaḥ ducchunābhyaḥ
translated: Do not deceive us, O you who are hidden, in the day or in the night, do not lead us astray from these, O you who are to be feared.

original: mā no vi yauḥ sakhyā viddhi tasya naḥ sumnāyatā manasā tat tvemahe //
analyzed: mā naḥ vi yauḥ sakhyā viddhi tasya naḥ sumnāyatā manasā tat tvā īmahe
translated: Do not separate us from our friend, know that. We implore you with a mind that is inclined to what is good.

original: aheḷatā manasā śruṣṭim ā vaha duhānāṃ dhenum pipyuṣīm asaścatam /
analyzed: a heḍatā manasā śruṣṭim ā vaha duhānām dhenum pipyuṣīm asaścatam
translated: Bring with a mind free from anger the willing, milch cow, who yields much, who is unfailing.

original: padyābhir āśuṃ vacasā ca vājinaṃ tvāṃ hinomi puruhūta viśvahā //
analyzed: padyābhiḥ āśum vacasā ca vājinam tvām hinomi puruhūta viśvahā
translated: With verses I swiftly urge the swift one, with speech I urge you, O Puruhuta, for all time.

original: rākām ahaṃ suhavāṃ suṣṭutī huve śṛṇotu naḥ subhagā bodhatu tmanā /
analyzed: rākām aham su havām suṣṭutī huve śṛṇotu naḥ subhagā bodhatu tmanā
translated: I invoke Raka, the easy to invoke one, with good praises. May the fortunate one listen to us and be aware of herself.

original: sīvyatv apaḥ sūcyācchidyamānayā dadātu vīraṃ śatadāyam ukthyam //
analyzed: sīvyatu apaḥ sūcyā a chidyamānayā dadātu vīram śatadāyam ukthyam
translated: May she sew up the waters with a needle that is not torn. May she give a son who is to be praised, who gives a hundred gifts.

original: yās te rāke sumatayaḥ supeśaso yābhir dadāsi dāśuṣe vasūni /
analyzed: yāḥ te rāke sumatayaḥ supeśasaḥ yābhiḥ dadāsi dāśuṣe vasūni
translated: O Raka, your good opinions that are well-formed, by which you give wealth to the worshipper,

original: tābhir no adya sumanā upāgahi sahasrapoṣaṃ subhage rarāṇā //
analyzed: tābhiḥ naḥ adya sumanāḥ upāgahi sahasra poṣam subhage rarāṇā
translated: With those, come to us today with a good mind, O fortunate one, bestowing a thousandfold increase.

original: sinīvāli pṛthuṣṭuke yā devānām asi svasā /
analyzed: sinīvāli pṛthuṣṭuke yā devānām asi svasā
translated: O Sinivāli, of wide praise, you who are the sister of the gods,

original: juṣasva havyam āhutam prajāṃ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ //
analyzed: juṣasva havyam āhutam prajām devi didiḍḍhi naḥ
translated: Accept the offered oblation, O goddess, grant us offspring.

original: yā subāhuḥ svaṅguriḥ suṣūmā bahusūvarī /
analyzed: yā su bāhuḥ su aṅguriḥ suṣūmā bahusūvarī
translated: She who has good arms, good thighs, good speech, who bears many children,

original: tasyai viśpatnyai haviḥ sinīvālyai juhotana //
analyzed: tasyai viś patnyai haviḥ sinīvālyai juhotana
translated: To that lady of the people, to Sinivāli, offer an oblation.

original: yā guṅgūr yā sinīvālī yā rākā yā sarasvatī /
analyzed: yā guṅgūḥ yā sinīvālī yā rākā yā sarasvatī
translated: She who is Guṅgū, who is Sinivāli, who is Raka, who is Sarasvatī,

original: indrāṇīm ahva ūtaye varuṇānīṃ svastaye //
analyzed: indrāṇīm ahve ūtaye varuṇānīm svastaye
translated: I invoke Indrāṇī for help, Varuṇānī for well-being.

original: ā te pitar marutāṃ sumnam etu mā naḥ sūryasya saṃdṛśo yuyothāḥ /
analyzed: ā te pitar marutām sumnam etu mā naḥ sūryasya saṃdṛśaḥ yuyothāḥ
translated: O father, may you find pleasure in the Maruts' favor. Do not keep us away from the sight of the sun.

original: abhi no vīro arvati kṣameta pra jāyemahi rudra prajābhiḥ //
analyzed: abhi naḥ vīraḥ arvati kṣameta pra jāyemahi rudra prajābhiḥ
translated: May the hero favour us in the race; may we be born with offspring, O Rudra.
