original: tvādattebhī rudra śantamebhiḥ śataṃ himā aśīya bheṣajebhiḥ /
analyzed: tvādattebhiḥ rudra śantamebhiḥ śatam himā aśīya bheṣajebhiḥ
translated: With these most gentle gifts of thine, O Rudra, may I obtain a hundred winters with thy healing herbs.

original: vy asmad dveṣo vitaraṃ vy aṃho vy amīvāś cātayasvā viṣūcīḥ //
analyzed: vi asmat dveṣaḥ vitaram vi aṃhaḥ vi amīvāḥ cātayasva viṣūcīḥ
translated: Drive away from us hatred, drive away affliction, drive away diseases, drive away evil influences.

original: śreṣṭho jātasya rudra śriyāsi tavastamas tavasāṃ vajrabāho /
analyzed: śreṣṭhaḥ jātasya rudra śriyā asi tavastamaḥ tavasām vajra bāho
translated: Thou, O Rudra, art the best by glory of what is born; thou, O mighty one, art the most powerful of the powerful, O thou with the thunderbolt in thy hand.

original: parṣi ṇaḥ pāram aṃhasaḥ svasti viśvā abhītī rapaso yuyodhi //
analyzed: parṣi naḥ pāram aṃhasaḥ svasti viśvāḥ abhītīḥ rapasaḥ yuyodhi
translated: Carry us over the flood of affliction, O thou who art prosperous; drive away all diseases and all evil influences.

original: mā tvā rudra cukrudhāmā namobhir mā duṣṭutī vṛṣabha mā sahūtī /
analyzed: mā tvā rudra cukrudhāmā namobhiḥ mā duṣṭutī vṛṣabha mā sahūtī
translated: Let not Rudra, O Rudra, be angry with us, not through our homage, O bull, not through our evil words, not through our loud calls.

original: un no vīrāṃ arpaya bheṣajebhir bhiṣaktamaṃ tvā bhiṣajāṃ śṛṇomi //
analyzed: ud naḥ vīrān arpaya bheṣajebhiḥ bhiṣaktamam tvā bhiṣajām śṛṇomi
translated: Impel our heroes with thy healing herbs; of all physicians I hear that thou art the best.

original: havīmabhir havate yo havirbhir ava stomebhī rudraṃ diṣīya /🔽ṛdūdaraḥ suhavo mā no asyai babhruḥ suśipro rīradhan manāyai //
analyzed: havīmabhiḥ havate yaḥ havirbhiḥ ava stomebhiḥ rudram diṣīya  ṛdūdaraḥ su havaḥ mā naḥ asyai babhruḥ su śipraḥ rīradhat manāyai
translated: He who calls with offerings, with oblations, with praises, let him seek to propitiate Rudra.🔽May the kind-hearted, the easily entreated one, the brown one with beautiful eyebrows, favour us for this our devotion.

original: un mā mamanda vṛṣabho marutvān tvakṣīyasā vayasā nādhamānam /
analyzed: ud mā mamanda vṛṣabhaḥ marutvān tvakṣīyasā vayasā nādhamānam
translated: Let not the bull, the friend of the Maruts, afflict me, the one who is inferior in strength, with his most powerful strength.

original: ghṛṇīva cchāyām arapā aśīyā vivāseyaṃ rudrasya sumnam //
analyzed: ghṛṇī iva chāyām arapāḥ aśīyāḥ vivāseyam rudrasya sumnam
translated: Let him, like a shadow, enjoy my oblation, and let me dwell in the favour of Rudra.

original: kva sya te rudra mṛḷayākur hasto yo asti bheṣajo jalāṣaḥ /
analyzed: kva sya te rudra mṛḍayākuḥ hastaḥ yaḥ asti bheṣajaḥ jalāṣaḥ
translated: Where is that healing hand of thine, O Rudra, that is a balm, that is a medicine?

original: apabhartā rapaso daivyasyābhī nu mā vṛṣabha cakṣamīthāḥ //
analyzed: apabhartā rapasaḥ daivyasya abhi nu mā vṛṣabha cakṣamīthāḥ
translated: Be thou the remover of the divine disease: look thou upon me, O Bull, with a friendly eye.

original: pra babhrave vṛṣabhāya śvitīce maho mahīṃ suṣṭutim īrayāmi /
analyzed: pra babhrave vṛṣabhāya śvitīce mahaḥ mahīm suṣṭutim īrayāmi
translated: To the brown Bull, to the white-backed one I offer a great and glorious praise.

original: namasyā kalmalīkinaṃ namobhir gṛṇīmasi tveṣaṃ rudrasya nāma //
analyzed: namasya kalmalīkinam namobhiḥ gṛṇīmasi tveṣam rudrasya nāma
translated: We praise with homage the ruddy one, the tawny one, the terrible name of Rudra.

original: sthirebhir aṅgaiḥ pururūpa ugro babhruḥ śukrebhiḥ pipiśe hiraṇyaiḥ /
analyzed: sthirebhiḥ aṅgaiḥ puru rūpaḥ ugraḥ babhruḥ śukrebhiḥ pipiśe hiraṇyaiḥ
translated: With firm limbs, of many forms, the fierce one, the brown one shines with bright golden ones.

original: īśānād asya bhuvanasya bhūrer na vā u yoṣad rudrād asuryam //
analyzed: īśānāt asya bhuvanasya bhūreḥ na vai u yoṣat rudrāt asuryam
translated: From the lord of this wide world, from Rudra, no one may escape his sway.

original: arhan bibharṣi sāyakāni dhanvārhan niṣkaṃ yajataṃ viśvarūpam /
analyzed: arhan bibharṣi sāyakāni dhanvā arhan niṣkam yajatam viśva rūpam
translated: Worthy art thou to bear the shafts, the bow, worthy to sacrifice, to wear the golden chain of every form.

original: arhann idaṃ dayase viśvam abhvaṃ na vā ojīyo rudra tvad asti //
analyzed: arhan idam dayase viśvam abhvam na vai ojīyaḥ rudra tvat asti
translated: Worthy art thou to show mercy to all creatures: there is no power greater than thine, O Rudra.

original: stuhi śrutaṃ gartasadaṃ yuvānam mṛgaṃ na bhīmam upahatnum ugram /🔽mṛḷā jaritre rudra stavāno 'nyaṃ te asman ni vapantu senāḥ //
analyzed: stuhi śrutam garta sadam yuvānam mṛgam na bhīmam upahatnum ugram  mṛḷa jaritre rudra stavānaḥ nyam te asmat ni vapantu senāḥ
translated: Praise the renowned, the young, the dweller in the pit, the terrible, the fierce, the rushing one, like a beast.🔽Be gracious, O Rudra, to the singer: let other hosts than thine fall upon us.

original: kumāraś cit pitaraṃ vandamānam prati nānāma rudropayantam /
analyzed: kumāraḥ cit pitaram vandamānam prati nānāma rudra upayantam
translated: Even the boy, when he reverences his father, is distinguished, when he approaches, from Rudra.

original: bhūrer dātāraṃ satpatiṃ gṛṇīṣe stutas tvam bheṣajā rāsy asme //
analyzed: bhūreḥ dātāram sat patim gṛṇīṣe stutaḥ tvam bheṣajā rāsi asme
translated: I praise the giver of earth, the lord of the good. Praised by me, bestow healing upon us.

original: yā vo bheṣajā marutaḥ śucīni yā śantamā vṛṣaṇo yā mayobhu /
analyzed: yā vaḥ bheṣajā marutaḥ śucīni yā śantamā vṛṣaṇaḥ yā mayobhu
translated: Your pure, most wholesome, invigorating medicines, O Maruts, O mighty ones,

original: yāni manur avṛṇītā pitā nas tā śaṃ ca yoś ca rudrasya vaśmi //🔽pari ṇo hetī rudrasya vṛjyāḥ pari tveṣasya durmatir mahī gāt /
analyzed: yāni manuḥ avṛṇīta ā pitā naḥ tā śam ca yoḥ ca rudrasya vaśmi  pari naḥ hetiḥ rudrasya vṛjyāḥ pari tveṣasya durmatiḥ mahī gāt
translated: Which Manu, our father, chose, for those I pray for welfare and peace from Rudra.🔽Turn away from us the dart of Rudra, turn away the great evil thought of the terrible one.

original: ava sthirā maghavadbhyas tanuṣva mīḍhvas tokāya tanayāya mṛḷa //
analyzed: ava sthirā maghavadbhyaḥ tanuṣva mīḍhvaḥ tokāya tanayāya mṛḍa
translated: Weave firm bonds for the wealthy ones, be gracious to the offspring and children.

original: evā babhro vṛṣabha cekitāna yathā deva na hṛṇīṣe na haṃsi /
analyzed: eva babhro vṛṣabha cekitāna yathā deva na hṛṇīṣe na haṃsi
translated: Thus, O tawny bull, O discerning one, that you may not be angry with us, O god, that you may not strike us,

original: havanaśrun no rudreha bodhi bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //🔽dhārāvarā maruto dhṛṣṇvojaso mṛgā na bhīmās taviṣībhir arcinaḥ /
analyzed: havana śrut naḥ rudra iha bodhi bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ  dhārā varāḥ marutaḥ dhṛṣṇu ojasaḥ mṛgāḥ na bhīmāḥ taviṣībhiḥ arcinaḥ
translated: O Rudra, be attentive to our invocation. May we speak lofty words in the assembly, with brave sons.🔽The Maruts, with flowing streams, of bold strength, terrible like wild beasts, shining with their own might,

original: agnayo na śuśucānā ṛjīṣiṇo bhṛmiṃ dhamanto apa gā avṛṇvata //
analyzed: agnayaḥ na śuśucānāḥ ṛjīṣiṇaḥ bhṛmim dhamantaḥ apa gāḥ avṛṇvata
translated: Like blazing fires, the impetuous ones, blowing on the mist, have loosed the cows.

original: dyāvo na stṛbhiś citayanta khādino vy abhriyā na dyutayanta vṛṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: dyāvaḥ na stṛbhiḥ citayanta khādinaḥ vi abhriyāḥ na dyutayanta vṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: Like the sky, they adorn with their rays, the greedy ones. The rains shine like the clouds.

original: rudro yad vo maruto rukmavakṣaso vṛṣājani pṛśnyāḥ śukra ūdhani //
analyzed: rudraḥ yat vaḥ marutaḥ rukma vakṣasaḥ vṛṣā ajani pṛśnyāḥ śukre ūdhani
translated: When Rudra, O Maruts, with golden breasts, was born as a bull from the white-uddered Pṛśni.

original: ukṣante aśvāṃ atyāṃ ivājiṣu nadasya karṇais turayanta āśubhiḥ /🔽hiraṇyaśiprā maruto davidhvataḥ pṛkṣaṃ yātha pṛṣatībhiḥ samanyavaḥ //
analyzed: ukṣante aśvān atyān iva ājiṣu nadasya karṇaiḥ turayantaḥ āśubhiḥ  hiraṇya śiprāḥ marutaḥ davidhvataḥ pṛkṣam yātha pṛṣatībhiḥ samanyavaḥ
translated: They urge the horses on as in a race, the Maruts with the ears of the roaring (cloud), urging (them) with the swift (wind).🔽The Maruts, with golden swords, with the twang of the bowstring, go to the rain with the spotted (does), with those of one mind.

original: pṛkṣe tā viśvā bhuvanā vavakṣire mitrāya vā sadam ā jīradānavaḥ /🔽pṛṣadaśvāso anavabhrarādhasa ṛjipyāso na vayuneṣu dhūrṣadaḥ //
analyzed: pṛkṣe tā viśvā bhuvanā vavakṣire mitrāya vā sadam ā jīra dānavaḥ  pṛṣat aśvāsaḥ anavabhra rādhasaḥ ṛjipyāsaḥ na vayuneṣu dhūrṣadaḥ
translated: They have all extended that rain over all existing things, the ever-waxing Dânava, for Mitra.🔽With spotted horses, with unfailing gifts, with swift chariots, with yokes that shake, in the sacrifices.

original: indhanvabhir dhenubhī rapśadūdhabhir adhvasmabhiḥ pathibhir bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: indhanvabhiḥ dhenubhiḥ rapśa dūdhabhiḥ adhvasmabhiḥ pathibhiḥ bhrājat ṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: With the kindling-sticks, with the milch-kine whose udders are full of milk, with the paths that lead to the sacrifice, with eyes that shine,

original: ā haṃsāso na svasarāṇi gantana madhor madāya marutaḥ samanyavaḥ //
analyzed: ā haṃsāsaḥ na svasarāṇi gantana madhoḥ madāya marutaḥ samanyavaḥ
translated: Come, O Gâs, to your own abodes, O Maruts, of one mind, to the drinking of the sweet juice.

original: ā no brahmāṇi marutaḥ samanyavo narāṃ na śaṃsaḥ savanāni gantana /
analyzed: ā naḥ brahmāṇi marutaḥ samanyavaḥ narām na śaṃsaḥ savanāni gantana
translated: Come, O Brahmans, O Maruts, of one mind, to the libations of the men, to the praises.

original: aśvām iva pipyata dhenum ūdhani kartā dhiyaṃ jaritre vājapeśasam //
analyzed: aśvām iva pipyata dhenum ūdhani karta dhiyam jaritre vāja peśasam
translated: Make the hymn swell like a milch-cow in the udder of the horse, bestowing strength on the worshipper.

original: taṃ no dāta maruto vājinaṃ ratha āpānam brahma citayad divedive /
analyzed: tam naḥ dāta marutaḥ vājinam rathe āpānam brahma citayat dive dive
translated: Bestow on us, O Maruts, that strong chariot, the drinking-cup, the prayer that is to be desired day by day.

original: iṣaṃ stotṛbhyo vṛjaneṣu kārave sanim medhām ariṣṭaṃ duṣṭaraṃ sahaḥ //
analyzed: iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ vṛjaneṣu kārave sanim medhām ariṣṭam duṣṭaram sahaḥ
translated: Food for the singers in the assemblies, gain, thought, uninjured, irresistible might.

original: yad yuñjate maruto rukmavakṣaso 'śvān ratheṣu bhaga ā sudānavaḥ /
analyzed: yat yuñjate marutaḥ rukma vakṣasaḥ śvān ratheṣu bhagaḥ ā sudānavaḥ
translated: When the Maruts, whose breasts are adorned with gold, yoke their horses to their chariots, O bountiful ones,

original: dhenur na śiśve svasareṣu pinvate janāya rātahaviṣe mahīm iṣam //
analyzed: dhenuḥ na śiśve svasareṣu pinvate janāya rāta haviṣe mahīm iṣam
translated: Like a cow in the stalls of her calf, she swells for the people who offer oblations, for great food.

original: yo no maruto vṛkatāti martyo ripur dadhe vasavo rakṣatā riṣaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ marutaḥ vṛkatāti martyaḥ ripuḥ dadhe vasavaḥ rakṣatā riṣaḥ
translated: O Maruts, the mortal enemy who sets himself against us, O Vasus, protect him from harm.

original: vartayata tapuṣā cakriyābhi tam ava rudrā aśaso hantanā vadhaḥ //
analyzed: vartayata tapuṣā cakriyā abhi tam ava rudrāḥ aśasaḥ hantana vadhaḥ
translated: Turn him with your fiery weapons, O Rudras, destroy him with your deadly weapon.

original: citraṃ tad vo maruto yāma cekite pṛśnyā yad ūdhar apy āpayo duhuḥ /
analyzed: citram tat vaḥ marutaḥ yāma cekite pṛśnyāḥ yat ūdhar api āpayaḥ duhuḥ
translated: That wonderful deed of yours, O Maruts, is to be wondered at, when they milked the udder of Pṛśni for the waters.

original: yad vā nide navamānasya rudriyās tritaṃ jarāya juratām adābhyāḥ //🔽tān vo maho maruta evayāvno viṣṇor eṣasya prabhṛthe havāmahe /
analyzed: yat vā nide navamānasya rudriyāḥ tritam jarāya juratām adābhyāḥ  tān vaḥ mahaḥ marutaḥ eva yāvnaḥ viṣṇoḥ eṣasya prabhṛthe havāmahe
translated: Or when, O infallible ones, you made Trita young again with your old age, in the anger of Rudra.

original: hiraṇyavarṇān kakuhān yatasruco brahmaṇyantaḥ śaṃsyaṃ rādha īmahe //
analyzed: hiraṇya varṇān kakuhān yata srucaḥ brahmaṇyantaḥ śaṃsyam rādhaḥ īmahe
translated: We invoke those of you, O Maruts, who follow the great one, at the sacrifice of Viṣṇu, the golden-hued, the swift, whose ladles are raised, who are in the midst of the Brahman, we invoke the praiseworthy gift.

original: te daśagvāḥ prathamā yajñam ūhire te no hinvantūṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: te daśagvāḥ prathamāḥ yajñam ūhire te naḥ hinvantu uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭiṣu
translated: Those who first led the sacrifice in the tenfold way, may they impel us at the break of dawn.

original: uṣā na rāmīr aruṇair aporṇute maho jyotiṣā śucatā goarṇasā //
analyzed: uṣāḥ na rāmīḥ aruṇaiḥ aporṇute mahaḥ jyotiṣā śucatā go arṇasā
translated: Dawn shines forth with her ruddy rays, with great light, with pure milk for the cows.

original: te kṣoṇībhir aruṇebhir nāñjibhī rudrā ṛtasya sadaneṣu vāvṛdhuḥ /
analyzed: te kṣoṇībhiḥ aruṇebhiḥ nāñjibhiḥ rudrāḥ ṛtasya sadaneṣu vāvṛdhuḥ
translated: They, the Rudras, have grown great in the seats of order with their red regions and their rays.

original: nimeghamānā atyena pājasā suścandraṃ varṇaṃ dadhire supeśasam //
analyzed: nimeghamānāḥ atyena pājasā su ścandram varṇam dadhire supeśasam
translated: They have assumed a very beautiful form, very lovely, with a splendour that is not to be surpassed.

original: tāṃ iyāno mahi varūtham ūtaya upa ghed enā namasā gṛṇīmasi /
analyzed: tām iyānaḥ mahi varūtham ūtaye upa gha id enā namasā gṛṇīmasi
translated: To them, as I invoke them, may he come for help, for protection, and I praise them with adoration.

original: trito na yān pañca hotṝn abhiṣṭaya āvavartad avarāñ cakriyāvase //
analyzed: tritaḥ na yān pañca hotṝn abhiṣṭayaḥ āvavartat avarām
translated: Trita, who for the sake of help turned back the five Hotras who were following after him.

original: yayā radhram pārayathāty aṃho yayā nido muñcatha vanditāram /
analyzed: yayā radhram pārayatha ati aṃhaḥ yayā nidaḥ muñcatha vanditāram
translated: By which (help) ye deliver the poor man over the distress, by which ye set free the man who is to be slain,

original: arvācī sā maruto yā va ūtir o ṣu vāśreva sumatir jigātu //
analyzed: arvācī sā marutaḥ yā vaḥ ūtiḥ ā u su vāśrā iva sumatiḥ jigātu
translated: May that help of yours, O Maruts, come hither, and may your favour come quickly like a cow.

original: upem asṛkṣi vājayur vacasyāṃ cano dadhīta nādyo giro me /
analyzed: upa īm asṛkṣi vājayuḥ vacasyām canaḥ dadhīta na adyaḥ giraḥ me
translated: To this (cow) I have come, eager for strength, for the sake of praise. May the giver accept my songs.

original: apāṃ napād āśuhemā kuvit sa supeśasas karati joṣiṣad dhi //
analyzed: apām napāt āśu hemā kuvid sa supeśasaḥ karati joṣiṣat hi
translated: The swift-moving one of the waters, will he not make (her) very lovely, for he is inclined to favour (us).

original: imaṃ sv asmai hṛda ā sutaṣṭam mantraṃ vocema kuvid asya vedat /
analyzed: imam su asmai hṛde ā su taṣṭam mantram vocema kuvid asya vedat
translated: To him I will speak this hymn, well-fashioned in the heart. Who knows, he may understand it.

original: apāṃ napād asuryasya mahnā viśvāny aryo bhuvanā jajāna //
analyzed: apām napāt asuryasya mahnā viśvāni aryaḥ bhuvanā jajāna
translated: The waters' foot, by the greatness of the Asura, has brought forth all the created things.

original: sam anyā yanty upa yanty anyāḥ samānam ūrvaṃ nadyaḥ pṛṇanti /
analyzed: sam anyāḥ yanti upa yanti anyāḥ samānam ūrvam nadyaḥ pṛṇanti
translated: Some of the rivers flow together, some flow separately, all fill the same plain.

original: tam ū śuciṃ śucayo dīdivāṃsam apāṃ napātam pari tasthur āpaḥ //
analyzed: tam ū śucim śucayaḥ dīdivāṃsam apām napātam pari tasthuḥ āpaḥ
translated: Him, the pure one, the pure ones, the shining one, the son of the waters, the waters have surrounded.

original: tam asmerā yuvatayo yuvānam marmṛjyamānāḥ pari yanty āpaḥ /
analyzed: tam asmerāḥ yuvatayaḥ yuvānam marmṛjyamānāḥ pari yanti āpaḥ
translated: The unmarried girls, the unmarried ones, the young one, the young one, the one being anointed, the waters go around him.

original: sa śukrebhiḥ śikvabhī revad asme dīdāyānidhmo ghṛtanirṇig apsu //
analyzed: sa śukrebhiḥ śikvabhiḥ revat asme dīdāya a nidhmaḥ ghṛta nirṇij apsu
translated: He, with the bright ones, with the shining ones, the prosperous one, for us, the one with the kindled fire, the one with the ghee-dripping (oblations), in the waters.

original: asmai tisro avyathyāya nārīr devāya devīr didhiṣanty annam /
analyzed: asmai tisraḥ avyathyāya nārīḥ devāya devīḥ didhiṣanti annam
translated: For him, for the unshaken one, three women, for the god, the goddesses prepare food.

original: kṛtā ivopa hi prasarsre apsu sa pīyūṣaṃ dhayati pūrvasūnām //
analyzed: kṛtāḥ iva upa hi prasarsre apsu sa pīyūṣam dhayati pūrvasūnām
translated: As if made, he has spread out in the waters. He sucks the milk of the earlier cows.

original: aśvasyātra janimāsya ca svar druho riṣaḥ sampṛcaḥ pāhi sūrīn /
analyzed: aśvasya atra janima asya ca svar druhaḥ riṣaḥ sampṛcaḥ pāhi sūrīn
translated: Here is the birth of the horse, and of heaven. Protect the seers from the enmity, hostility, and harm of the enemies.

original: āmāsu pūrṣu paro apramṛṣyaṃ nārātayo vi naśan nānṛtāni //🔽sva ā dame sudughā yasya dhenuḥ svadhām pīpāya subhv annam atti /
analyzed: āmāsu pūrṣu paras apramṛṣyam na arātayaḥ vi naśan na anṛtāni  sve ā dame sudughā yasya dhenuḥ svadhām pīpāya subhu annam atti
translated: In the raw, old (cows), beyond destruction, the non-harming ones, destroying the falsehoods.🔽He whose cow yields well in her own stall, his own nourishment, the strong one eats good food.

original: so apāṃ napād ūrjayann apsv antar vasudeyāya vidhate vi bhāti //
analyzed: saḥ apām napāt ūrjayan apsu antar vasu deyāya vidhate vi bhāti
translated: He, the one with the feet in the waters, nourishing, in the waters, shines, being appointed for the bestowal of treasure.

original: yo apsv ā śucinā daivyena ṛtāvājasra urviyā vibhāti /
analyzed: yaḥ apsu ā śucinā daivyena ṛtāvā ajasraḥ urviyā vibhāti
translated: He who in the waters shines with pure divine truth, the truthful one, the ever-flowing one, with vast extent.

original: vayā id anyā bhuvanāny asya pra jāyante vīrudhaś ca prajābhiḥ //
analyzed: vayāḥ id anyā bhuvanāni asya pra jāyante vīrudhaḥ ca prajābhiḥ
translated: Other beings of him are born from him, the plants with offspring.

original: apāṃ napād ā hy asthād upasthaṃ jihmānām ūrdhvo vidyutaṃ vasānaḥ /
analyzed: apām napāt ā hi asthāt upastham jihmānām ūrdhvaḥ vidyutam vasānaḥ
translated: The son of the waters hath risen up to the place of the crooked ones, standing erect, clothed in lightning.

original: tasya jyeṣṭham mahimānaṃ vahantīr hiraṇyavarṇāḥ pari yanti yahvīḥ //
analyzed: tasya jyeṣṭham mahimānam vahantīḥ hiraṇya varṇāḥ pari yanti yahvīḥ
translated: Bearing the most excellent greatness of him, the youthful ones of golden hue go round.

original: hiraṇyarūpaḥ sa hiraṇyasaṃdṛg apāṃ napāt sed u hiraṇyavarṇaḥ /
analyzed: hiraṇya rūpaḥ sa hiraṇya saṃdṛś apām napāt sa id u hiraṇya varṇaḥ
translated: He is golden-hued, he is golden-coloured, the son of the waters, he is of golden hue.

original: hiraṇyayāt pari yoner niṣadyā hiraṇyadā dadaty annam asmai //🔽tad asyānīkam uta cāru nāmāpīcyaṃ vardhate naptur apām /
analyzed: hiraṇyayāt pari yoneḥ niṣadyā hiraṇya dāḥ dadati annam asmai  tat asya anīkam uta cāru nāma āpīcyam vardhate naptuḥ apām
translated: From the golden womb, from the seat, he who gives gold gives food to him.🔽That is his beautiful name, his host, the wondrous one increases of the waters' grandson.

original: yam indhate yuvatayaḥ sam itthā hiraṇyavarṇaṃ ghṛtam annam asya //🔽asmai bahūnām avamāya sakhye yajñair vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ /
analyzed: yam indhate yuvatayaḥ sam itthā hiraṇya varṇam ghṛtam annam asya  asmai bahūnām avamāya sakhye yajñaiḥ vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ
translated: Whom the maidens kindle together, of golden hue, ghee is his food.🔽To him, the youngest of the many, for friendship, let us serve with sacrifices, with homage, with oblations.

original: saṃ sānu mārjmi didhiṣāmi bilmair dadhāmy annaiḥ pari vanda ṛgbhiḥ //
analyzed: sam sānu mārjmi didhiṣāmi bilmaiḥ dadhāmi annaiḥ pari vande ṛgbhiḥ
translated: I cleanse his summit, I delight him with the songs, I fill him with foods, I honour him with the hymns.

original: sa īṃ vṛṣājanayat tāsu garbhaṃ sa īṃ śiśur dhayati taṃ rihanti /
analyzed: saḥ īm vṛṣā ajanayat tāsu garbham saḥ īm śiśuḥ dhayati tam rihanti
translated: He, the bull, begot that embryo in them, he, the child, sucks it, they lick him.

original: so apāṃ napād anabhimlātavarṇo 'nyasyeveha tanvā viveṣa //
analyzed: saḥ apām napāt an abhimlāta varṇaḥ nyasya iva iha tanvā viveṣa
translated: He, the son of the waters, of unfaded hue, hath entered here as if into another's body.

original: asmin pade parame tasthivāṃsam adhvasmabhir viśvahā dīdivāṃsam /
analyzed: asmin pade parame tasthivāṃsam adhvasmabhiḥ viśvahā dīdivāṃsam
translated: Him, who hath stood in this highest place, shining with the paths, ever shining,

original: āpo naptre ghṛtam annaṃ vahantīḥ svayam atkaiḥ pari dīyanti yahvīḥ //
analyzed: āpaḥ naptre ghṛtam annam vahantīḥ svayam atkaiḥ pari dīyanti yahvīḥ
translated: The waters, the daughters of the sky, bearing ghee as food, are carried around by their own girdles.

original: ayāṃsam agne sukṣitiṃ janāyāyāṃsam u maghavadbhyaḥ suvṛktim /
analyzed: ayāṃsam agne su kṣitim janāya ayāṃsam u maghavadbhyaḥ suvṛktim
translated: O Agni, give the people a good abode, and to the wealthy ones a good hymn.

original: viśvaṃ tad bhadraṃ yad avanti devā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: viśvam tat bhadram yat avanti devāḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: All that is good which the gods favor, may we speak loftily in the assembly, with good heroes.

original: tubhyaṃ hinvāno vasiṣṭa gā apo 'dhukṣan sīm avibhir adribhir naraḥ /
analyzed: tubhyam hinvānaḥ vasiṣṭa gāḥ apaḥ dhukṣan sīm avibhiḥ adribhiḥ naraḥ
translated: O Vasishtha, the men, urging you on, have milked the waters with their sheep and stones.

original: pibendra svāhā prahutaṃ vaṣaṭkṛtaṃ hotrād ā somam prathamo ya īśiṣe //
analyzed: piba indra svāhā prahutam vaṣaṭkṛtam hotrāt ā somam prathamaḥ yaḥ īśiṣe
translated: O Indra, drink the Svâhâ-offered, the Vashat-uttered Soma, which is first to be thine from the Hotri.

original: yajñaiḥ sammiślāḥ pṛṣatībhir ṛṣṭibhir yāmañ chubhrāso añjiṣu priyā uta /
analyzed: yajñaiḥ sammiślāḥ pṛṣatībhiḥ ṛṣṭibhiḥ yāmam śubhrāsaḥ añjiṣu priyāḥ uta
translated: The bright ones, with their spotted spears, are mingled with the sacrifices, and are dear in the anointed places.

original: āsadyā barhir bharatasya sūnavaḥ potrād ā somam pibatā divo naraḥ //
analyzed: āsadya barhiḥ bharatasya sūnavaḥ potrāt ā somam pibata divaḥ naraḥ
translated: Having sat down on the sacrificial grass, O sons of Bharata, drink the Soma from the Hotri, O men of heaven.

original: ameva naḥ suhavā ā hi gantana ni barhiṣi sadatanā raṇiṣṭana /
analyzed: amā iva naḥ su havāḥ ā hi gantana ni barhiṣi sadatana raṇiṣṭana
translated: Come to us, O ye who are easily invoked! Sit on the sacrificial grass, and rejoice there!

original: athā mandasva jujuṣāṇo andhasas tvaṣṭar devebhir janibhiḥ sumadgaṇaḥ //
analyzed: athā mandasva jujuṣāṇaḥ andhasaḥ tvaṣṭar devebhiḥ janibhiḥ sumat gaṇaḥ
translated: Then, O Tvashtar, rejoice, being pleased with the juice, with the gods, with thy kinsmen, with a great company.

original: ā vakṣi devāṃ iha vipra yakṣi cośan hotar ni ṣadā yoniṣu triṣu /
analyzed: ā vakṣi devān iha vipra yakṣi ca uśan hotar ni sadā yoniṣu triṣu
translated: O priest, bring the gods hither, and worship them! O Hotri, sit in the three sacred seats!

original: prati vīhi prasthitaṃ somyam madhu pibāgnīdhrāt tava bhāgasya tṛpṇuhi //
analyzed: prati vīhi prasthitam somyam madhu piba āgnīdhrāt tava bhāgasya tṛpṇuhi
translated: Accept the offered, Soma-mingled, mead. Drink from the Agnidh's share. Be satisfied.

original: eṣa sya te tanvo nṛmṇavardhanaḥ saha ojaḥ pradivi bāhvor hitaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa sya te tanvaḥ nṛmṇa vardhanaḥ sahaḥ ojaḥ pradivi bāhvoḥ hitaḥ
translated: This, strengthening thy body's manly power, thy strength, is laid within thy arms, O thou of ample sway.

original: tubhyaṃ suto maghavan tubhyam ābhṛtas tvam asya brāhmaṇād ā tṛpat piba //
analyzed: tubhyam sutaḥ maghavan tubhyam ābhṛtaḥ tvam asya brāhmaṇāt ā tṛpat piba
translated: Pressed out for thee, O Maghavan, brought to thee, drink thou thy fill of this, O thou, from the Brāhman's hand.

original: juṣethāṃ yajñam bodhataṃ havasya me satto hotā nividaḥ pūrvyā anu /
analyzed: juṣethām yajñam bodhatam havasya me sattaḥ hotā nividaḥ pūrvyāḥ anu
translated: Enjoy the sacrifice, be watchful of my call, as Priest, sit in thy wonted place, according to the ancient rite.

original: acchā rājānā nama ety āvṛtam praśāstrād ā pibataṃ somyam madhu //🔽mandasva hotrād anu joṣam andhaso 'dhvaryavaḥ sa pūrṇāṃ vaṣṭy āsicam /
analyzed: acchā rājānā namaḥ eti āvṛtam praśāstrāt ā pibatam somyam madhu  mandasva hotrāt anu joṣam andhasaḥ dhvaryavaḥ sa pūrṇām vaṣṭi āsicam
translated: Come to the homage, O ye Kings, come to the rite: drink ye the Soma-mingled draught from out the spoon.🔽Rejoice thee in the Hotar's share of Soma juice. The Adhvaryus fill the ladle full for thee.

original: tasmā etam bharata tadvaśo dadir hotrāt somaṃ draviṇodaḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ //
analyzed: tasmai etam bharata tad vaśaḥ dadiḥ hotrāt somam draviṇaḥ daḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ
translated: Bring him this, O ye Bharatas, who gives according to his will. Drink thou the Soma from the Hotar's share, O thou who givest wealth, in due season.

original: yam u pūrvam ahuve tam idaṃ huve sed u havyo dadir yo nāma patyate /
analyzed: yam u pūrvam ahuve tam idam huve sa id u havyaḥ dadiḥ yaḥ nāma patyate
translated: Whom I have called on first, on him I call this day. He is the giver who is called by name.

original: adhvaryubhiḥ prasthitaṃ somyam madhu potrāt somaṃ draviṇodaḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ //
analyzed: adhvaryubhiḥ prasthitam somyam madhu potrāt somam draviṇaḥ daḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ
translated: The Soma-mingled draught, set forth by the Adhvaryus, drink thou the Soma from the Potar's share, O thou who givest wealth, in due season.

original: medyantu te vahnayo yebhir īyase 'riṣaṇyan vīḷayasvā vanaspate /
analyzed: medyantu te vahnayaḥ yebhiḥ īyase riṣaṇyan vīḍayasva vanaspate
translated: Let thy fires blaze, wherewith thou goest forth unhindered. O Tree, spread out thy branches wide.

original: āyūyā dhṛṣṇo abhigūryā tvaṃ neṣṭrāt somaṃ draviṇodaḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ //🔽apād dhotrād uta potrād amattota neṣṭrād ajuṣata prayo hitam /
analyzed: āyūya dhṛṣṇo abhigūrya tvam neṣṭrāt somam draviṇaḥ daḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ  apāt hotrāt uta potrāt amatta uta neṣṭrāt ajuṣata prayaḥ hitam
translated: Come hither, O thou who art to be invoked, come hither to the pressing-stone. O thou who givest wealth, drink the Soma with the seasons from the Neshtar.🔽He has drunk from the Hotar's cup, and from the Potri's, and has become intoxicated. He has accepted the offering brought by the Neshtar.

original: turīyam pātram amṛktam amartyaṃ draviṇodāḥ pibatu drāviṇodasaḥ //
analyzed: turīyam pātram amṛktam amartyam draviṇaḥ dāḥ pibatu drāviṇodasaḥ
translated: Let the immortal one, the fourth cup, untouched by death, the giver of wealth, drink of the Soma, O ye givers of wealth.

original: arvāñcam adya yayyaṃ nṛvāhaṇaṃ rathaṃ yuñjāthām iha vāṃ vimocanam /
analyzed: arvāñcam adya yayyam nṛvāhaṇam ratham yuñjāthām iha vām vimocanam
translated: Today yoke ye the car that bringeth men hither, that which is to be loosed here for you.

original: pṛṅktaṃ havīṃṣi madhunā hi kaṃ gatam athā somam pibataṃ vājinīvasū //
analyzed: pṛṅktam havīṃṣi madhunā hi kam gatam athā somam pibatam vājinīvasū
translated: Anoint the oblations with honey, for ye have come hither. Then drink the Soma, O ye two wealthy ones.

original: joṣy agne samidhaṃ joṣy āhutiṃ joṣi brahma janyaṃ joṣi suṣṭutim /
analyzed: joṣi agne samidham joṣi āhutim joṣi brahma janyam joṣi suṣṭutim
translated: Accept the kindling-stick, O Agni, accept the offering. Accept the prayer of the suppliant, accept the eulogy.

original: viśvebhir viśvāṃ ṛtunā vaso maha uśan devāṃ uśataḥ pāyayā haviḥ //
analyzed: viśvebhiḥ viśvān ṛtunā vaso mahaḥ uśan devān uśataḥ pāyaya haviḥ
translated: With all, O all-bountiful one, with the season, be pleased. Eagerly offer the oblation to the eager gods.

original: ud u ṣya devaḥ savitā savāya śaśvattamaṃ tadapā vahnir asthāt /
analyzed: ud u sya devaḥ savitā savāya śaśvattamam tad apāḥ vahniḥ asthāt
translated: The god Savitar has risen up for his own work. The most ancient bearer of the oblation has stood up.

original: nūnaṃ devebhyo vi hi dhāti ratnam athābhajad vītihotraṃ svastau //
analyzed: nūnam devebhyaḥ vi hi dhāti ratnam athā abhajat vītihotram svastau
translated: Now he distributes the treasure to the gods. He has assigned the all-sacrificing one to prosperity.

original: viśvasya hi śruṣṭaye deva ūrdhvaḥ pra bāhavā pṛthupāṇiḥ sisarti /
analyzed: viśvasya hi śruṣṭaye devaḥ ūrdhvaḥ pra bāhū ā pṛthu pāṇiḥ sisarti
translated: For the hearing of all, the god, lofty, with wide arms, wide-handed, sends forth.

original: āpaś cid asya vrata ā nimṛgrā ayaṃ cid vāto ramate parijman //
analyzed: āpaḥ cit asya vrate ā nimṛgrāḥ ayam cit vātaḥ ramate parijman
translated: Even the waters are subject to his law, and this wind, the wanderer, delights in him.

original: āśubhiś cid yān vi mucāti nūnam arīramad atamānaṃ cid etoḥ /
analyzed: āśubhiḥ cit yān vi mucāti nūnam arīramat atamānam cit etoḥ
translated: Whom he will surely loose with his swift steeds, even the most impetuous one from his abode.

original: ahyarṣūṇāṃ cin ny ayāṃ aviṣyām anu vrataṃ savitur moky āgāt //
analyzed: ahyarṣūṇām cit ni ayām aviṣyām anu vratam savituḥ mokī āgāt
translated: Even of the swift ones have I made the slow ones, and have come to the release of Savitar's law.

original: punaḥ sam avyad vitataṃ vayantī madhyā kartor ny adhāc chakma dhīraḥ /
analyzed: punar sam avyat vitatam vayantī madhyā kartoḥ ni adhāt śakma dhīraḥ
translated: The wise one, the middlemost, has put together the scattered, the extended, the weaver's woof.

original: ut saṃhāyāsthād vy ṛtūṃr adardhar aramatiḥ savitā deva āgāt //
analyzed: ud saṃhāya asthāt vi ṛtūṃr adardhar aramatiḥ savitā devaḥ āgāt
translated: He has risen up, he has divided the seasons. Savitar, the god, the entertainer, has come.

original: nānaukāṃsi duryo viśvam āyur vi tiṣṭhate prabhavaḥ śoko agneḥ /
analyzed: nānā okāṃsi duryaḥ viśvam āyuḥ vi tiṣṭhate prabhavaḥ śokaḥ agneḥ
translated: The various ships, all life, are spread out in front. The flame of Agni is the source of light.

original: jyeṣṭham mātā sūnave bhāgam ādhād anv asya ketam iṣitaṃ savitrā //🔽samāvavarti viṣṭhito jigīṣur viśveṣāṃ kāmaś caratām amābhūt /
analyzed: jyeṣṭham mātā sūnave bhāgam ādhāt anu asya ketam iṣitam savitrā  samāvavarti viṣṭhitaḥ jigīṣuḥ viśveṣām kāmaḥ caratām amā abhūt
translated: The mother has assigned to her son the highest portion. After his impulse has Savitar sent forth his light.🔽He has turned back, he who stands firm, he who would conquer. The desire of all who move has become his own.

original: śaśvāṃ apo vikṛtaṃ hitvy āgād anu vrataṃ savitur daivyasya //
analyzed: śaśvān apaḥ vikṛtam hitvī āgāt anu vratam savituḥ daivyasya
translated: He has come, the varied one, leaving the distant waters, after the law of the divine Savitar.

original: tvayā hitam apyam apsu bhāgaṃ dhanvānv ā mṛgayaso vi tasthuḥ /
analyzed: tvayā hitam apyam apsu bhāgam dhanva anu ā mṛgayasaḥ vi tasthuḥ
translated: The portion of water which is assigned to you in the waters, the hunters have spread out over the deserts.

original: vanāni vibhyo nakir asya tāni vratā devasya savitur minanti //
analyzed: vanāni vibhyaḥ nakir asya tāni vratā devasya savituḥ minanti
translated: No one violates those ordinances of the god Savitar, the forest-dweller, the forest-dweller.

translated: The all-pervading Savita, the sun, has opened the doors of the world, and has spread out the forms of life, as Varuna, the lord of waters, opens the doors of the ocean, and spreads out the waters.🔽The all-pervading Savita, the sun, has opened the doors of the world, and has spread out the forms of life, as Varuna, the lord of waters, opens the doors of the ocean, and spreads out the waters.

analyzed: mene iva tanvā śumbhamāne dampatī iva kratu vidā janeṣu
translated: As if thinking, shining with their bodies, like a married couple, knowing the sacrifice among the people.

original: śṛṅgeva naḥ prathamā gantam arvāk chaphāv iva jarbhurāṇā tarobhiḥ /
analyzed: śṛṅgā iva naḥ prathamā gantam arvāk śaphau iva jarbhurāṇā tarobhiḥ
translated: Come to us first like horns, with the swift ones like hooves,

translated: Like a pair of chakravaka birds at dawn, come to us like two charioteers, O Shakra.🔽Carry us across like a boat, like a yoke, like a cloud, like a support, like a roof.

original: śvāneva no ariṣaṇyā tanūnāṃ khṛgaleva visrasaḥ pātam asmān //
analyzed: śvānā iva naḥ ariṣaṇyā tanūnām khṛgalā iva visrasaḥ pātam asmān
translated: Protect our bodies from harm like two dogs, protect us from the jaws like two fetters.

original: vātevājuryā nadyeva rītir akṣī iva cakṣuṣā yātam arvāk /
analyzed: vātā iva ajuryā nadyā iva rītiḥ akṣī iva cakṣuṣā yātam arvāk
translated: Come to us like the wind and the swift waters, like two eyes with sight.

original: hastāv iva tanve śambhaviṣṭhā pādeva no nayataṃ vasyo accha //🔽oṣṭhāv iva madhv āsne vadantā stanāv iva pipyataṃ jīvase naḥ /
analyzed: hastau iva tanve śambhaviṣṭhā pādā iva naḥ nayatam vasyaḥ accha  oṣṭhau iva madhū āsne vadantā stanau iva pipyatam jīvase naḥ
translated: Most auspicious, like two arms to the body, lead us to what is good like two feet.🔽Like two lips smeared with honey, speaking, like two breasts, swell for our life.

original: nāseva nas tanvo rakṣitārā karṇāv iva suśrutā bhūtam asme //
analyzed: nāsā iva naḥ tanvaḥ rakṣitārā karṇau iva su śrutā bhūtam asme
translated: Protect our bodies like two noses, be to us like two well-hearing ears.

original: hasteva śaktim abhi saṃdadī naḥ kṣāmeva naḥ sam ajataṃ rajāṃsi /
analyzed: hastā iva śaktim abhi saṃdadī naḥ kṣāmā iva naḥ sam ajatam rajāṃsi
translated: Like two hands grasping a spear for us, like two fields joining our regions,

original: imā giro aśvinā yuṣmayantīḥ kṣṇotreṇeva svadhitiṃ saṃ śiśītam //
analyzed: imāḥ giraḥ aśvinā yuṣmayantīḥ kṣṇotreṇa iva svadhitim sam śiśītam
translated: Sharpen these songs of ours, O Asvins, like a razor with your teeth.

original: etāni vām aśvinā vardhanāni brahma stomaṃ gṛtsamadāso akran /
analyzed: etāni vām aśvinā vardhanāni brahma stomam gṛtsamadāsaḥ akran
translated: These are your two, O Asvins, your strengthening gifts: the Gritsamadas have made the prayer and praise.

original: tāni narā jujuṣāṇopa yātam bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: tāni narā jujuṣāṇā upa yātam bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: Accepting these, O Heroes, come to us: in the assembly may we speak boldly, with brave sons.

original: somāpūṣaṇā jananā rayīṇāṃ jananā divo jananā pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: somāpūṣaṇā jananā rayīṇām jananā divaḥ jananā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Soma and Pûshan, the begetters of wealth, the begetters of heaven, the begetters of earth,

original: jātau viśvasya bhuvanasya gopau devā akṛṇvann amṛtasya nābhim //
analyzed: jātau viśvasya bhuvanasya gopau devāḥ akṛṇvan amṛtasya nābhim
translated: The two who are born to be the guardians of all the world, the Gods have made the navel of immortality.

original: imau devau jāyamānau juṣantemau tamāṃsi gūhatām ajuṣṭā /
analyzed: imau devau jāyamānau juṣanta imau tamāṃsi gūhatām ajuṣṭā
translated: These two Gods rejoice in being born, these two conceal the hateful darkness.

original: ābhyām indraḥ pakvam āmāsv antaḥ somāpūṣabhyāṃ janad usriyāsu //
analyzed: ābhyām indraḥ pakvam āmāsu antar somāpūṣabhyām janat usriyāsu
translated: By these may Indra, by Soma and Pûshan, beget the ripe corn in the unripe plants.

original: somāpūṣaṇā rajaso vimānaṃ saptacakraṃ ratham aviśvaminvam /
analyzed: somāpūṣaṇā rajasaḥ vimānam sapta cakram ratham a viśvaminvam
translated: Soma and Pûshan, the measure of the region, the car with seven wheels, which none may hinder,

original: viṣūvṛtam manasā yujyamānaṃ taṃ jinvatho vṛṣaṇā pañcaraśmim //
analyzed: viṣūvṛtam manasā yujyamānam tam jinvathaḥ vṛṣaṇā pañca raśmim
translated: Which is turned round, yoked with the mind, that do ye quicken, O ye Mighty, with five reins.

original: divy anyaḥ sadanaṃ cakra uccā pṛthivyām anyo adhy antarikṣe /
analyzed: divi anyaḥ sadanam cakre uccā pṛthivyām anyaḥ adhi antarikṣe
translated: One of these Gods hath made his lofty station in the sky, and one upon the earth in the atmosphere.

original: tāv asmabhyam puruvāram purukṣuṃ rāyas poṣaṃ vi ṣyatāṃ nābhim asme //
analyzed: tau asmabhyam puru vāram purukṣum rāyaḥ poṣam vi syatām nābhim asme
translated: May they, bestowing much, the rich in corn, extend to us the navel of the growth of wealth.

original: viśvāny anyo bhuvanā jajāna viśvam anyo abhicakṣāṇa eti /
analyzed: viśvāni anyaḥ bhuvanā jajāna viśvam anyaḥ abhicakṣāṇaḥ eti
translated: One of these Gods hath brought forth all the worlds: the other goeth forth surveying all.

original: somāpūṣaṇāv avataṃ dhiyam me yuvābhyāṃ viśvāḥ pṛtanā jayema //
analyzed: somāpūṣaṇau avatam dhiyam me yuvābhyām viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ jayema
translated: O Soma and Pūṣan, help my thought. By you may we conquer all battles.

original: dhiyam pūṣā jinvatu viśvaminvo rayiṃ somo rayipatir dadhātu /
analyzed: dhiyam pūṣā jinvatu viśvaminvaḥ rayim somaḥ rayi patiḥ dadhātu
translated: May Pūṣan stimulate my thought, the supporter of all. May Soma, lord of wealth, bestow wealth on me.

original: avatu devy aditir anarvā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: avatu devī aditiḥ anarvā bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: May the goddess Aditi, the unerring one, protect us. May we speak lofty words in the assembly, with brave sons.

original: vāyo ye te sahasriṇo rathāsas tebhir ā gahi /
analyzed: vāyo ye te sahasriṇaḥ rathāsaḥ tebhiḥ ā gahi
translated: O Vayu, come with those chariots of yours that are worth a thousand.

original: niyutvān somapītaye //
analyzed: niyutvān soma pītaye
translated: Together with the troop, to drink the Soma.

original: niyutvān vāyav ā gahy ayaṃ śukro ayāmi te /
analyzed: niyutvān vāyo ā gahi ayam śukraḥ ayāmi te
translated: Together with the troop, O Vayu, come hither. This bright (Soma) is pressed for you.

original: gantāsi sunvato gṛham //
analyzed: gantāsi sunvataḥ gṛham
translated: You will go to the house of the presser.

original: śukrasyādya gavāśira indravāyū niyutvataḥ /
analyzed: śukrasya adya gavāśiraḥ indra vāyū niyutvataḥ
translated: O Indra and Vayu, today, O lords of the troop, come to the head of the bright (Soma) and the cow.

original: ā yātam pibataṃ narā //
analyzed: ā yātam pibatam narā
translated: Come, O heroes, and drink.

original: ayaṃ vām mitrāvaruṇā sutaḥ soma ṛtāvṛdhā /
analyzed: ayam vām mitrāvaruṇā sutaḥ somaḥ ṛtāvṛdhā
translated: This Soma, O Mitra and Varuṇa, is pressed for you, O you who uphold the truth.

original: mamed iha śrutaṃ havam //
analyzed: mama id iha śrutam havam
translated: Listen here to my call.

original: rājānāv anabhidruhā dhruve sadasy uttame /
analyzed: rājānau an abhidruhā dhruve sadasi uttame
translated: O kings who do not oppress, on the firm, highest seat,

original: sahasrasthūṇa āsāte //
analyzed: sahasra sthūṇe āsāte
translated: They sit with a thousand pillars.

original: tā samrājā ghṛtāsutī ādityā dānunas patī /
analyzed: tā samrājā ghṛta āsutī ādityā dānunas patī
translated: Those two emperors, who delight in ghee, the Ādityas, the lords of the generous,

original: sacete anavahvaram //
analyzed: sacete anavahvaram
translated: They go together to the unerring one.

original: gomad ū ṣu nāsatyāśvāvad yātam aśvinā /
analyzed: gomat ū su nāsatyā aśvāvat yātam aśvinā
translated: O Nāsatyas, come, O Aśvins, on a chariot rich in cows and horses,

original: vartī rudrā nṛpāyyam //
analyzed: vartiḥ rudrāḥ nṛpāyyam
translated: You two Rudras, who are worthy of men.

original: na yat paro nāntara ādadharṣad vṛṣaṇvasū /
analyzed: na yat paras na antare ādadharṣat vṛṣaṇvasū
translated: Which (enemy), neither from near nor from far, would oppress you, O you whose wealth is great,

original: duḥśaṃso martyo ripuḥ //
analyzed: duḥśaṃsaḥ martyaḥ ripuḥ
translated: Man is a wicked enemy.

original: tā na ā voḷham aśvinā rayim piśaṅgasaṃdṛśam /🔽dhiṣṇyā varivovidam //
analyzed: tā naḥ ā voḷham aśvinā rayim piśaṅga saṃdṛśam  dhiṣṇyā varivaḥ vidam
translated: O Asvins, we invoke that wealth of yours, which is like gold,🔽Which is the most delightful.

original: indro aṅga mahad bhayam abhī ṣad apa cucyavat /
analyzed: indraḥ aṅga mahat bhayam abhī sat apa cucyavat
translated: Indra, indeed, has overcome a great fear, and has shaken it off.

original: sa hi sthiro vicarṣaṇiḥ //
analyzed: sa hi sthiraḥ vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: For he is firm, and very active.

original: indraś ca mṛḷayāti no na naḥ paścād aghaṃ naśat /
analyzed: indraḥ ca mṛḍayāti naḥ na naḥ paścāt agham naśat
translated: May Indra be gracious to us, and may he not inflict evil on us from behind.

original: bhadram bhavāti naḥ puraḥ //🔽indra āśābhyas pari sarvābhyo abhayaṃ karat /
analyzed: bhadram bhavāti naḥ puras  indraḥ āśābhyaḥ pari sarvābhyaḥ abhayam karat
translated: May he be propitious to us in front.🔽May Indra grant us freedom from fear on every side.

original: jetā śatrūn vicarṣaṇiḥ //
analyzed: jetā śatrūn vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: The conqueror of enemies, the very active one.

original: viśve devāsa ā gata śṛṇutā ma imaṃ havam /🔽edam barhir ni ṣīdata //
analyzed: viśve devāsaḥ ā gata śṛṇutā me imam havam  ā idam barhiḥ ni sīdata
translated: All ye Gods, come hither, listen to this my invocation.🔽Sit ye down on this sacred grass.

original: tīvro vo madhumāṃ ayaṃ śunahotreṣu matsaraḥ /
analyzed: tīvraḥ vaḥ madhumān ayam śunahotreṣu matsaraḥ
translated: This gladdening drink of yours, O ye of Shunahotra, is strong and full of sweetness.

original: etam pibata kāmyam //
analyzed: etam pibata kāmyam
translated: Drink ye this delightful one.

original: indrajyeṣṭhā marudgaṇā devāsaḥ pūṣarātayaḥ /
analyzed: indra jyeṣṭhāḥ marut gaṇāḥ devāsaḥ pūṣa rātayaḥ
translated: Ye Gods, headed by Indra, the Maruts, the sons of Prani, the all-conquering,

original: viśve mama śrutā havam //
analyzed: viśve mama śruta havam
translated: All of them have heard my invocation.

original: ambitame nadītame devitame sarasvati /
analyzed: ambitame nadītame devitame sarasvati
translated: Most bountiful, O Sarasvati, most delightful, most divine,

original: apraśastā iva smasi praśastim amba nas kṛdhi //
analyzed: apraśastāḥ iva smasi praśastim amba naḥ kṛdhi
translated: We are as it were unpraised; do thou, O mother, make us praised.

original: tve viśvā sarasvati śritāyūṃṣi devyām /
analyzed: tve viśvā sarasvati śritā āyūṃṣi devyām
translated: In thee, O Sarasvati, divine, are all the long-lasting powers.

original: śunahotreṣu matsva prajāṃ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ //
analyzed: śunahotreṣu matsva prajām devi didiḍḍhi naḥ
translated: Rejoice among the Shunahotras; grant us offspring, O Goddess.

original: imā brahma sarasvati juṣasva vājinīvati /
analyzed: imā brahma sarasvati juṣasva vājinīvati
translated: O Brahman, Sarasvati, accept these, O you who possess strength,

original: yā te manma gṛtsamadā ṛtāvari priyā deveṣu juhvati //
analyzed: yā te manma gṛtsamadāḥ ṛtāvari priyā deveṣu juhvati
translated: The thought of you, O you who are true to your promise, which the Gritsamadas, dear to the gods, offer to you.

original: pretāṃ yajñasya śambhuvā yuvām id ā vṛṇīmahe /
analyzed: pretām yajñasya śambhuvā yuvām id ā vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose you two today, O you who bring prosperity to the sacrifice,

original: agniṃ ca havyavāhanam //🔽dyāvā naḥ pṛthivī imaṃ sidhram adya divispṛśam /
analyzed: agnim ca havyavāhanam  dyāvā naḥ pṛthivī imam sidhram adya divispṛśam
translated: And Agni, the bearer of oblations.🔽O Heaven and Earth, accept this prosperous sacrifice today, reaching to the sky,

original: yajñaṃ deveṣu yacchatām //
analyzed: yajñam deveṣu yacchatām
translated: Which we offer to the gods.

original: ā vām upastham adruhā devāḥ sīdantu yajñiyāḥ /
analyzed: ā vām upastham adruhā devāḥ sīdantu yajñiyāḥ
translated: May the gods who bring no harm sit on your lap, O you who are to be worshipped.

original: ihādya somapītaye //🔽kanikradaj januṣam prabruvāṇa iyarti vācam ariteva nāvam /
analyzed: iha adya soma pītaye  kanikradat januṣam prabruvāṇaḥ iyarti vācam aritā iva nāvam
translated: Here today for the drinking of Soma.🔽Cawing, proclaiming your birth, you set the voice in motion like a boat in the water.

original: sumaṅgalaś ca śakune bhavāsi mā tvā kā cid abhibhā viśvyā vidat //
analyzed: su maṅgalaḥ ca śakune bhavāsi mā tvā kā cit abhibhā viśvyā vidat
translated: You are a bird of good omen, may no one, no one at all, overcome you.

original: mā tvā śyena ud vadhīn mā suparṇo mā tvā vidad iṣumān vīro astā /🔽pitryām anu pradiśaṃ kanikradat sumaṅgalo bhadravādī vadeha //
analyzed: mā tvā śyenaḥ ud vadhīt mā suparṇaḥ mā tvā vidat iṣumān vīraḥ astā  pitryām anu pradiśam kanikradat su maṅgalaḥ bhadra vādī vada iha
translated: May the falcon not kill you, may the eagle not seize you, may no hero with a weapon find you.🔽Cawing in the direction of the ancestral (mansion), be a bird of good omen, speak what is auspicious.

original: ava kranda dakṣiṇato gṛhāṇāṃ sumaṅgalo bhadravādī śakunte /
analyzed: ava kranda dakṣiṇatas gṛhāṇām su maṅgalaḥ bhadra vādī śakunte
translated: Cawing, come down to the right of the houses, O bird of good omen, speak what is auspicious.

original: mā na stena īśata māghaśaṃso bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: mā naḥ stenaḥ īśata mā agha śaṃsaḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: Let no thief rule over us, let no slanderer. With great voice let us speak in the assembly, with brave sons.

original: pradakṣiṇid abhi gṛṇanti kāravo vayo vadanta ṛtuthā śakuntayaḥ /
analyzed: pradakṣiṇit abhi gṛṇanti kāravaḥ vayaḥ vadantaḥ ṛtuthā śakuntayaḥ
translated: The birds sing forth their songs, the Kāravas sing forth their songs, the birds sing forth their songs in due season.

original: ubhe vācau vadati sāmagā iva gāyatraṃ ca traiṣṭubhaṃ cānu rājati //
analyzed: ubhe vācau vadati sāma gāḥ iva gāyatram ca traiṣṭubham ca anu rājati
translated: He utters both voices as if chanting Sāman, and follows the Gāyatrī and Triṣṭubh meters.

original: udgāteva śakune sāma gāyasi brahmaputra iva savaneṣu śaṃsasi /🔽vṛṣeva vājī śiśumatīr apītyā sarvato naḥ śakune bhadram ā vada viśvato naḥ śakune puṇyam ā vada //🔽āvadaṃs tvaṃ śakune bhadram ā vada tūṣṇīm āsīnaḥ sumatiṃ cikiddhi naḥ /
analyzed: udgātā iva śakune sāma gāyasi brahma putraḥ iva savaneṣu śaṃsasi  vṛṣā iva vājī śiśumatīḥ apītya ā sarvatas naḥ śakune bhadram ā vada viśvatas naḥ śakune puṇyam ā vada  āvadan tvam śakune bhadram ā vada tūṣṇīm āsīnaḥ sumatim cikiddhi naḥ
translated: You sing the Sāman like a bird, you chant like a son of a Brahmin at the sacrifices.🔽You go to the young maidens like a strong bull. O bird, speak good to us from all sides, speak auspicious to us from all sides.🔽Speaking, O bird, speak good to us. Sitting silently, think of favor for us.

original: yad utpatan vadasi karkarir yathā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: yat utpatan vadasi karkariḥ yathā bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: When you fly up and speak like a crow, may we speak great things in the assembly with good heroes.
